Notes: Baloch prisoner sentenced to death who was executed after refusing intelligence officials' offer to assassinate government opponents abroad in exchange for freedom. He said 'I have lived with honor and manliness. If you want to execute me, do it, but I will never kill anyone to save myself.'
Taken from his school in Shiraz for interrogation a few days prior, his body was delivered to his family the next day. He was only 15 years old.
Patriotic teacher and monarchist supporter from Lorestan. Was fired from his job after supporting Reza Shah II, then arrested by Islamic Republic terrorists on 7th of Bahman.

Baloch citizen shot and killed by unknown armed individuals while traveling from Chabahar to Zahedan near Kahnook village in Iranegan district of Khash county at approximately 3:30 AM. Son of Abdel, married, resident of Zahedan.
Injured on 19 Dey 1404 in Shiraz and died on 14 Bahman
23-year-old Kurdish citizen from Islamabad-e Gharb (Shabad), student and English teacher, arrested by government forces on Sunday 12 Bahman with no information available about her fate
Arrested by security forces in Shahrekord. Cousin of Jamshid Mokhtari.

Gilaki citizen from Ramsar and father of an 8-year-old son. Shot with a Kalashnikov war bullet to the abdomen by Islamic Republic forces on January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1404) in front of the IRGC building in Ramsar during nationwide protests. Was severely injured and transferred to Ramsar hospital where he underwent several surgeries over several weeks. Despite medical efforts, his physical condition deteriorated and he died in the hospital.

Kurdish citizen and father of a newborn. Shot on January 9, 2026 during public protests in Rasht by military-security forces of the Islamic Republic. Severely wounded by three war bullets. After being hospitalized for 25 days in Porsina Hospital in Rasht, died on February 1 due to severity of injuries.

Physics student at University of Tabriz and editor-in-chief of the banned student publication 'Yol', arrested by security forces at his home on Sunday evening, February 1st, 2026. No information about his charges has been given to his family.

Lawyer and member of Hormozgan Bar Association, arrested by security forces on Sunday after being summoned to Bandar Abbas prosecutor's office. No information has been released about her detention location, legal status, or charges against her despite all follow-ups for official explanations being unsuccessful. Described as enforced disappearance of independent lawyers as deliberate effort to silence defenders of rights and law.
Shot with at least two bullets on Thursday, 18 Dey 1404 during protests in Astaneh, Gilan. Died two weeks later on Thursday, 2 Bahman after succumbing to his injuries.

Father of two children from Surak city in Mazandaran province. Was injured on Thursday January 8, 2026 during popular protests in Sari's Martyrs Square when government forces shot him directly with a live round that hit his leg. Died two weeks later on February 21, 2026 due to delayed hospital transfer and severe infection. Had avoided seeking timely medical treatment due to fear of arrest.

Shot with pellets by suppressive forces during protests on 18 Dey 1404 (January 8, 2026) in Isfahan while defending his wife Shirin. After being knocked down, several armed forces aimed their weapons at him and fired pellets consecutively, leaving over 200 pellets in his body and causing him to lose feeling in his legs immediately. He was left for dead by the attacking forces but survived initially. Despite being transferred to hospital and undergoing surgery with initial relative improvement, he eventually died on 11 Bahman 1404 due to the severity of injuries and complications from the numerous pellets. He had been transferred home from hospital before completing full treatment due to fear of being finished off or arrested. Radiological images showed many pellets had hit sensitive areas of his body. Married man.
Memorial record from Iran International, no specific circumstances provided

Father of family, arrested on 18 Dey during Iranian national revolution in Sadeghiyeh, killed with a coup de grâce shot after six days of torture in detention center of the Islamic Republic, family under severe pressure and forced silence
Died after arrest in Kerman city. His body was returned to his family on 10 Bahman. Bakhtiari ethnicity.

Baloch citizen who was severely beaten by unknown individuals. Found in critical condition on a Tehran street on Friday, January 29, 2026, and died after being taken to hospital. Forensic examination showed death was caused by severe blows to the head with a hard object. Evidence showed he had been severely beaten before death. Son of Ali Mohammad, from Mitgan village in Sarbaz county. Worked as a welder. Left his residence Thursday evening January 28 after receiving a phone call from someone claiming to need him 'for work'. Multiple signs of beating were observed on various parts of his body including head, abdomen, legs and genital areas during burial. Body was buried in his hometown of Sarbaz on Monday February 2, 2026.
Arrested in front of his business on Sarafrāzān Boulevard in Mashhad

18-year-old Baluch citizen, son of Abdolkarim, resident of Gazhak village in Delgan county. Shot and killed by unknown armed individuals around 2 AM while traveling by personal vehicle in Chahshoor village area. Died on the spot due to severity of injuries from multiple gunshot wounds. Attackers fled immediately after the shooting.

Shot in the throat while standing in front of his protein shop in Andisheh Phase 3 on 19 Dey. Was in a coma for 10 days before dying. Described as an athlete who was cheerful and full of life enthusiasm. Buried in his birthplace Qaemshahr.

19-year-old who disappeared on Friday 19 Dey, was returned to his family after 20 days on 9 Bahman with signs of torture on his body from Kahrizak. His body was buried in Behesht Zahra cemetery with his family and amid applause.
Shot with war bullet in the abdomen on Taleghani Street in Tehran, underwent bowel and stomach evacuation surgery at hospital, fell into coma, and died after 10 days

Mountain climber and nature lover who was violently arrested by security forces who stormed his personal residence on 8 Bahman 1404. He was arrested using violence and transferred to an unknown location. Despite family efforts, no information is available about potential charges, the arresting agency, or his detention location. There is complete silence about his condition after the violent arrest.

Eight-year-old child shot without justification by police forces in Taheruiyeh neighborhood while a police vehicle was pursuing a car suspected of carrying smuggled goods. The child was an innocent bystander who was hit by gunfire. After being taken to the hospital, police surrounded the hospital and prevented news and details of the incident from being published. The incident led to widespread anger among citizens.

17-year-old Lor child from Chaghakhor village in Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province, resident of Shahin Shahr Isfahan. Shot in the leg with a war bullet during popular protests by direct fire from government forces on Thursday 18 Dey 1404 (January 8, 2026). Was wounded and arrested, then died in custody. His body was returned to the family after 20 days of repeated follow-ups by the family. Body was buried on Friday 10 Bahman 1404 in his birthplace, Chaghakhor district.

Executed on charges of espionage for Israel. The judiciary claimed he conducted intelligence and operational activities for the Zionist regime including purchasing equipment needed by officers, moving vehicles in Isfahan and Lorestan provinces to prepare for Israeli sabotage of Defense Ministry missile facilities in an operation called 'Great Operation' that was discovered and neutralized by Intelligence Ministry agents in 1401 (2022-2023).
Shot with a war bullet on Behjouyi Street in Ardabil on 19 Dey, severely wounded and died after enduring injuries for several days

Doctor and architect shot with one bullet to the back/waist and one bullet to the head in Khane Isfahan neighborhood. Has two daughters. Died one week after being shot and was buried without notice in Shahinshahr, Isfahan.
18-year-old 12th grade science student at Hasheminejad 3 High School in Mashhad, arrested on 8 Bahman when security forces raided his home, whereabouts unknown since arrest

17-year-old Gilak child shot directly by Iranian regime forces at Sargol Square in Rasht while returning home from work around 8:30 PM. Hit in the head by sniper positioned on top of a building and severely wounded. Transferred to Aria Hospital but after four days in coma, security forces removed her body from hospital and transferred it to forensic medicine. Body was returned to family under heavy security pressure with commitments not to hold mourning ceremonies or post announcements. Family was forced to bury her at 11 PM in limited manner in villages around Fouman.

Shot at close range with pellet ammunition on January 10, 2026 (19 Dey). Remained in a coma from the time of shooting until death on January 26, 2026 (6 Bahman) due to severity of injuries. Born in village of Eskaneh near Arak.

Teacher and official education employee with master's degree in psychology. Shot directly with military bullet to the head on Thursday January 8, 2026 (18 Dey) in Marlik area. Bullet hit his brain causing severe injury. Was kept alive on life support for one full week in coma with very low consciousness at Shohada-ye Salamat Malard Hospital. IRGC forces prevented organ donation despite his organ donor card, stating those shot during protests cannot donate organs. Family was demanded approximately 2 billion tomans as 'bullet fee' after autopsy to determine weapon type. Died after one week without being allowed to donate organs despite being healthy and suitable for donation. Body was eventually returned to family and buried in Behesht-e Fatemeh cemetery in Qods city.

Teacher from Izeh arrested at her home at 5 AM on 6 Bahman 1404. No information about her condition has been provided since arrest. Described as having committed no crime and being arrested innocently.
Family member of Babak Alipour (prisoner sentenced to death), arrested along with other family members

Shot in the throat in Fardis on Thursday 18 Dey month. The bullet damaged his trachea, lungs, and spinal cord. After surgery and regaining consciousness in the hospital, he was unable to speak or move his legs. His eyes could not see due to the shotgun pellet injury. He ultimately died due to the severity of his injuries after nearly two weeks on 5 Bahman. He was a Lor from Malmir village, living in Fardis, Karaj. He was a mechanic who worked on heavy vehicles and was the father of a 2-year-old child. His hardworking hands were still black when he was on the hospital bed. His family was under pressure to have a quiet burial at 7 AM without putting up his photo anywhere.
Employee of Landa laboratory from Gorgan. Shot with war bullets by the regime on 18 Dey 1404 (January 8, 2026), wounded and died after one week of suffering severe injuries in hospital.
Shot with war bullets on 18 Dey in Tehran, taken to hospital and underwent surgery, but died on 6 Bahman. Originally from Sabzevar city.
Family member of Babak Alipour (prisoner sentenced to death), arrested along with other family members
Family member of Babak Alipour (prisoner sentenced to death), arrested along with other family members

Lor Bakhtiari citizen from Nanadgan village in Fereydan, Isfahan province. Shot and killed by Basij forces while alone in his barbershop on Felatori Street, Iman Boulevard in Isfahan. He was targeted with two pistol shots from close range. He had previously been identified by local Basij forces on 18 Dey month. Was unmarried and buried in his birthplace in Nanadgan village, Fereydan.
Became martyred on Mokhtari Street in Amiriyeh district of Tehran on Saturday night of the 20th. Witnessed describes seeing his eyes bulging out of their sockets in his final moments

Location of Death: Siahan border area, Sistan and Baluchestan
Notes: 16-year-old teenager shot by border guards with bullet hitting head area. Killed alongside 20-year-old Yasin Siahani in the Siahan border area during heightened alert status following nationwide protest suppression. Border guards were shooting without warning or identification at anyone seen near zero point of border. Both victims were local residents using the mountainous Siahan route between Bacheh-rahi and Esfandak for daily commute.

Location of Death: Siahan border area, Sistan and Baluchestan
Notes: Shot by border guards with bullet hitting head area. Killed alongside 16-year-old Nader Siahani in the Siahan border area during heightened alert status following nationwide protest suppression. Border guards were shooting without warning or identification at anyone seen near zero point of border. Both victims were local residents using the mountainous Siahan route between Bacheh-rahi and Esfandak for daily commute.

Arrested protester who contacted family from detention but was later executed without trial in warehouses through various methods including shooting, lethal injection, or fatal beating. Body was delivered to family at night with only parents present and only allowed to see his face before burial by security forces.
Shot directly by government suppressive forces during protests. Originally from Dezful, resident of Isfahan.
Mother of Sobhan Esmaeil Doost, approximately 60 years old, arrested early Saturday morning on 5 Bahman and transferred to Lakan prison in Rasht
Wounded on 19 Dey 1404 in Mashhad and died on 4 Bahman
17-year-old who was injured on 18 Dey 1404 in Bushehr and died on 3 Bahman. Born in 1372 Persian calendar.
Shot with pellets on the 18th, his kidneys and lungs were punctured, died on 4 Bahman. Father of three children. From Fasa.

14-year-old Kurdish child who was critically wounded during protests when government forces shot her directly with a war bullet that hit her pelvis area. After two weeks in a coma, she died due to severe injuries and inadequate medical care. She was an honor student at Setaregan School in Kermanshah. Her body was buried on Sunday 5 Bahman under pressure and threats from security agencies.
Injured on January 8, 2026 in Tehranpars, Tehran and died on January 23, 2026

19-year-old Baháʼí resident of Kerman arrested on Saturday evening 4 Bahman 1404 when security forces brutally raided her home without showing a warrant. House was searched before arrest. Arrest was part of widespread detention of Baháʼí citizens during protests. No information available about her since arrest.

33-year-old reportedly executed in Mashhad on 22 January, becoming one of the first protesters to be executed. Iran's judiciary denied his execution having taken place, stating that such a person had not even been detained

Third-term student of Iranian painting at Tabriz Art University, arrested from his residence near the university. His laptop, mobile phone, and personal belongings were confiscated. His whereabouts and condition remain unknown.

Left home at 3 AM after celebrating his birthday (2nd Bahman). His phone was in possession of security agencies. The next morning his body was found hanging in the house courtyard with his mouth covered by cloth and hands and feet tied. Forensic results have not been announced. Milad had said he was being followed.

Artist, photographer and potter arrested during security forces raid on his pottery workshop in Mashhad. The arresting agency and charges against this young Mashhadi artist are unknown. Possibly targeted due to Bahai faith as indicated by the Bahai hashtag in the post.

Shot on 18 Dey in Tehranpars, died on 23 Dey. Death certificate falsely listed cause as 'electrocution'. Identity confirmed through fingerprinting. 400 million demanded for body release. Body delivered in Kahrizak with split chest, bullet-wounded leg, and fresh blood. Father of a 15-year-old son.

Shot in the head with a war bullet in front of Gohardasht police station. Music teacher and tar/setar instructor, manager of 'Pazhvak Honar' music school. His body was missing for 7 days before being found mistakenly buried in place of another person at Behesht-e Sakineh. Body found with torn clothes and blood, face unrecognizable due to severe injuries, identified only through fingerprints. Father was pressured to not hold a ceremony and falsely claim Yaser was a Basij member, though he was an independent artist and musician.
Injured on 18 Dey 1404 in Mashhad, died on 21 Dey

39-year-old Mashhad resident and father of an eleven-year-old daughter. Shot by Khamenei's agents in front of Haft-e Tir police station in Mashhad on 18 Dey and died in hospital 3 days later. His Instagram page shows he was also a supporter of the Pahlavi family.

48-year-old resident of Babol and father, shot directly by suppressive forces during nationwide protests on 18 Dey (first day of Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi's call) in the city. A shotgun pellet hit his eye from close range, causing severe brain hemorrhage, and he died after three days in a coma.

Nurse at Imam Reza Hospital in Kermanshah, internal medicine ward. Shot by a sniper positioned in a tall building above Dr. Kaboli pharmacy near Housing Bank at the city four-way intersection (Doveqola) in Shaabad. He was targeted from behind. Taken home initially but after a few hours had to be transferred to hospital. Died after three days of resistance.
Citizen from Sirvan city residing in Ilam, kidnapped from his workplace by mercenaries of the Islamic Republic on 2 Bahman, no information available about his condition
Shot in the heart by security forces in Yazdanshahr, Najafabad, Isfahan

Baluch citizen who was severely wounded on 24 Dey 1404 during protests in Mashhad by shotgun pellets fired by military forces to the head, neck, chest and abdomen. He hid for 8 days out of fear of arrest and finally died on 1 Bahman.

22-year-old midwifery student and volleyball player, shot near Milad crossroads, Imamat Boulevard in Mashhad during the Shir-o-Khorshid revolution. Transferred to medical facility but died due to severity of injuries. Her mother was also injured during the incident. Family kept her name secret for a long time due to pressures and threats, and even her burial ceremony was held without public announcement.

20-year-old arrested on January 8, 2026 (18 Dey) in Punak area of Tehran, executed on January 21, 2026 (1 Bahman) in Evin prison. Family was not allowed to hold funeral ceremony. Executed on charges of moharebeh (enmity against God).
Died in Karaj in Dey 1404
Death occurred in Shahriar during Dey 1404

Baloch citizen killed by security and military forces. Former wushu champion, coach, referee and veteran in Sistan and Baluchistan province. Former political prisoner who was arrested in 2010 in Zahedan prison, sentenced to 20 years exile in Gachsaran prison for charges including 'moharebeh and corruption on earth', sent on leave in 2022 after serving over 12 years of prison and exile, and had been residing in Khajeh Mask village in Zahedan county after refusing to return to prison. Government media claimed he was killed in clashes on the outskirts of Zahedan and labeled him as a member of Ansar al-Furqan group, but the group officially denied any connection with him.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial

Shot from behind while joining protesters near Arash Hospital in Tehranpars. Had just returned from his mother's seventh-day memorial ceremony with his wife when he separated from her to join the protesters. Body was returned to family 4 days later.
Died in Kazerun during Dey 1404
Friend who passed away during the protests period, commemorated by Mansour Inanloo as someone irreplaceable
Died during Dey 1404 in Tehran
Killed in Jajarm city, described as being 'scattered/torn apart' (پرپر شدن), possibly never having their names mentioned anywhere

21-year-old Lor ethnic man, resident of Tehran and working, shot directly by terrorist Islamic Republic regime forces from less than 10 meters distance at Andarzgou intersection in Tehran. He was on the verge of marriage but the regime cut short his life story with bullets. Family is under pressure and silent.
Azerbaijani citizen from Takab city in West Azerbaijan province, killed by gunfire from government forces in Qaleh Hassan Khan, Tehran
Died in Dansfahan, Qazvin during Dey 1404

Wounded by shotgun pellet on January 8 in Golshahr, Karaj. After his arrest, he was taken to Qezel Hesar prison, and on January 20, his family was informed that they could retrieve his body from Behesht-e Sakineh cemetery.
Died in Eslamshahr during Dey 1404
Commemorated as fallen, referenced as an evergreen cypress that has fallen to the ground

Mother of two daughters, shot in the neck with a war bullet in Ghasemabad neighborhood of Tehran. Originally from Mazandaran, buried in Gaznak, Mazandaran.

Was a nurse who saved lives. Became brain dead and his body was donated for organ donation so his life continues in others' bodies. Described as a silent hero.
Died in Gohardasht area of Karaj

Shot with three war bullets from behind during protests on the evening of 19 Dey 1404 around 8 PM after leaving home to join street demonstrations called by the Prince. Owner of a carpentry workshop in Siah-sang industrial area and known designer in classic furniture production. Told his mother he was going to the streets for the future of his 12-year-old daughter and Iran's children, leaving his watch as a memento for his daughter
Baloch citizen killed during protests in Nowshahr, Mazandaran. Son of Abdolhamid, from Khajeh Mask village in Zahedan suburbs.
Death occurred in Sade, Isfahan during Dey 1404
Mentioned in commemorative tweet from Karaj

Killed by forces of the Islamic Republic in the Shahrak Madani neighborhood on Besat Boulevard in Hamedan. Described as a brave defender of Iran and devoted to the nation.

35-year-old nurse at Gardo Hospital in Arak who had moved to Ardabil a few months after marriage. Killed by direct gunshot by suppressive forces of the terrorist Islamic Republic regime. Her body was transferred to Arak for burial and was buried alongside Saeed Miri in section 39-B of Arak cemetery.

Turkmen ethnicity, from Aq Qala, targeted during bloody suppression of Iran's national uprising and sacrificed her life. Described as a young woman from among the people; young, hopeful and standing alongside freedom. The regime tried to bury her name in silence.
Was injured on 19 Dey 1404 in Chamgardan, Isfahan and died on 1 Bahman

Shot with a war bullet from behind near Mandegar Tower in Azimiyeh, Karaj. Mother of a 9-year-old son. After her killing, the regime forced her family under pressure to introduce her as a 'Basiji' and held a humiliating burial with forced presence of IRGC members. The regime attempted to misappropriate the blood of a defenseless woman.
Commemorated as deceased during protests

Former political prisoner and long-time civil activist from Mashhad, killed during Iran's national revolution. Shot by security forces while participating in unprecedented protests in Mashhad on Vakil Abad street. He was wearing an electronic ankle monitor used for controlling prisoners at the time. He was a political prisoner in the 1980s and had been repeatedly targeted by security forces and arrested in recent years. In 2011, he was arrested while trying to organize a commemoration for Ferdowsi in Mashhad and was held in solitary confinement for over seven months. Last summer he was arrested to serve a sentence of 3 years and 7 months. Mashhad Revolutionary Court had sentenced him for financially supporting families of political prisoners and charges of propaganda and action against the system. He was an associate of Hussein Barazandeh, a famous religious reformist from Mashhad who was kidnapped in Dey month 1373 (December 1994/January 1995) in Mashhad and killed as part of the political murders of intellectuals and dissidents by Intelligence Ministry forces.
Killed by security forces in Shahrak Andisheh district of Tehran
Shot with bullets in Isfahan. His birthday would have been on 10 Bahman (January 29).
Shot in the stomach by Islamic Republic terrorists. Originally from Tuyserkan, living in Mehrshahr, Karaj when killed.
Killed one day after his birthday. His family reached out to friends saying 'they killed my brother' but they don't know where to report it to keep his name alive.
Shot directly by government suppressive forces during people's protests

15-year-old girl targeted by direct gunfire in Gorgan and killed. Due to complete communications blackout in Iran, it was not possible to contact emergency services or get her to a hospital, and she died from the severity of her injuries. Security and police forces used weapons and war bullets and direct shooting at protesters with the intent to kill them.
Shot to the heart in Tehran's Shamsabad neighborhood. Was a psychologist and child rights activist.

Kurdish citizen from Sarkhzu village in Bojnord, motorcycle delivery worker, shot by military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during people's protests in Tehran. His burial ceremony was held in Bojnord.

Kurdish civil activist from Sardasht arrested by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces at his workplace located in Sharko Internet Cafe. All electronic equipment from his cafe was confiscated and no information about his fate is available.

Shot directly from behind by Islamic Republic suppression forces on Ghaem Magham Street in Malayer while unable to take cover quickly enough during security forces' shooting and dispersing of protesters. Witnesses reported she lacked sufficient speed to take shelter when security forces were firing at and dispersing protesters.

55-year-old retired education employee from Sangar, living in Karaj. Shot and killed along with his wife and child while inside their personal vehicle during peaceful protests. Government agents opened fire on their car. Bodies were transferred to Sangar and buried before 6 AM under strict security measures and compulsion by agents.
Shot in the head by criminals/authorities in such a way that she was not recognizable, and her mother identified this dear girl by the tattoo on her hand
Died in Dezful on 19 Dey 1404 during 2025-2026 Iranian protests
Shot in the throat in front of Tabarsi Shomali police station on Friday 19 Dey, was wounded and died a few days later in the hospital

Shot in the head with a bullet. Originally from Arak, married with two children. Family was forced to commit to holding burial in silence in Ebrahim-Abad village in Arak in exchange for receiving the body.

Shot directly in the head during protests. Security forces cut off his ear piercing before returning his body to family because their rules prohibit men from wearing earrings. Described as showing no mercy to his lifeless body.
Died in Marlik, Karaj area

Separated from family on 18 Dey in Nazi-abad area of Tehran. Family searched hospitals and prisons for 12 days. Body found among unidentified corpses at Kahrizak forensic medicine facility with a bullet wound to the chest. Was a vendor in Tehran bazaar.
Student, originally from Dezful, living in Isfahan, killed by direct gunfire from government suppression forces during people's protests
Lor ethnicity from Khorramabad, shot by suppression forces in Masouri neighborhood of the city and died

Car mechanic, 49 years old, married with children. Family found out on the night of the 19th that a war bullet had hit his side. Two agents were placed over him at Valiasr Hospital in Qaemshahr until he died from severe bleeding. Permission to bury was given with a commitment that he was a Basij member and had gone to the pharmacy to get medicine for his mother. He was a monarchist supporter from Dowatishah, resident of Mazandaran, buried in Imamzadeh Seyyed Mehdi, Mehdiabad, Arteh city.

Shot directly in the heart with a bullet while helping an injured person on Setareh Street in Parand. Was with his son who witnessed the killing. The governor contacted the family to come to their home and record a condolence message for Islamic Republic television, but the family refused entry and declared that this dear one's blood was spilled for the freedom of his people and they seek justice.
Committed suicide on 30 Dey (January 19th) after burying his young wife Shahla Kakaei, who was killed by gunshot

23-year-old futsal player and master's degree student in industrial engineering at Shahrood University of Technology, killed by Iran's security forces during nationwide protests. He was the goalkeeper for the university's futsal team and also practiced bodybuilding. Before his death, he wrote on Telegram: 'Even if only one of us remains, it is their duty to remain a narrator.'
Shot with three war bullets in the abdomen during protests in Amol on the evening of 19 Dey. Died several days later in hospital. From Buran village, Amol.
Football coach for Damash team, killed during protests in Tehranpars by direct gunshot to chest by government suppression forces, killed alongside his wife
Killed during protests in Islamabad-e Gharb (Shababad). Identity confirmed by Hengaw Organization for Human Rights as one of 14 confirmed fatalities.

Shot by Islamic Republic forces on January 8, 2026. Struck from behind by two bullets, one above the heart and the other in the side. Was taken by pickup truck to three different hospitals but none would admit him. Eventually brought to a clinic where his family was informed of his death on January 14. Body was transferred to Kahrizak Forensic Medical Centre and funeral was held on Tajik Blvd, Sabashahr.
Listed in Iran International memorial as a victim

Shot by sniper fire from Islamic Republic security forces. Killed by two sniper bullets from a building near the Education Department while participating in popular protests. Originally from Dehlaran village, family had moved to Shushtar because Mehdi was accepted into gifted students school. Was a part-time student who also repaired bicycles and motorcycles.
Killed during protests in Dezful as part of the freedom movement

Hit in the head with a baton during street suppression on January 18, returned home, developed brain hemorrhage hours later and died the next day on January 19. After his death, family kept his body in the village morgue but intelligence agents raided and seized the body, extorted 300 million tomans from the family and threatened them into silence before allowing burial only after applying pressure and obtaining commitments.
Shot directly by government suppression forces during people's protests
Shop owner in Islamshahr, killed in service to the homeland during protests
Judo champion and coach, martyred in Mobarakeh

21-year-old physical education student and footballer, shot by Islamic Republic forces during protests in the Imamat area of Mashhad. He was targeted with direct gunfire while returning home from work in the Seyedrazi area, was transferred to hospital but died from his injuries. Had professional football experience in second division beach football league and had recently been accepted to play in Karaj first division league.
Shot by security forces during protests in Phase 3 of Andisheh township. He was one of those commemorated in the protests in Tehran.

Shot with bullet on 18 Dey that entered from right side and exited from left side. After falling, was targeted again with pellets in thigh. Despite having injuries, fought against death for one day and night but died on the morning of 19 Dey.

Turkish citizen from Qazvin who was shot in the forehead with pellet gun by government suppression forces during protests on Thursday 18 Dey (January 8, 2026). He fell into a coma and died after eleven days. His body was buried in one of the villages around Qazvin.
Shot in the heart by regime forces. His last words were: 'I think I'm dying. Take care of yourself. I love you.'
Shot by suppression forces on Razi Street in Khorramabad
Shot with direct military fire in front of Emamiyeh police station in Mashhad
Shot directly to the head by Basij commander Davood Ghafouri, a resident of the same city. Killed on the night of 19 Dey. The entire city witnessed who killed their child.
Shot in the chest with war bullets by government forces on Friday evening. Security forces prevented his family from holding any public funeral or mourning ceremonies after his death.
20-year-old public administration student from Tabriz, living in Tehran. Shot directly by government suppression forces during people's protests in Sadeghiyeh.

Theater actress killed by direct gunshot from Islamic Republic agents during the Iranian National Revolution on Friday night in Nazi-Abad neighborhood of Tehran. Family was pressured and threatened by security agents to claim she died in a car accident after a secret burial
Shot directly in the head with a bullet in Narmak area of Tehran. Family wrote on funeral announcement that she was 'gifted to the homeland'
Shot on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026), taken to hospital where his condition was reportedly good and surgery was excellent, but died the next day on 19 Dey
Shot in the head and chest by suppressive forces during people's protests. Married with three children, originally from Ardabil, residing in Parand.
17-year-old from Marvdasht, shot by government forces during popular protests
Shot by suppression forces (security forces) in Tabriz

Shot by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Karaj. Was a 27-year-old player in Iran's women's football league, played for Tehran's 'Mehrgan Pardis' team, had previously played for 'Azarakhsh' and 'Saba' teams, and had been invited to Iran's national women's football training camps. She was also a professional mountaineer who had conquered Damavand and Elbrus peaks. Her body was returned to her family 3 days after her killing on Monday 22 Dey and she was buried in Islamshahr.

Killed along with her husband and child when Islamic Republic forces opened fire on their car during a peaceful protest in Karaj. She was a retired employee of the Social Security Organization from Karaj, originally from Sonqor. Their eldest son Davood survived despite being shot. Bodies were transferred to Sonqor and buried before 6 AM under heightened security.

19-year-old from Malek Shahr who participated in protests on 18-19 Dey month. After participating in protests, he received threatening calls from security agencies. On 28 Dey month, while working as a Snapp driver, he was kidnapped by unknown individuals in Shahin Shahr area. Local sources say he died after being injected with a toxic substance following his abduction. His body was found hours later on the side of a street in Shahin Shahr. His family has been threatened by security forces to remain silent about his death.

Shot by security forces in Shahriar on Thursday January 8, 2026, hit by bullet in the back/waist area. After being transferred to hospital by security forces, he died on January 18, 2026. His physical condition after being shot was severely critical and widespread infection in the body, along with punctured lung, were declared as the main causes of death. Funeral held under strict security measures with plainclothes forces present among people, preventing public ceremony. Buried in Behesht-e Rezvan cemetery in Shahriar.
Kurdish citizen killed during popular protests in the provinces of Ilam, Tehran, Alborz, Markazi, Kermanshah and Isfahan
Shot in the forehead with live ammunition by IR armed suppressive forces during protests and died from her injuries

Disappeared on the night of 19 Dey 1404 while trying to deliver medical supplies to injured protesters in the Baharestan area of Isfahan following protest calls. After 10 days of uncertainty and contradictory information from authorities, his lifeless body was delivered to his family under strict security measures with threats. Burial ceremony was held under security surveillance with plainclothes agents present to expedite burial and prevent gatherings. Had recently obtained a crane driving license and planned to work officially.

Shot by Islamic Republic security forces during national uprising on January 9th. Shot twice in the neck while rushing to help his brother Hamid who had been wounded. Fell into a coma and passed away in hospital on January 17th. Entrepreneur brother and well-known figure in Iran's furniture industry. Father of three young children. Security agencies demanded 1.5 billion tomans from family to release body and forced them to sign a pledge declaring cause of death as stroke.
Arrested on 26th Dey at his workplace in Shahin Shahr, Isfahan. No news has been received since the arrest. Family has been severely threatened and intimidated into silence.

Promising footballer for Tehran's Delvar Afraz youth team, fatally shot by security forces during protests. Authorities enforced media blackout, fabricated a case against him, forced his family to falsely claim he was a Basij member for body release, and threatened them into silence.

Wrote a critical letter to Khamenei on January 7, 2026. His lifeless body was found beside a roadway in Marivan, Kurdistan province on January 16, 2026. His hands and feet were reportedly broken and signs of torture and beatings were visible throughout his body.

Shot in the throat by regime suppressive forces directly in front of his workplace at Nagin Shopping Center, Phase 3 Andisheh, after closing his shop on the evening of 19 Dey 1404. He immediately fell into a coma and after several days of struggling with death, died on 27 Dey. His body was buried in his birthplace Qaem-shahr. He was a young man full of hope and dreams, and his only 'crime' was being present on the street during the national uprising of the Iranian people.

Kurdish citizen who was shot by government forces during popular protests in Khorramabad. He was hit by a direct bullet while on the balcony of his house on Razi Street. He was initially wounded and later died in the hospital. His body was buried in the cemetery of Ivandreh village in Kakaraza district.
Injured on 19 Dey 1404 in Isfahan, died on 26 Dey from his injuries

Father killed by the Islamic Republic regime, leaving behind a young child who doesn't understand death and asks his mother to go to God to wake up his father. He sacrificed his life for the path of freedom.
Shot on Friday, 19 Dey 1404 in Anzali (Naser Khosrow area) and died the following Wednesday. Authorities did not allow burial in Anzali, so he was buried in Ramsar instead.

Kurdish citizen who fell into a coma after being shot with bullets and receiving multiple baton blows to the head during protests. Died after one week. Initially wounded on Thursday 18 Dey by government forces through shooting with war bullets and baton strikes. Body was buried on Friday 26 Dey.

Last seen on 18 Dey (January 8) around 9:30 PM at Coca-Cola intersection. Body was returned 6 days later on 24 Dey. Killed by gunshot at close range to his face. Born 23 Bahman 1372. Had tried to emigrate but decided to stay in Iran and build his life there.

Shot in the head with a bullet in Tehranpars. Family had no information about their children for six days, then were contacted on 25 Dey to come to the forensic medicine office for identification where they found Milad's body. He had a twin sister.

Transgender woman who fell from a motorcycle at Hasht Behesht intersection. Found with head bleeding, taken to Asgarieh Hospital where she died. Body was transferred to Bagh Rezvan cemetery. Family received the body on Friday and burial took place on Sunday January 16 in Gashnizjan village, Isfahan. A memorial service was held at a local mosque on Monday January 18.
Injured on January 8, 2026 on Ayatollah Kashani Street in Tehran, died 6 days later on January 14

Arrested on 18th Dey at Qale Hassan Khan, held in prison until 24th Dey where his brother visited him. Killed in prison on the evening of 24th Dey. Family was forced to claim he was a Basiji who died as a martyr. Only 3 people were allowed to attend his burial ceremony.

Abducted by regime's repressive forces and killed. Known for writing Mahsa Amini's name on a mountain during the Woman, Life, Freedom uprising's 40th day commemoration in 1401. Family was not allowed to bury him in Arak; his body was buried in the city of Astaneh.
Arrested on 18 Dey in Ariashahr, killed under torture on 23 Dey at the Prevention Security Police of Revolution Square Tehran

Shot by live ammunition (گلوله جنگی) while working in Tehran Bazaar. His body was released to family only after payment of 1.6 billion Tomans (~$24,000 USD). Funeral was held under tight security measures with only immediate family allowed. He had previously been wounded by pellet rounds during the 2022 protests.

Beaten with batons on Enqelab Street in Tehran on Thursday, 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) until his skull was shattered. Ambulance was prevented from reaching him. Was transported to Imam Khomeini Hospital by private car but died on 24 Dey (February 13, 2026).

28-year-old Gilaki citizen from Rasht living in Tehran, arrested by IRGC intelligence forces on Tuesday 23 Dey 1404. Security agents first stopped her on the street then followed her to her residence. After she entered her home, IRGC intelligence forces raided her family home, searched the premises and arrested her. No official information about her detention location, reasons for arrest, or physical and legal condition has been provided to the family.

Killed by Khamenei's murderers in Amol. His body was stolen and his family was forced under threats and intimidation to introduce him as a Basiji member. Everyone in Amol who knew Iliya knows he hated this regime.

Civil activist from Arak, arrested by IRGC intelligence on her way back from Tehran to Arak. No information available about her fate since arrest. Had been previously arrested months earlier due to her civil activities.
Kurdish Yarsan from Zardeh Dalahu, killed by direct shooting by military forces during popular protests

Shot and killed along with Hadi Ghanbarpour at a checkpoint 5 kilometers from Jonghan city. Their car was inspected at the checkpoint, and when they got back in to leave, they were shot from 5-10 meters away with dozens of war bullets. Aligholi was severely injured by dozens of bullets and pellets to his chest, head, neck, face and spinal cord. After being hospitalized for several days, he was abducted from the hospital at midnight by regime security forces accompanied by clerics. His body was returned to his family after he died. The regime attempted to present him as a 'martyr of the Islamic Republic' but this was rejected by the people of Jonghan.

Kurdish citizen shot directly at close range (0.5-1 meter distance) with at least 150 pellets in the right eye area during protests. Pellets penetrated his nerves, brain, neck arteries, and even lungs, completely destroying his face. Lost both eyes immediately and fell into a coma with consciousness level 3. Died after 5 days in coma at Shabad Hospital.

Shot and killed along with Aligholi Mokhtari at a checkpoint 5 kilometers from Jonghan city. Their car was inspected at the checkpoint, and when they got back in to leave, they were shot from 5-10 meters away with dozens of war bullets by IRGC suppression and intelligence forces. The regime attempted to present him as a 'martyr of the Islamic Republic' but this was rejected by the people of Jonghan. Both bodies were buried under strict security measures with families forced to give commitments not to publicize the matter.

33 years old, with associate degree in petrochemical industries, from Abadan. Shot by government forces during people's protests on 22 Dey 1404, targeted in the neck and leg area. Body has not been returned to family yet.

Shot with pellet gun by government forces at close range while helping an injured person at Sharifabad intersection in Shiraz. More than 80 pellets were extracted from his right kidney. The pellet hit his right kidney which had to be removed, he underwent surgery twice with part of his intestines also removed, and his left kidney failed. He was a truck driver who recently owned a spare parts shop. Family was not allowed to see the wound site, only his face, and his funeral was held under restrictions with four security forces present.

Kurdish blogger known online as 'Black Scorpion' (عقرب سیاه), arrested by government forces in the city of Lomar. No information available about his fate. Previously arrested during the 'Woman Life Freedom' movement.
Mother of a teenage daughter, arrested and killed by intelligence forces in Yaftabad area of Tehran

Shot in front of Basij base in Rudbar. Was the only son of his family, loved sports, and had opened a small mobile phone repair shop. His body was so tall that the coffin was too small and his legs stuck out. Authorities initially withheld his body and when they returned it, forced his family to claim it was the work of terrorists. Family was threatened that if they told the truth, his body would be stolen from the grave.

Shot with war bullets by government criminals in the liver and spleen area during Iran's national uprising on 18 Dey (2026-01-08). Severely injured and transferred to hospital. After 3 days of enduring pain and deprivation of safe medical care, died on the path to homeland freedom. Example of direct shooting, targeted killing and abandoning youth in death cycle.

Shot by forces of the Islamic Republic regime. According to his niece, he was shot directly while participating in protests. He was described as a healthy man who went to the mountains and was mindful of his diet, had 5 grandchildren, and was in the streets during the protests when he was killed.

20-year-old electronics student shot by regime mercenaries in the main blood artery in his leg near Nazi Abad, Tehran. Was taken to Amir al-Momenin Hospital which lacked sufficient equipment, then transferred to Shariati Hospital where surgery was performed, but he could not survive. Body buried in section 309 of Behesht Zahra cemetery.
Killed during protests in Rafsanjan, Kerman. Described as an unidentified/unnamed example case.

Shot with a war bullet during suppression of popular protests in Mehrshahr area of Karaj around 8:30 PM on Friday. According to eyewitness accounts, he was targeted in the abdomen area and the bullet exited through his back. Plainclothes agents had created tension among the crowd and thrown stones at shop shutters before security forces fired tear gas and threw grenades. At least two people were shot during the incident.
Arrested in Jannatabad, Tehran on 21 Dey, and there has been no news of him since then

3-year-old child who died from injuries sustained from direct gunfire by government suppressive forces during protests. Was hit by a bullet during clashes between government forces and protesters on January 9, 2026, was wounded and fell into a coma before dying. Body was buried on January 14, 2026 in the cemetery of Shadab village in Neyshabur. Government institutions blamed protesters for her death.

Medical student at Qazvin University of Medical Sciences. Shot with three war bullets by security forces. First bullet hit her abdomen, second bullet hit her heart, third bullet hit her abdomen again. Three security agents stood over her preventing anyone from helping her. Her body was found covered in blood. Security forces confiscated the surveillance video. Family was forced to pay 600 million tomans (200 million per bullet) to receive her body after 6 days. Forced to claim she died in a terrorist attack. Not allowed to bury her in her hometown Takestan, buried in Qazvin without public attendance.

Baloch citizen shot directly in the neck by government forces during popular protests in Neyshabur. Suffered severe spinal cord injury and spinal cord severance. Died after three days in ICU. Body was returned to family after three days for 300 million tomans.
Citizen of Talesh from Makelovan area of Fouman, worked as tire seller in Tehran, shot directly by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran in Nezam-Abad area of Tehran

Shot directly by suppression forces on Ponak Street in Tehran during the Iranian National Revolution. Originally from Chhregh village in Salmas county, West Azerbaijan province, and resident of Patavir village, but had come to Tehran for work. Was in very difficult financial situation and worked as a Snap driver to support his family, sending part of his income to them. Was the breadwinner of his family and in the last year due to increased rents, couldn't even afford to rent a house and slept in his car at nights.
Construction worker (gypsum worker). Killed in Shiraz, Adelabad neighborhood, Qahramanan Square. Funeral was held only with close family members and security presence.
Died in Baharestan, Isfahan

Shot with bullets in the Zia Abri area of Rasht city. After his death, security agencies prevented any public ceremonies for him. His family was pressured and forced to sign a written commitment to introduce his body as a 'Basiji'. His body was buried in the Nasirolmahalle mosque in Shaft without public ceremonies. He was a 52-year-old Gilak citizen from Shaft.
Died during protests in Ghaleh Seid, Dezful in Dey 1404. Born in 1370 Persian calendar

Shot by Islamic Republic security forces during national uprising on January 9th. Critically wounded by bullet to the head and fell into a coma. Died on January 11th after being unconscious. Entrepreneur brother and well-known figure in Iran's furniture industry. Father of two children. Security agencies demanded 1.5 billion tomans from family to release body and forced them to sign a pledge declaring cause of death as stroke.

Shot from behind with a war bullet during Islamic Republic forces' suppression in Arak city. Originally from Khomein district. His body was buried on Sunday 21 Dey in his birthplace Khomein under severe security conditions.
Arrested along with Peyman Momeni for supporting people and calls on their work page, sentenced to death
Killed during protests in Tehran. Worked at a car showroom in Abbas Abad, Tehran.

Gilan citizen from Shaft, residing in Rasht. Shot by Iranian government forces in the Razi roundabout area of Rasht while inside his vehicle. The bullet hit his forehead area. His body was buried on 21 Dey 1404 (January 11, 2026) with heavy presence of intelligence forces at around 12:30 AM in Osmavoandan village.
Shot with bullets while traveling by motorcycle with his close friend Mohammadamin Khatem. The two young men were intimate friends who were targeted while in transit and lost their lives.
Died in Khorramabad on 21 Dey 1404
Shot with two bullets on Friday 19 Dey in Fardis, Karaj. Transferred to hospital and died after 3 days of hospitalization and several surgeries on Monday 22 Dey
Shot with a bullet in her car in front of her sister. Genetics elite from University of Tehran. Was planning to go to Canada in Ordibehesht. Body was taken and found 3 days later in Kahrizak
Arrested along with Maedeh Daneshmand for supporting people and calls on their work page, sentenced to death
Buried on 21 Dey, birthday was 22 Dey, died at approximately 20 years old
Killed during popular protests, identified as one of the victims by Hengaw Organization for Human Rights
Died in Gonabad during the protests

Gilaki citizen from Bandar Anzali, arrested by security forces in Rasht on 19 Dey 1404. Released after two days of detention with extensive bruising throughout her body. Hours after release, her physical condition deteriorated with severe nausea. She died while her family was attempting to transport her to Bandar Anzali hospital.
Arrested at 3:30 a.m. in her personal residence. Doctor who was helping injured Iranians. Family has no information about her whereabouts or safety.

Shot by IRGC forces on Basirat Street in Foulad Shahr, Isfahan at 8:30 PM while alone. Motorcyclist approached him, he sat on the ground and put his hood over his head pleading not to be beaten. They placed a gun on his back and fired pellets/buckshot, with a scatter pattern that resulted in 50 pellets entering his body, penetrating his spinal cord and heart. Died instantly from bleeding. Body delivered to family on the 26th and buried under security measures.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial

Turkish citizen, resident of Ramsar, killed by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces while driving. He encountered a security checkpoint, failed to stop when ordered, and his vehicle was shot at with gunfire, resulting in his death. The city of Ramsar was under heavy security control at the time of the incident.

Shot by suppression forces on Friday January 9, 2026 with two bullets - one in the thigh and one in the stomach. Died two days later on January 11, 2026 at Imam Hussein Hospital in Tehran. Described as a freedom-loving woman whose name and photo had not appeared in any lists, prompting calls to preserve her memory.
37-year-old resident of Shahreza, shot by direct fire from government forces during popular protests on 19 Dey 1404
47-year-old worker, father's name Mir Ali, company worker/supervisor of two children and elderly mother, died during the early hours of the call on the eighteenth (18 Dey)
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Tehran
Shot directly by government suppressive forces while on foot during people's protests in Nazi-Abad, Behesht Square

Shot by suppressor forces on Darvish Street in Isfahan. His relatives kept his body at home under ice and the next day secretly took him to his father's village 'Dork Shahpouri village' and buried him there
Listed in Iran International Memorial

Gilak citizen from Chaboksar, born in 1361 (1982), father of a 17-year-old son and 13-year-old daughter. Shot in the back with war bullets by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during popular protests in Chaboksar on 19 Dey 1404 (January 8, 2026). After enduring severe injuries for several days, he died on 28 Dey 1404

Shot during popular protests on 19 Dey 1404 in Isfahan by direct fire from security forces. He was hit by two bullets from behind on Zeinabiyeh Street and was transferred to Gharzi Hospital where he died due to severe injuries and punctured lung. He had been married for less than two years.
17-year-old Armenian teenager killed by regime suppression forces. Described as an unarmed teenager, part of targeted and deliberate killing to intimidate the Iranian people.

Shot with war bullets while returning from work on the evening of his birthday. Initially wounded by gunshot to the thigh area, then killed by security forces with finishing shots. Father of a 4-year-old daughter. Security forces used war bullets against protesters who had no weapons and showed no signs of armed conflict.
Father of two children, shot by Islamic Republic forces in front of the governor's office in Homayounshahr (Khomaini-shahr) during the Iranian national revolution

26-year-old law graduate student from Mahmoudabad, Mazandaran. During the national revolution, he suffered severe injuries after body search and beating with batons. He was transferred to hospital but died due to the severity of his injuries. Family was forced to hold funeral and mourning ceremonies in a limited, private manner due to security pressures.

Shot with a bullet to the temple area. Left home alone around 6:30-7 PM on Friday evening before any protest calls, never returned. Family searched hospitals, detention centers and streets for days. Body was found bloodied and later washed for identification at Behesht Reza cemetery in Mashhad. After his killing, authorities pressured family to present him as a 'Basiji' member, which family refused. Death was ultimately registered as an 'accident' to cover up the crime. Described as a cheerful, harmless, and jovial person who had never even seen the inside of a detention center and was not one to cause trouble at his age.

Father of two children aged 7 and 10, shot by security forces in Saba Shahr, Shahriar around 9 PM near Melli Bank and Taleghani Street. Bullet hit his chest area. After being shot, friends took him near his home. While his family was trying to get him to hospital, he died in his father's arms.
Died in Malekshahr, Isfahan

Shot during peaceful protest in Andisheh Township, Phase 3, Ferdowsi Street near Rudaki intersection. Direct gunfire from behind and from an unknown location hit his back and side around 8:20 PM while he was attending a protest gathering with his daughter. Despite severe bleeding and pain, he remained conscious and speaking. He was transported to hospital by his daughter and several young people but died after approximately two hours due to severe blood loss. His body was transferred to Kahrizak and identified by his son and close relatives among thousands of bodies two days later. Buried in Behesht Zahra cemetery.
Graduate student at Arak University of Technology, shot by regime suppression forces during protests in Tehran (Narmak area)

Shot in Kerman. Was a hardworking man, eldest child with a younger sibling, originally from Goshk-e Sofla village in Baft but lived in Kerman. Was a sign maker in Kerman and had recently become a loader driver at Gol-e Gohar mine in Sirjan. Left the mine because his income didn't cover his expenses and he was helping with his father's expenses. Had come back to Kerman to start a shop.

25-year-old microbiology graduate student at Ferdowsi University of Mashhad. Two accounts exist of his death: first account suggests he was killed on the night of 20 Dey month with body returned to family after ten days; second account indicates he was first arrested and after about a week his family was called to collect his body
Died in Isfahan during the protests

Shot directly by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic in Ahmadabad area. He was a merchant and bazaari from Mashhad who owned a men's clothing store. He was married and his wife was seven months pregnant at the time of his death. After his killing, his family kept his body at his father's house for a period to prevent it from being taken by security forces. His burial ceremony was eventually held in Behesht-e Reza cemetery in Mashhad, block 48, row 21.

Shot during popular protests, killed by direct gunfire from IRGC forces. He was a 24-year-old Gilaki citizen from Manjil, Gilan province. He was the only child of his family, known as an athlete and footballer with a bachelor's degree. He had a serious interest in sports, especially football and basketball, was a Persepolis fan, and dreamed of playing at the highest level of professional football. He had recently been deployed as a soldier to the naval base in Manjil but had left the barracks during the protest days to join the street demonstrations.
Shot directly in the stomach area during protests in Fardis, Karaj. Killed for standing with the people and Iran's national uprising.

Turkmen citizen of Gonbad-e Kavus, shot directly by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces on Sarabi Street during protests in the city. His body was delivered to the family after several days at 6 AM. Before the body was delivered, the family was repeatedly threatened by security institutions to 'not make trouble'. Two security agents accompanied and controlled the family inside the morgue. The body was transferred directly to the cemetery and the family only had a few seconds to see his body. The burial ceremony was conducted without public rituals and under security pressures at Gonbad-e Kavus cemetery.
Shot directly in the chest by security forces, died from internal bleeding

22-year-old champion athlete in Kyokushin karate, member of Iran's national team (2022), participant in Asian championships in Kazakhstan, official Kyokushin karate referee. Shot in the heart with a war bullet by Islamic Republic suppression forces at 9:30 PM while trying to save an injured person in Sirjan city.

Artesh First Lieutenant shot and killed 'while on mission' in Khavaran neighbourhood, eastern Tehran. Iranian state media reported his death and US-based human rights activists acknowledged his death on 20 January.

Orphan raised by grandmother with worker's wages, shot directly by security forces near the police station in Rostamkola, Behshahr County, Mazandaran Province. Body returned to family after several days with severe restrictions

Shot with 3 military bullets in hand and stomach during protests in Nazi Abad, Tehran on the night of 18 Dey. Died at 7 AM the next morning (Friday) at Pakdasht Hospital. Husband and father of a 4-year-old daughter. Orphaned from childhood, grew up without parents.

Killed by the Islamic Republic regime. The text describes the systematic crimes of the regime against defenseless people, with his mother sleeping while holding his photo frame every night, representing the grief imposed by the regime on families.
Shot in the eye with a bullet. Originally from Tuyserkan, killed in Eslamshahr, Tehran.

13-year-old child from Norabad Delfan, shot in the back with a war bullet by military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Qaemiyeh neighborhood, Eslamshahr, Tehran province. Security institutions pressured the family to introduce him as a Basij member in exchange for handing over the body, but the family refused this demand. His body was handed over to the family after four days and payment of one billion tomans, and was buried under pressure from security institutions in Dehshad cemetery
Shot directly in the heart by government suppressive forces during people's protests. He was an Iran-Iraq war veteran who had participated in defending Iranian territory.

16-year-old teenager shot with live ammunition in the upper chest/heart area outside Jaber Ansari Street metro station in Isfahan. He was severely wounded and died after being transferred to Dr. Gharazi Hospital in Isfahan. His body was returned to his family about a week later. Shot directly with war weapons targeting vital areas of the body including head and heart by security forces, demonstrating clear intent to kill.
Shot with a barrage of bullets while inside his personal vehicle around midnight. Gilak citizen from Khoshkbijar. Killed on the spot due to severity of injuries.

Graduate student in IT at Azad University Tehran, killed by suppressive forces with multiple pellet shots and knife wounds; combination of bullets and blade used to deliberately kill an educated young man

Shot in the heart during protests. On the night of 18 Dey, he came home with pellet marks on his clothes and his mother asked him not to go to the streets anymore, but Amirali went out again on Friday night and his body was delivered to his mother with a bullet wound to his heart.
Victim memorialized in Iran International database, location specified as Nazi Abad in Seraj Square area of Tehran
Death occurred in Isfahan
Shot by regime suppression forces during protests. Young man from Razgardan village near Arak.

19-year-old physical education student shot and killed by Islamic Republic forces in Sayghalan Square in Rasht. He had joined street protests following a call by Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi. Shot from behind in the head area and died before being transported to medical center. His body was handed over to his family three days later, and his burial ceremony was held under security conditions at 10 PM. Family was asked to refrain from holding any public ceremonies or publicizing the incident.

Born April 6, 1997 (16 Farvardin 1376). Had an associate degree in management and worked at his father's cookery. Shot in the head with a war bullet while protecting his mother and two sisters during protests. He had taken them to a side alley when security and military forces began direct shooting at people. When he looked out to see if officers were following them, he was shot in the head. Died in the arms of his mother and two sisters. Family was forced to pay one billion tomans to retrieve his body.

Shot in the throat while with friends in Fardis, Karaj. Taken to hospital but was not admitted due to lack of capacity and died while being transferred to another hospital. Originally from west Tehran.
Victim documented in Iran International memorial

50-year-old athlete, mountaineer, and fitness coach from Esfahan, devoted mother to her 19-year-old son and 25-year-old daughter, gunned down with a direct shot to the head, dying in her son's arms on Bagh-e Daryacheh Street

Shot with three bullets by the Islamic regime. He was only 20 years old and his only weapon was chanting against the regime. In his last messages he was hopeful that more people would come out the next day and fight for their freedom.

Shot with a war bullet in Elahiyeh neighborhood of Kermanshah on 19 Dey. Family was severely pressured and threatened not to speak about it. No ceremonies were allowed at home or during burial. The mosque mentioned for the ceremony was filled with plainclothes security forces. Funeral announcements were immediately torn down from walls.

Shot in the throat in front of his house in Fooladshahr. Originally from Ramhormoz. His body remained in his mother's arms until morning when authorities took it. Authorities demanded one billion in ransom for the body and said the family must declare he was a Basiji member.

Well-known farmer in Torbat-e Jam, father of four children with one grandchild, shot directly from behind in the head by Islamic Republic forces. Security agencies later contacted his family calling it 'human error' and offered to declare him a 'martyr' but family rejected this. Part of wider suppression in Torbat-e Jam where over 100 people were killed including children, with direct shooting at unarmed citizens in the streets.
Targeted during bloody suppression in Shahrak Andisheh, sacrificed her life on the path to freedom for the homeland. Described as one of the faces of the national uprising.

Shot by security forces while witnessing the beating and killing of 2 young men. Security forces first shot the 2 young men, then fired at Azra Bahadori's house to prevent recording. Bullet hit her artery and she died instantly.
Shot in the carotid artery after opening her home to help two young people who were being beaten to death by security forces. Mother of two children aged 8 and 16.
Shot with war bullets by mercenaries and terrorists of the Islamic Republic. Originally from Hamadan, had two young children.
Shot with bullets (شلیک گلوله). Family was unable to publish his photo and information publicly, and there is no mention of his name anywhere.
Killed by Khamenei's mercenaries during protests. Was from a good financial background but cared about his people who lived in poverty. Sacrificed his life for the freedom of the homeland.
From Baharestan area of Isfahan, commemorated as martyr (javidnam) during 2025-2026 protests
Shot on Saheb-Zaman street during national uprising. Was from the Yarsan religious minority community from Qaleh Hassan Khan.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial
Died in Isfahan during the protests
48-year-old man from Mashhad. Located on Emamaat Boulevard in Razavi Khorasan province.
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Arak
Shot in the heart with a war bullet by the Islamic Republic regime in Khomeini Square in Malayer. Family was forced to pay 400 million [tomans/rials] to retrieve his body.
Baloch citizen killed during protests in Bandar Abbas. From the Chatri tribe, son of Hassan, had a 3-year-old daughter, originally from Anbarabad (Kerman province). Buried on 22 Dey in Anbarabad.

Shot directly in the heart with a bullet on Ahmadabad Street in Mashhad. She was a married mother of a 5-year-old child. Her body was buried several days after her killing at Behesht-e Reza cemetery in Mashhad, around the time of her birthday anniversary.
Shot with direct bullet to the heart area by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government during protests. Gilaki citizen from Lashtnesha.
Mother with a five-year-old child who was taken/arrested and subsequently disappeared with no news or explanation since

Shot directly with war bullets by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic during suppression of popular protests. His body was targeted with war bullets and at least 12 pellets were observed in his head area

Her body was transported to northern Iran for burial under intense security pressure with very limited attendees. The mosque door was not allowed to be opened for her ceremony, despite her previous extensive financial contributions to that mosque. Her body showed suspicious conditions - her abdomen was completely cut and stitched, but no signs of stitching or repair were visible at the bullet impact site, raising serious doubts about possible unauthorized organ removal.

Died after his body was found following a six-day search. Shot by Islamic Republic regime agents in Hesarak neighborhood of Tehran. Was planning to get married and start married life with his wife. His grieving sister's page was shut down under Islamic Republic pressure after she posted stories about him.

Shot in the head on Chahal Va Panj Metri street in Dezful next to an underpass. Shot directly with a war bullet in the throat. Family searched for his body for a week among corpses at Gharazi Hospital. When found, his gold necklace had been removed from his neck and stolen. Buried on 25 Dey beside his mother.

Killed by regime's suppressive forces during national uprising. Targeted with deadly violence for the crime of standing with the people and accompanying Iran's national uprising.

Shot with three bullets by Islamic Republic regime suppression forces in Ghasemabad area of Mashhad during Dey month protests as part of the Shir-o-Khorshid Revolution. Described as 'martyr of the homeland path'. Had previously defeated cancer several years ago.

Shot with pellet gun by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic regime on Jaber Ansari Street in Isfahan. Multiple pellets hit her waist and heart area, and she died on the spot. Mother of a 7-year-old daughter, shot by suppression forces during protests in Nurabad Mamasani. Her body was returned to the family after several days under security conditions, including restrictions on who could perform the ritual washing, burial in early morning hours, and prohibition on chanting by relatives. Multiple bullets were found in her body, including a shot to the heart that evidence suggests occurred after her phone call.
Shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppressors during protests. Was a gifted student and 5th semester medical student at Mashhad University of Medical Sciences.

15-year-old child from Isfahan, shot at close range with a Kalashnikov rifle with direct fire to the heart area by suppressive forces of the terrorist regime of the Islamic Republic during the national uprising in the Se-rahe Simin neighborhood of Isfahan. Killed instantly.

Shopkeeper from Shapour Jadid Isfahan area. Born in 1954 (Persian calendar year 54 likely refers to 1375/1996, but given context of being a shopkeeper, more likely refers to 1954 Gregorian or 1333 Persian = 1954). Commemorated as 'child of Iran, life-giver for the homeland'

17-year-old student from Shushtar, killed by direct gunshot to the head from close range during popular protests. Shot with live ammunition by plainclothes forces during protests in Yaftabad neighborhood around 11 PM. Shot from behind with war bullets while protests were being suppressed. Attackers were plainclothes but used a Samand car with IRGC insignia.

20-year-old Lor protester shot by Islamic Republic suppression forces with bullets hitting both legs, died from severe bleeding around 11 PM on Khalij 18 street in Sarabtaveh area of Yasuj. Body buried in Sepidar cemetery in Yasuj suburbs.

Shot directly in the head by a sniper with war bullets during popular protests in front of the 8th police station in Gohardasht. Shot by government agents. Family was under security pressure when they received her body and were forced to commit to not publicize the matter and not hold any ceremony. Buried in Behesht-e Sakineh cemetery in Karaj.

37-year-old accountant and technology park employee from Shiraz, living in Tehran. Shot directly by government suppression forces in front of his wife's eyes during protests. His body was returned to the family three days later and buried in Damavand.

Buried in silence and media blackout in his hometown of Sahneh, Kermanshah, three days after death, with family under pressure and threats. Cousin of the tweet author

Shot by IRGC forces with three types of weapons (shotgun, Kalashnikov, and Dushka) while returning home after dropping off a friend in Baharestan Isfahan, around Baharestan Square. He fought for 8 hours in his own blood before being transferred to Al-Zahra Hospital Isfahan where he died from severe injuries. He was a mechanical engineer, motorcycle courier, owner of a simple Pride car, and family breadwinner who was saving money to buy a house for his family.

Singer, musician, and talented artist who changed his name from Mohammad to Shahoo a year ago. Shot with two bullets to his heart by repressive forces of the Islamic Republic. Shot by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic security forces during Iran's national uprising in Baharestan, Isfahan. Killed during protests on 20 Dey 1404. Sister contacted source noting his photo was not included among other commemorated victims.

Killed during protests in the coastal city of Chaf in Langarud County. Mother of two children. Shot with pellet bullets from behind during popular protests in Fooladshahr, Isfahan at 8:30 PM. Died due to internal bleeding. Body was delivered to family on 26 Dey and buried under security measures.

22-year-old final-year software engineering student shot directly from behind by Islamic Republic forces in Tehranpars area of Tehran. Family found his body among other corpses after five days of searching. He was also a guitarist and athlete alongside his studies.

17-year-old from Tehran who was shot and killed by direct gunfire from war bullets on the night of the 19th on Zakaria Razi street in Shahr-e Rey. 33-year-old Kurdish man from Karzan in Ilam Province who was shot with shotgun pellets by security forces on Friday, 19 Dey 1404, during public protests. He is the breadwinner of his family and a simple worker. After 17 days from the injury, he still sees only darkness and general doctors have given up hope for treating his eyes. His family had to sell their sheep, which were their main source of income, to travel to Tehran and seek specialist medical opinion.
