Death occurred in Shahrood
22-year-old computer engineering student at Birjand University of Technology, from Esfarayen, shot by Islamic Republic suppressors in the evening
Shot with war bullets by suppression forces during Isfahan protests on January 8, 2026. Despite 11 surgeries and 8 cardiac resuscitations and leg amputation, he died at Al-Zahra Hospital in Isfahan

27-year-old metallurgical engineer and violinist, targeted by direct suppression forces of the Islamic Republic terrorist regime in Haft-Howz Square in Tehran during Iran's national uprising. Described as an educated daughter of this land with science, art and dreams, who was taken from us for the crime of standing with the people.
Killed in Saadat Shahr. Family is under pressure and no photos or names have been released about him.

Voice actor and film and theater artist from Isfahan, assistant director, member of the Glory Dubbing Group and the Tehran Dubbing Association, presenter and assistant director. Shot in the throat by the repressive forces of the Islamic Republic regime during protests in the city. Security institutions attempted to distort the cause of her death by claiming it was due to cardiac arrest, contradicting eyewitness accounts. Her last project was a film titled 'A Bridge Over a Dry River' where she worked as script supervisor, selected for the Tajikistan International Film Festival.
Died in Malak-Shahr district of Isfahan. Also known as Hassan Akbrpor.

Shot directly by Karimian, former head of Sadeh Lenjan police station. Bullet hit under his armpit, entered his lung causing severe internal bleeding. He was unarmed at the time and had tried to prevent violence through dialogue, saying 'Come down, we have no business with you' to the police station chief. During the protests, he had been helping others and saving wounded protesters without protective equipment despite the danger of gunfire, successfully saving several lives from direct danger.
Listed in Iran International Memorial victim record
Listed as victim #512 by remembrance account

Gilak citizen from Lahijan, died in the night of 19 Dey 1404 in Rasht in the area of Seighalan Square. His body was transferred to Lefmejan village in Lahijan for burial. He was married and had a 12-year-old child.
Bodybuilding coach and father of a 14-year-old son who had lost his wife seven years prior and raised his son alone. Killed by Islamic Republic agents with war bullets in Rostamabad.
Died in Neyshabur
Shot directly by security forces in Mamasani city

Shot with direct gunfire by government forces on Naser Khosrow Street in Khorramabad. Death certificate recorded 'entry of multiple foreign objects to the abdominal area' indicating multiple bullet wounds and direct shooting with intent to kill. Body was delivered to family on January 11 after several days of pursuit and uncertainty. Family was under intense pressure to accept the government's false narrative and identify their son as a 'Basiji'. Was an engineer and his father is a retired police force member.
Lur ethnicity, from Shushtar, shot by suppression forces
Shot and killed by special forces units with direct gunfire in front of a store where his sister was working. His wife and two daughters witnessed the incident.
Mentioned alongside Sepehr Mousavifar, likely a family member who was also killed
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial
Shot by government forces during protests in Marvdasht
16-year-old Lor child from Vilashahr, Isfahan, killed by suppression forces with direct gunshot to the head

Shot by military and security forces during suppression of nationwide protests in Torogh neighborhood of Mashhad. Bullet hit his thigh area. Along with at least 21 other citizens, he was targeted by direct shooting. After being shot, security forces transported the wounded in vehicles including a Pride car to locations away from public view and abandoned them without medical care to die from blood loss. Security forces refused to hand over his body to family and pressured them to declare cause of death as 'stabbing'. Father was directly threatened that if he didn't cooperate and accept the security narrative, a case would be fabricated against his daughter as an 'agitator'. Body was eventually handed over with condition of quiet burial in a remote village, but family transferred it to Torogh neighborhood in Mashhad for burial on 22 Dey 1404. Originally from Zabol, born in Zahedan, son of Shahab, Baloch ethnicity from Sistan and Baluchestan province.

Shot directly in the heart by Islamic Republic forces during protest. Security forces prevented anyone from helping him for about forty minutes while he was bleeding, threatening anyone who tried to assist. After the killing, security forces collected and removed all CCTV cameras from homes and shops on 15th Street in Fardis to destroy evidence. He was an aspiring rapper who had built a small recording studio in his bedroom closet and wrote lyrics about the pain of his generation.
Targeted and killed by suppression forces in Fooladshahr, Isfahan. The victim was of Lor ethnicity.
Death occurred in Tehranpars district of Tehran
Shot several times in the head. Father of a one year old daughter.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial database
Shot in the chest and side by security forces during suppression
Shot directly in the head by Khamenei's forces. Nephew of the tweet author's aunt.

First-team catcher of Iran's national baseball team, youth baseball coach in Mashhad who taught without payment. On 18 Dey (January 8) he smoked his first cigarette ever to counteract tear gas effects while having been hit in the head by a pellet. Despite this injury, he returned on Friday to join the national revolution protests again. Was killed by handgun fire in the Emamat area. Body was returned after 3 days and many commitments. Authorities did not allow a funeral ceremony to be held.
Death occurred in Gonbad-e Kavus

University of Art Tabriz student arrested at his workplace on Friday 19 Dey month. Currently held in Tabriz prison, reportedly at risk of death sentence being issued and executed. Denied access to lawyer and facing threats to his life.

25-year-old from Qashqai nomadic tribe living in Aram district of Dashtestan county in Bushehr province, shot by Islamic Republic suppressive forces during Iranian national revolution in Kazerun city. Young worker who lived in black tents with family in difficult economic conditions. Family was forced to pay 700 million tomans as 'bullet fee' to IRGC forces to retrieve his body. They had to sell some of their sheep and borrow money to pay this amount. IRGC forces secretly buried his body in a nighttime operation and prevented public funeral ceremonies.

Shot in the leg on 19 Dey (January 8, 2026), then arrested. A few days later was shot and killed with a finishing shot. Family found his body a week later, confirming he had been killed. Father of 3 sons (oldest 16 years old) and breadwinner of the family. Resident of Parand, shot there but buried at night in Dezful, Khuzestan.

Shot in the neck with a war bullet by security forces during Friday protests. He was shot from the rooftop of Al-Rasoul Mosque and died on the spot. He was buried the next day in a village in Takestan county. He would have turned 26 the day after he was killed.

Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces on 19 Dey. According to some eyewitnesses, the shooter was among his acquaintances. Some relatives of Ali Karami are members of the Revolutionary Guards. Family faced pressure from relatives which led to his burial being held in a highly securitized environment, and the family was forbidden from mentioning the honorific title 'Javid Nam' on his gravestone. He was a worker at Mamasani Electricity Office and did not have good financial conditions.
Shot with war bullet by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Shahin Shahr. He was engaged for four years and was about to get married and start their shared life together

Shot directly in the heart during direct gunfire targeting him and about 50 others in Shams Abad neighborhood. He was from Yaft Abad neighborhood in Tehran and was the sole supporter of his family - his father had died the previous year and his mother has been ill for years, with one side of her body paralyzed after a stroke.

From Marvdasht, lived in Isfahan, worked in car audio systems and owned a shop. Joined protests on January 9 and never returned home. Authorities contacted family on Tuesday to collect body, delayed delivery until Thursday. Family noted stitches on his head and a gunshot wound to his forehead. Was arrested and taken to hospital where he was killed.
Shot by suppressive forces during people's protests
48-year-old father of two children, resident of Isfahan, killed during people's protests by direct gunshot to the head by government suppression forces
Shot by suppression forces in Dezful

Artist from Zarinshahr. 39 years old with an 8-year-old daughter and 4-year-old son. On 19 Dey while getting into his car, he was shot at close range in the side with pellets. He died during transport to hospital due to severe internal bleeding.
First wounded with knife stabs, then killed with shotgun pellets to the body and a war bullet to one side of his face. Authorities withheld his body for seven days before returning it to family.

University of Tehran graduate student (class of 2019, irrigation major, College of Agriculture and Natural Resources), shot with war bullets by suppressive forces. Was wounded on Thursday evening 18 Dey in Haft-Howz area of Tehran, died on 19 Dey. Had a tattoo on his arm reading 'For those I love I will sacrifice'. Secret burial ceremony held with extensive presence of security agents.

Shot by Islamic Republic regime forces on Thursday at Hafthoz, died Friday during brutal suppression of uprising. Had hand tattoo reading 'For those I love I will sacrifice'. Described as courageous young man under 25 who was brimming with joy during 10 days of protests and vowed 'Don't fear, I'll stand in front of you'
Mentioned in memorial list from Rey city on January 9, 2026

Shot with direct gunfire by government forces during popular protests in Neyshabur. He had recently gotten married. Security forces pressured his family to hold the burial ceremony in silence without public attendance.

Shot in the temple by security forces' bullets during popular protests. His body was found 8 days later in the body delivery container and was buried 10 days after his killing at 7 AM under heavy pressure from security agents.
Killed during Dey month protests. Memorial ceremony held with large attendance featuring applause, music and dance to honor both victims
Memorial record from Iran International - specific circumstances not detailed in provided text
Shot with direct gunfire (war bullets) during the national uprising in Shahriyar. Young man who courageously took to the streets for Iran's future and died under the terrorist regime's suppression.
Originally from Khorramabad, killed in Punak Tehran by direct shooting by Islamic Republic regime terrorists during nationwide protest suppression
Died in Andimeshk
Died in Golshahr, Karaj
Died in Yaftabad, Tehran

Shot with pellets on 18 Dey in Rasht, treated himself, then on 19 Dey when he witnessed a suppressor about to shoot with a war bullet, he said 'don't shoot, I have a little daughter' but the suppressor shot him and Ali died

Shot in the neck with a war bullet by government forces during suppression of popular protests. Born in 1388 Persian calendar. Had posted an Instagram story with a song by Hichkas titled 'They Can't Kill Me' a few months before his death.

22-year-old basketball player for Oghab Ashour club team, studied business management, worked as pharmacy technician. Shot with direct bullet to his heart at Kaj Square near his workplace and residence during Dey month.
Incident occurred at Kaj Square in Tehran
Shot with war bullets by forces from Hessar Police Station 48 in Hessar neighborhood of Karaj

Shot with war bullet from behind by Islamic Republic forces in Javadiyeh, Tehran. He was the head of household and caretaker of two disabled children. His name has not been registered anywhere according to the source.
Shot with a war bullet to the heart on Abr Street, from Jey Street in Isfahan
Shot with war bullets by forces from Hessar Police Station 48 in Hessar neighborhood of Karaj

Shot with direct gunfire by suppressor forces of the Islamic Republic in the head area at Simin intersection in Isfahan. His body was identified and delivered at Alzahra Hospital morgue in Isfahan one week after being killed.
Shot directly by suppressive forces in Fouladshahr, Isfahan. The bullet hit his leg, but after being transferred to hospital, he died due to excessive bleeding.
Turkish citizen following Yarsani religion from Takestan, killed while standing with friends next to their parked motorcycle in the Grand Bazaar. A complaint message was sent about him as a rioter.
33 years old, from Aqche-Qale village. Died on Friday the 19th of Dey month in Saveh, sacrificing his life for the freedom of the homeland.

23-year-old final year microbiology student shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces in east Tehran. Transferred to Shahid-e Tajrish Hospital immediately after shooting, died on 19 Dey due to severe bleeding. Family believes blood was not transfused during treatment. Body was not returned to family for three days and was transferred to Kahrizak. Family had to search among thousands of unnamed corpses to find their daughter's body. Family was under severe security pressure, not allowed to post mourning notices in their neighborhood, forced to hold limited funeral at home.
Shot directly with bullets by Islamic Republic suppressors in Abpakhsh city, Dashtestan County, Bushehr Province

Shot with pellets during national uprising, face was bloodied the night before his death but he refused to clean the blood saying it was for the homeland and he was proud of it, continued to stand for freedom until his final moment
17-year-old 12th grade student shot in the head in Heravi area of Tehran. Family appears to be afraid and intimidated by the government to claim that terrorists killed him
17-year-old from Abpakhsh city in Braazjan county, Bushehr province, killed by Islamic Republic's suppression forces

Shop owner known for his fairness and kindness who had just gotten engaged. Shot in the back, in the spine. His family was pressured to claim that Alireza was a Basiji (a member of the Islamic Republic's paramilitary volunteer force) and a martyr of the Islamic Republic in order to receive his body.
Shot directly with bullets during popular protests

Shot and killed by plainclothes forces on Aban Street in Lab-ab area of Rasht. He was fleeing from plainclothes forces who had taken control of checkpoints and were firing indiscriminately. He was separated from his companions during the escape and was ambushed by plainclothes forces on Aban Street near Haj Hossein restaurant. He was shot twice - once in the heart area from the front that exited the other side of his body, and once near the neck area that also exited the other side. The bullets were likely fired from a Kalashnikov rifle at very close range. After being killed, one of the plainclothes officers repeatedly kicked his body while saying 'Seyyed Ali sarnegoneh, are?' (referring to Supreme Leader). His body showed no reaction to the kicks. His body was then placed in the trunk of a car and taken away. His body was found a week later in Bagh-e Rezvan cemetery in Rasht along with his uncle-in-law's body.
Listed as victim #465
Death occurred in Rafsanjan, Kerman province
Shot directly by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government in Rasht. He was a Gilaki citizen from Rasht and father of one child.

17-year-old from Bojnurd who had come to Tehran for work. On the evening of 19 Dey (January 8, 2026), he was shot in the legs by government forces, developed systemic infection leading to brain death. He died today.

Kurdish young man from Divandarreh, resident of Tehran. Shot with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during protests. Killed instantly. Body not returned to family and unclear if buried in Tehran. Family held limited mourning ceremony in Kani Sefid (Kani Charmu) village with only close relatives, public ceremony not permitted. Father Jalal Qahramani is a worker, family has lived in Tehran for over 30 years.
Died in Rostamkola, Mazandaran province
Died in Qarchak, Varamin area

Shot by direct sniper fire from suppressive forces at 8:30 PM on Taleghani Street, beginning of Shokoufeh Street in Karaj. He fell and died in front of his mother and sister. Described as a public execution in the heart of the city, part of organized massacre of defenseless people.
Became martyred (جاودانه شدند) in Yazdabad Falavarjan, Isfahan (known as 'Silk City')

Worked in Tehran's bazaar in the perfume and cologne trade. Shot in the head by suppressive forces during people's protests on 19 Dey 1404. Transferred to Loghman Hospital and died 24 hours later. Body was delivered to family in Kahrizak.
Killed on 18 Dey in Kaj Square, Saadatabad. Was a friend of the poster's nephew. Had recently wanted to give them sweets for his new car.
From Homayounshahr in Khomeini Shahr, Isfahan province. Became eternal (died) on Friday 19 Dey
Shot directly in the heart by government suppression forces during people's protests in Nazi Abad, Behesht Square
Shopkeeper from Ala-al-Din Passage, directly targeted by bullets during protests on 18-19 Dey
Former member of Iran's youth national taekwondo team, shot and killed by security forces during people's protests in Marvdasht as part of the Iranian national revolution against the Islamic Republic
Shot by Islamic Republic suppressors at Simin intersection in Isfahan on January 9, 2026 (19 Dey) and died on January 15, 2026 (25 Dey)
Shot directly by government suppression forces during protests in Haft Houz area
Shot with live ammunition by government forces during popular protests in Fardis. Killed alongside his brother Omid and nephew Armin while participating as a family in the protests.

Shot with a war bullet in the thigh on the evening of 19 Dey. After being transferred to hospital, he was killed with a finishing shot by suppressive forces of the regime. He was an only child living alone with his mother.
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime

Kurdish man in his twenties from Divandarreh living in Tehran, killed by live fire from regime forces during protests. His body hasn't been returned to his family, and only a small private mourning ceremony with close relatives was allowed in his village, Kani Sefid.

Physical education student, 21-year-old taekwondo athlete and former member of Iran's national youth taekwondo team, killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces. He was considered one of Iran's prominent taekwondo talents and had a silver medal from the Asian Club Cup
Shot at close range in the eye area after being beaten. Born 1383/02/27.
Born in 1983, killed by gunshot to the heart from suppressive forces
Killed in Hamadan on 19 Dey (January 9th). Context indicates death during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests that began December 28, 2025.
Shot with a war bullet on Sarsabil Street on Thursday 18 Dey
Murdered along with his three-year-old son. Bodies have not been handed over to family.
University student at Tehran University of Art (2024 admission), arrested by security forces on the evening of 19 Dey. No information available about his condition since arrest.
Listed as one of the eternal names (جاویدنامان), referring to victims of Iranian state violence. Listed with number 12493 and described as 'sacrificed for the homeland'

21-year-old soldier who was on leave. Was outside on Thursday 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) when he fled from suppression forces but they caught up with him in Hammam Sheik alley in Shahroud where he was hit by a war bullet. Was taken to hospital too late to save his life.
Shot by suppression forces' bullets in Karaj. Originally from Khorramabad.
Death occurred in Eslamshahr
Death occurred in Gorgan on 19 Dey 1404
Shot in the head with a bullet while protesting on the street, went to the protests with his two sisters and mother
Died on January 9, 2026 in Tehran

8-year-old girl shot and killed while traveling with her mother in a car in Isfahan. They were trying to go home but security forces blocked their route. The mother circled around multiple times, explaining that their home was on that street, but they still wouldn't let her pass. When she took an alternative route, they ordered her to stop and then opened fire. The child was killed. Authorities threatened the family extensively and buried the child under the name of 'national martyrs' in their procession at Isfahan's Martyrs Cemetery. The mother's condition deteriorated severely and she attempted suicide by cutting her wrists, though she survived. The child's school and classmates were heavily threatened not to speak about the child or their friend. Days later, state TV went to the school and made the 8-year-old children cry while filming them, then forced them to sing Iranian national songs. Graffiti was written on city walls saying 'Anila, martyr of Iran, death to America.'
Shopkeeper from Ala-al-Din Passage, directly targeted by bullets during protests on 18-19 Dey
Shot by snipers during celebrations after police were driven out of an area. Victims had gathered to dance and celebrate when snipers came and shot everyone present.
Shot directly with pellets and bullets by regime suppression forces in the Tabarsi area of Mashhad during Friday evening protests. Killed for participating in Iran's national uprising.
Shot with direct fire by government suppression forces during people's protests

6th semester medical student at Islamic Azad University Najafabad branch, killed during the national uprising. Born in 1383 (Persian calendar), family from Shahrekord. Body returned to family after several days delay on evening of Thursday 25 Dey. Burial ceremony held Friday 26 Dey in restricted atmosphere in Shahrekord with threatening phone calls to relatives warning against large gatherings or public expressions of grief. Memorial service held Monday 29 Dey at Behesht Rahmat Cemetery in Shahrekord with about 1000 attendees despite restrictions.

Shot with three direct bullets to the head, heart, and chest, then his body was stabbed with knives. Gilaki citizen from Rasht. Family was pressured to falsely claim he was a Basiji member killed by protesters, which relatives say is untrue.
15-year-old child from Babamidan Lor Memasani killed by direct gunfire from security forces
Killed by direct gunfire from government suppressive forces during popular protests in Isfahan

Petrochemical worker shot by government forces around 10:30 PM in the area of the city's cultural center. His body was initially seized by security forces. Family was told they would only receive the body if they claimed in an interview that their son was killed by 'thugs and riffraff'. The family refused this condition. Security forces eventually allowed burial under pressure and after obtaining written commitments, with the burial conducted by security forces without family members present. Buried in Haft Tapeh village on Monday at around 3:30 AM.

Shot with direct gunfire to the heart area on Andarzgoo Boulevard on Friday evening. Family initially thought he was arrested and searched for him for days. They were directed to Kahrizak detention center on Sunday morning where they were shown albums containing photos of the killed to identify individuals. Among the first 500 images, there was no trace of Armin which gave the family brief hope, but when the second series of images was presented, Armin's lifeless body was identified among them.
Died in Tehran
Listed as victim number 1062 in memorial list
Shot with live ammunition by government forces during popular protests in Fardis. Son of Omid Teymoori Rad, killed alongside his father and uncle Amir while participating as a family in the protests.
18-year-old boxer from Baharestan in Isfahan, originally from Izeh in southern Iran, worked as a hairdresser in Isfahan, killed by security forces during protests in the city
Shot with direct gunfire by suppressive forces in Banafsheh neighborhood of Karaj. He was targeted when he was separated from his friends and was alone at the location.
Victim commemorated in Iran International memorial
Died in Fardis, Karaj

14-year-old Kurdish child from Kangavar, shot with military bullet from behind by Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Eslamshahr, Tehran Province. Severely wounded and died several hours after being transferred to hospital. Burial ceremony held on 22 Dey month at Behesht-e Fatemeh cemetery in Salehieh. Was active in wrestling and gymnastics sports and had recently completed a professional hairdressing training course.
Died in Rasht during the protests

23-year-old photographer and videographer from Tabriz, shot directly by Khamenei's forces during the glorious epic of Tabriz people. Her body was handed over to the family 12 days later under pressure.
Shot by government forces during popular protests. Married, 39 years old, from Marvdasht.

35-year-old Kurdish man from Kermanshah living in Karaj, killed during popular protests on 19 Dey in Fardis, Karaj by direct shooting of war bullet by Islamic Republic suppression forces to his forehead area. His body was buried on 23 Dey 1404 in Kermanshah with family and relatives present, accompanied by 'Chamari' singing and mother's mourning dance over his grave. He had a fiancée.
Listed as victim #986 in memorial post from Shushtar on 19 Dey 1404

Shot and killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic suppressive forces on Vakil Abad Boulevard in Mashhad. His car was targeted with barrage of bullets - dozens of war bullets were fired at his vehicle. He was a 41-year-old hairdresser and father of a 14-year-old daughter. The intensity of the shooting indicated clear intent to kill. Security forces forced his family to pledge not to publicize this crime after his death.

Hairdresser and father to a 14-year-old daughter, fatally shot by Iran's repressive Islamic Republic forces on Vakil Abad Blvd. His car was riddled with dozens of bullets in a deliberate killing. He was proud of his work, especially grooming grooms, and showcased his passion on his Instagram page.

Shot in the head by suppressive forces during people's protests. Her body was returned to her family nine days later with the condition of burial in Kermanshah. She was a 22-year-old art graduate living in Tehran.

Shot in the neck with military bullets by Islamic Republic forces in the Haft-Houz area of Tehranpars. After the bullet hit Ava's neck, suppressive forces cordoned off the area with gunfire, preventing people from approaching Ava.
Baloch citizen killed during protests in Hassan-Abad village in Rask county, Sistan and Baluchestan province. Described as son of Kingi.

Shot at close range at 9 PM on the night of 19 Dey in Phase One Andisheh area, likely with pellets as companions were all hit with pellets. Blood flowed from nose and mouth moments after being shot. Died at 10 PM in Noor Hospital in Shahriyar. Body was found on Sunday in Kahrizak and buried on Tuesday.

Shot at close range with pellet gun during protests on the night of 19 Dey at 9 PM in Fase Yek Andishe. His companions were all hit with pellets. He bled from his nose and mouth after being shot. Died at 10 PM at Nour Hospital in Shahriyar. His body was found on Sunday in Kahrizak and buried on Tuesday.
Described as a martyr of the homeland's path. His daughter mentioned that because he wasn't young, his name doesn't get mentioned anywhere

Shot with a war bullet on Golestan Street in Isfahan. The bullet hit precisely in the waist area (belt area). His body was delivered after 6 days of obstruction. He was buried in Mirabad village, Isfahan.

Father of two sons. The text suggests he died during protests but provides no specific details about how, when, or where he died. Referenced as someone who wrote 'The world owes me a Hayedeh concert' and is now described as being owed a life by the world.

Shot with a bullet directly to the heart area during protests. Security forces forced the family to sign a commitment to refrain from any public information sharing when delivering the body, and asked the family to register the cause of death differently and introduce him as a 'martyr'.
Shot directly in the heart region by government forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran during protests in Rasht. Father of two daughters. Gilaki citizen from Rasht.
Died in Neyshabur on 19 Dey 1404

17-year-old from Neyshabur shot directly by suppression forces while fleeing. Video evidence shows she was running away after hearing gunshots and was shot from behind. She posed no threat and was not in a position of confrontation, but was simply a teenager trying to save her life.

17-year-old teenager and follower of the Baha'i faith, shot directly by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Karaj, the capital of Alborz province. Directly targeted by security forces and died from the severity of his injuries.
Killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces in the street during Friday protests in Saveh city in Markazi province (Arak)

Shot by government mercenaries in the evening of 19 Dey in Sabzevar. His body was in the street gutter for several hours. He was transferred to hospital where he died from the severity of his injuries.
Lur ethnicity from Dezful, targeted and killed by suppression forces in the city
Shot by sniper from above Qasemabad police station around Imamiyeh square area in Mashhad
Father of two sons aged 5 and 15, from Mashhad, resident of Torbat-e Jam. Shot in the neck by direct fire from government suppression forces during people's protests.

Shot in the forehead by IRGC snipers while carrying an injured protester on his shoulders to his house parking lot for medical treatment during protests in Fardis, Karaj. He was helping others who were wounded by government forces firing war bullets at protesters. Two other people were also shot while locals risked their lives to retrieve his body. He had been previously warned by two Basij members that he had been identified by intelligence forces and his life was in danger. Born 1370, resident of Fardis Karaj, recently married just 45 days before his death. His body was returned to his family three days after death. He owned a clothing boutique called 'Diamond' in Fardis Karaj and was known as Behrouz Diamond. He had previously provided shelter to injured protesters in his house parking lot during November 2019 protests, Mahsa movement of 2022, and Dey month 2025 protests.
Father, killed with war bullet in chest at 7 o'clock on Friday in Fardis Karaj alongside his 25-year-old son Hamidreza
Died in Andimeshk

Shot in the throat with pellets at close range, transferred to Afshar Hospital in Yazd by civilians. Authorities contacted his mother to confirm identity but secretly transferred his body to unknown corpses section of Khaldbarin Yazd without informing family. Family found him after several days of searching. Body remained in morgue for 10 days before burial in Tariqol-Reza block of Khaldbarin Yazd.

Baloch citizen without identity documents, originally from Zahedan, shot by military and security forces on the evening of Friday, January 9, 2026 (19 Dey 1404) at the Imamat-Estaghlal intersection in Mashhad during the suppression of nationwide protests. He was struck by a bullet to the head (left side) while sitting in the passenger seat of a Peugeot 405, returning home from a gas station with a relative. He was not participating in protests but was caught during street suppression operations. Died two days later in Razavi Hospital due to severe injuries. Married with two young children (2 years old and 2 months old), from Hemmatabad neighborhood in Shirabad district of Zahedan. Security agencies demanded 500 million tomans from his family for the body's release. After 11 days of family appeals, he was buried in Behesht Reza cemetery in Mashhad under strict security measures with only 10 close relatives present. Transfer of body to Zahedan for burial in his hometown was denied.

Young footballer and resident of West Baghestan, Karaj. Shot directly with war bullets by Islamic Republic security forces during protests. Shot in the abdomen in the Shahin Karaj area near 10th Street. Was alive when transferred to Alborz Hospital in Karaj but died due to delays and lack of timely medical care from severe bleeding. Was unarmed and participated peacefully in protests demanding freedom, human dignity and end of Islamic Republic rule. Security forces pressured his family to prevent public disclosure and media interviews.
Shot by direct fire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during protests in Rasht. Citizen of Gilan province, ethnic Gilak.
Shot with war bullet in Shahin Shahr. Body was returned to family after one week with written commitment. Burial ceremony held on Friday 26 Dey in Shahin Shahr.

Known as 'Bibi Rider', 19 years old from Gonbad-e Kavus in Golestan province, killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces during protests in Gorgan. She was interested in motorcycling and was targeted during the protests. Government officials made delivery of her body conditional on declaring 'death in accident', but family and friends insist she was present at protests and was killed by Islamic Republic forces.

Father of two children, shot directly by Khamenei's mercenaries in Masour neighborhood of Khorramabad on the evening of 19 Dey. Killed by deliberate bullets from a murderous government while trying to live and provide for his children's future. Part of systematic massacre of Iranian people - shooting to intimidate, silence, and establish terror.
Shot by suppression forces in Masour neighborhood of Khorramabad. Identified as Lur ethnicity.

Shot with live ammunition by government forces during popular protests in Saadat Abad area, bullet hit heart region. Child of Afghan father and Iranian mother. Was a child laborer working as mechanic apprentice.

Shot directly in the head with a bullet on Setareh Khan street in Tehran during protests. He was a 35-year-old protesting citizen, originally from Qom, who owned a food preparation shop called 'Javanan' on Shadman street in Tehran. His father was also an old restaurateur in the same neighborhood and owned the 'Javanan Eslami' restaurant. Ehsan was unmarried and had been showing solidarity and opposition to the current situation through social media posts since the beginning of the popular protests. On the last day when internet was limitedly connected, he messaged a friend saying he was going to the street to participate in protests but never returned. A close friend identified his face in a video showing bodies of victims in the street, which was captured from the mobile phone of suppressive forces and shows a disturbing scene where after the massacre, suppressors are standing over the blood-soaked bodies of freedom-seeking people, laughing and celebrating.
Lur from Izeh, shot directly by suppression forces in Freidunshahr
Death occurred in Mashhad
Died in Mohammadshahr, Karaj

23-year-old foundry worker from Dehanoui, Isfahan who was a protester in the freedom movement. He was wounded by a bullet to the left thigh area. Despite family reports that his physical condition was improving and there was talk of 'complete recovery', he was suddenly transferred to ICU after his condition deteriorated and died the next morning. Family was forced to pay 1.3 billion tomans to retrieve his body. Death occurred in suspicious circumstances with sudden transfer to ICU.

23-year-old citizen from Lahijan, severely injured during popular protests in Eslamshahr, Tehran province when military-security forces of the Islamic Republic opened fire with war bullets and pellet shots hitting his leg area. Died en route to hospital due to severe blood loss.
23-year-old soldier-teacher from Torbat-e Jam, killed by bullet from IRGC terrorists during the national revolution
Gilaki citizen and father of two children from Khoshkbijar city, killed by direct gunshot from Islamic Republic of Iran forces to the heart area
Died in Rasht
Became martyred in Yazdanshahr, Isfahan. Was Georgian-speaking.
Shot with a war bullet to the heart near Sohrevardi area in Isfahan
Shot by government forces during people's protests

Suffered severe brain contusion and skull fracture from severe blows to his head on the night of the 19th in Parand. After several days in a coma, he died. His family was severely pressured and threatened not to speak out. He was the only son with two sisters.
Shot with direct gunfire by government forces during popular protests
Located in Fallah area of Tehran
Listed in Iran International Memorial database as a victim

Shot by Khamenei's suppressive agents near Tajrish. Originally from Bandar Abbas but living in Tehran. Security agents threatened her family in Bandar Abbas, forcing them to tell relatives that the cause of death was 'cancer disease'

Shot in the heart by special forces during protests near Farhang Street in Rasht. She was a fourth-grade elementary school teacher and mother of an 8-year-old son. Special forces cornered protesters in an alley and opened fire. Her body was returned to family after signing commitments, with authorities demanding the family declare her a Basij member, which they refused.
Shot directly by suppression forces. Ethnic Lor from Jonegan in Isfahan Province.
Shot by suppression forces. 32-year-old Lor ethnicity from Yazdanshahr, Isfahan.

Shot with live ammunition by security forces during protest gathering in front of the governor's office. After forces attacked with tear gas, sound bombs, and then opened fire from rooftops of surrounding buildings, a bullet hit her from behind and exited through her abdomen. She was fleeing with her father when shot. Despite immediate transfer to clinic, she died due to severe internal and external bleeding.

17-year-old graphic design student shot with three war bullets by Islamic Republic armed forces during Friday protests on 19 Dey 1404 in Golshahr, Karaj. She was targeted in front of her house and died in her mother's arms.

16-year-old high school student from Isfahan who was a tenant and worked in the afternoons. Shot with three war bullets by special forces near Bozorgmehr Bridge in front of her father and mother's eyes on the night of 19 Dey.

Shot and killed with three bullets during Friday protests on 19 Dey 1404 in Tehranpars by Islamic Republic's suppressive forces. One bullet to the waist, one bullet to the thigh, and a final shot to the heart. Originally from Gorgan. IRGC intelligence forces are attempting to falsely portray him as a 'Basiji' through a fabricated scenario.

40-year-old skilled barber living on Shapour Street, shot directly in the abdomen by regime suppression forces during Iran's national uprising. Father of two young children aged 11 and 6, killed in the same alley where his mother lived.
From Mobarakeh, shot and killed by plainclothes security officer using unlicensed Samand car

Shot in the heart by Islamic Republic suppressors with war bullets during protests in Shahrak Kashavari neighborhood in Isfahan. She was a commercial sector employee and mother of a son over 18 years old. She had posted protest content including about people's livelihood problems and support for the Pahlavi dynasty, specifically Mohammad Reza Shah Pahlavi. She was buried on Friday in Bagh Rezvan cemetery in Isfahan.
Shot and killed by suppression forces. From Bakhtiari province, ethnically Lur
Died during protests in Isfahan
Shot directly in the neck with bullet on Barazandeh Street in Isfahan. Body was held hostage until 26 Dey (January 26, 2026)
Shot by suppression forces. Lur ethnicity.
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Fardis, Karaj during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests

Young single citizen from Chamgardaan city in Lenjan county. Recently completed military service and was self-employed. Arrested by security forces on Thursday 18 Dey 1404, died under torture during detention. Torture marks were visible on his body. Body was delivered to family on Tuesday 23 Dey with severe restrictions imposed by security forces to prevent people from seeing the body.
Owner of 'Amadegan' bookstore. Killed by direct shooting by government suppressive forces
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial
Father of a 3-month-old infant, worked at the metal skeleton unit of Mobarakeh Steel Company in Isfahan. Shot directly by government suppression forces during popular protests.
Shot directly in the heart with a bullet on Friday 19 Dey in the city of Shahrabad-e Abrisham, Isfahan
Died in Isfahan area (سده اصفهان)

21-year-old from Mashhad killed during bloody suppressions by the Islamic Republic regime, joined the victims on the path to freedom as one of thousands of youth who became victims of government violence and crimes with dreams of a free and humane future for Iran
Died in Fardis, Karaj

Shot directly to the heart between 8:30-9:00 PM on Friday in Malakshahr, Isfahan. Worked as a trailer tanker driver transporting fuel materials for Isfahan refinery. Also known by the nickname Abbas. Authorities restricted funeral ceremonies, did not allow formal ceremonies or announcements. Intelligence agents from IRGC came to observe the burial and threatened to take the body away if more than 10 people gathered.
Originally from Jara village in Tuyserkan county, Hamadan province. Killed in Pakdasht by Islamic Republic terrorists.

Kurdish Yarsan citizen shot with a war bullet from behind by Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Elahiye neighborhood of Kermanshah. Security forces did not allow his body to be buried in Kermanshah city, and the family was forced to bury him in their family village, 'Saraylan Toh Khaki'. The burial ceremony was held on 21 Dey despite the security atmosphere, with participants chanting anti-government slogans.
Shot by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Shazand, Arak. When Hassan was shot, he was still alive and managed to reach his home with difficulty, but died in front of his house.
Mentioned in remembrance post, Yaft-Abad Tehran area
45 years old, married, father of two children, from Marvdasht. Shot by government forces during people's protests.
Shot by government suppression forces with direct gunfire to the chest and leg during people's protests

Killed on 19th of Dey month. Body has not been returned to family despite passage of time. Security agencies have threatened the family with severe pressure to refrain from any media coverage or publicity of this crime.
16-year-old killed during protests. He worked as a hairdresser while studying. His mother said he died for the freedom of his homeland

Shot directly from behind in the head while helping an injured protester during nationwide protests in Rasht. Died in his son's arms. Security forces withheld his body for three days and pressured family to claim he was a Basij member before releasing the body. Buried at night without ceremony in a cemetery behind Rasht airport.

Karate champion and referee killed by suppression forces with war bullets in Zeynabiyeh neighborhood of Isfahan during the Iranian national revolution. His wife Fatemeh Rezaei is also a karate coach and they have a three-year-old child.
Listed in Iran International Memorial
Listed among martyrs from Najafabad, Isfahan during protests
Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, shot by military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Tehran

19-year-old from Baghmalek county, shot directly by security forces during popular protests on Naderi Street in Ahvaz. This protesting citizen was targeted by Khamenei's mercenaries' bullets and killed.

Shot with two war bullets to his chest by Islamic Republic suppression agents at Chaharrah Bazar in Najafabad during the Iranian national revolution. He was a firefighter and diver who lived with his father. Son of Ibrahim Radi, a veteran of the Iran-Iraq war.
Commemorated with 'eternal name' suggesting martyrdom or death related to protests

Kurdish citizen from Dehloran, originally from Zarin-Abad village in Kermanshah province but residing in Isfahan. Shot with war bullet by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests on 18 Dey. His family was able to retrieve his body after 5 days of follow-up and pressure from security institutions, and buried him on Wednesday 24 Dey 1404 in the cemetery of his birthplace in Zarin-Abad (Pahleh) village in Dehloran. He was married and father of two young children.
Shot by security forces during anti-regime protests on Sa'idi Street in old Mashour. Son of Jamal, resident of old Mashour who had become one of the field activists during the anti-regime protests.
Shot with war bullets by the terrorist group IRGC (Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps). Killed for the crime of standing with the people, became a target of the bloody suppression by the regime.

Football coach killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces after being beaten with batons in an alley, then shot directly with bullets to his body. He was a well-known sports figure in Arak, and his brother is a goalkeeper for Aluminum Arak football team.
Shot from close range in the back by Basij forces. He was a welder and had a 2-year-old son. Buried in Seyyed Mohammad cemetery.
Shot with a war bullet to the head during Iran's national uprising by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic. Jabbar was a Qashqai citizen.
Died in Zirab Savadkuh area
Shot in the head with live ammunition by mercenaries of the terrorist Islamic Republic regime in the Takestan region. Family is being threatened and coerced into falsifying the cause of his death.
Killed by suppressive forces in Chalus
Killed alongside Reza Foladi during the national uprising in Zirab Savadkoh on Friday 19 Dey.
Baloch individual killed by direct gunfire with war ammunition during protests in Dey 1404
Worker, from Zahedan living in Meybod, Yazd. Shot in the chest by government forces with a war bullet during people's protests in the city. His body was buried in his birthplace four days later.

Shot by security forces after throwing herself in front of regime forces to protect young protesters. The 66-year-old mother and grandmother courageously tried to shield protesters from being shot, but security agents opened fire anyway and killed the unarmed woman.

Born in 1974 from Ajin, Hamedan. Shot with a war bullet to the chest from above the police station in Tehran's district 2 (Khalij Fars neighborhood). He was a tailor and a cheerful, lively artist who always had a smile and was full of positive energy for everyone. Family was forced to promise not to speak about him.

Shot directly with military bullets during protests in Tehran around 8-9 PM near Fayazbakhsh Hospital. He was a 30-year-old tailor from Ajin city in Asadabad county, Hamadan province, born on 23 Esfand 1374.
Died in Zirab, Savadkuh area

39-year-old filmmaker, assistant director, and native of Hamedan, shot dead by Islamic Republic security forces on the streets of Tehran. Mr. Ganji was a respected behind-the-scenes professional in cinema and television, well known among directing and production teams with years of experience working on numerous films and TV projects.
Shot by snipers during celebrations after police were driven out of an area. Victims had gathered to dance and celebrate when snipers came and shot everyone present. Was less than 13 years old.

45-year-old hairdresser shot directly by security forces' bullets on Piroozi Street in Tehran during Iran's national uprising. According to family members, Javad was simply standing in front of his home when he was targeted and killed in less than two minutes. He was a hardworking person who dreamed of building a better future and immigrating to America.
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Sadeh, Isfahan

Shot in the head with a military bullet by Khamenei's mercenaries in Fardis city. His lifeless body was returned by two friends who were with him, given to his family, and buried at night in one of the villages near Arak without a death certificate.
Shot and killed at Mikaeil intersection in Rasht on Friday. Family described him as a very good person who would do anything for his friends and others.

Shot with Kalashnikov rifle in pelvic area and side, killed in front of police station 13 in Joyabad neighborhood. Buried a week later under family pressure without ceremony in Bagh Ferdows cemetery in Khomeinishahr
Shot with war bullets by forces from Hessar Police Station 48 in Hessar neighborhood of Karaj

16-year-old blogger in the gaming field from Fardis, Karaj, shot directly in the heart area by a war bullet from suppressive forces of the terrorist Islamic Republic regime during Iran's national uprising. The severity of the injury was such that he was never transferred to hospital and died before any medical attention. His body was delivered to the family without going through any treatment process and his burial ceremony was held at Sakineh Paradise in Karaj.
Mother of a 10-year-old child from Neyshabur. Shot directly by government suppression forces during people's protests in front of her house.

Shot in the heart with a war bullet in the evening in Shahin-Vila neighborhood of Karaj. He was a student who loved rap music and writing lyrics. He had recently started a Telegram channel where he published his rap videos. He was passionate about styling, studied, and worked at the same time.
University professor from Masjed Soleyman, shot by suppression forces in Haft Hoz area of Tehran

Shot directly in the neck with a war bullet by Khamenei's vile IRGC forces in Fardis. Father of a 13-year-old son. He had said the night before: 'I want to go out tonight, if something happens to me, don't let my name be forgotten. Let everyone know I became a martyr.'

38-year-old woman who died on 18 Dey as a result of beatings by regime forces in Tehran. Her body was transferred to Isfahan six days later and buried there. Another account of murder, delay in handing over the body, and depriving compatriots of human dignity.

43-year-old Kurdish woman from Hamadan residing in Qarchak (Tehran suburb), shot directly by suppressive forces during popular protests. She was married, mother of three children (ages 16, 11, and 2), standing next to a tree when targeted by snipers positioned around the gathering. Bullet hit her head, transferred immediately to hospital, died after two hours. Her body was delivered from Kahrizak on Monday 22 Dey and buried in a security atmosphere at Fatemeh Paradise cemetery in Qarchak.

Newlywed who was killed only one week after her wedding by direct shooting from Khamenei's agents. Security forces delivered her body to the family 10 days after the killing, only after receiving money and a written commitment not to hold public funeral ceremonies. According to the burial permit issued by the Sari forensic medicine office, cause of death was 'rupture of abdominal organs and fracture of lumbar spine' due to 'impact of hard high-speed projectile', clearly referring to being shot with war bullets by government agents.

Barber killed during protests on Friday 19 Dey 1404. Shot by suppression forces while operating his small barbershop in Bagh-Feyz neighborhood of Islamshahr. Was passionate about rap music and had posted a rap video on Instagram on 13 Dey expressing the pain of his generation. Buried in section 79 of Behesht Zahra cemetery.

Shot directly by Iranian Islamic Republic government forces in Jamaran neighborhood of Rasht, near a Basij base. The bullet hit his head and the incident occurred in front of his brother's eyes. He was a Gilaki citizen from Rasht.

Kurdish citizen from Qasr-e Shirin and industrial management student at Shahroud University. Shot in the back by military-security forces of the Islamic Republic while in front of his family home during popular protests in Qods city (Qaleh Hassan Khan). His mother found his bloody body when she opened the door. Security forces initially transferred his body to hospital then to Kahrizak. Initially 700 million tomans was demanded for body delivery, but family refused to pay and body was eventually delivered. Security forces did not allow transfer of body to Qasr-e Shirin, forcing family to hold burial ceremony on 23 Dey under security force control with limited attendance of close relatives in Tehran.
Kurdish Yarsan citizen shot by security forces during popular protests in Tehran in the evening of 19 Dey 1404.

Shot directly by government security forces with a war bullet hitting the back of his head during popular protests on Saheb al-Zaman road in Shushtar, near a motorcycle manufacturing unit. Lur ethnicity, from Shushtar city in Khuzestan province. Buried on Tuesday 23 Dey 1404 in Shushtar cemetery.

Shot with war bullets during the second night of the January 19th call for protests in Shahreza, Isfahan Province. Killed in the presence of his 15-year-old daughter. Father of 2 children. Family was not allowed to hold a funeral ceremony.

Shot with three live bullets by regime's repressive forces during protests in Yazdanshahr. He was a hardware tools shopkeeper who lived in northern regions of Iran and had traveled to Isfahan to visit his mother when he was targeted and killed during the protests.

CrossFit athlete and construction worker who was attacked in Marzdaran area of Tehran. First beaten and injured, then killed with a shotgun. Married with a child under one year old. Body has not been returned to family due to communication cuts and access restrictions.
Shot directly by government forces during popular protests in the Maskan neighborhood of Kermanshah. Kurdish citizen and resident of Kermanshah.

41-year-old Gilak citizen from Rasht, killed in the night of 19 Dey 1404 in the Darvazeh Lakan area of Rasht. After being identified as a leader, he was targeted and killed by a direct shot of a war bullet to the head by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran.
Died in Neyshabur on 19 Dey 1404

Mother of three children from Isfahan, died during popular protests on Nazar Sharghi Street in the city after sustaining multiple baton blows from government suppression forces. Her body was buried on Sunday 21 Dey 1404 without any ceremony and under security measures at Bagh Rezvan Cemetery in Isfahan.

Shot in the throat by Islamic Republic regime suppression forces during protests in Mashhad. She was a young woman who was directly targeted during the suppression of popular protests. She lived in Ghasemabad, Mashhad.

Killed in Qeshm, originally from Yasouj. After her death, family was pressured by security agencies to introduce her as a 'Basiji'. The regime prevented the family from holding mourning ceremonies to bury their crime in silence.

13-year-old Lor child from Chenarsafli (Sheikh) village in Asadabad, Hamedan province. Killed by direct gunfire from government forces with a war bullet hitting him during popular protests in front of his family home.

Shot and killed at the Qazi intersection in Dezful while he was with his family. According to an informed source, they first shot his leg and then security forces went over him and shot him in the heart.
Killed by Islamic Republic forces in Tehran on 19 Dey
Commemorated as martyred victim, friends are deeply saddened

Baloch female student of biomedical engineering at Azad University of Kerman, daughter of Hossein, from Anbarabad county. Shot in the back by suppressive forces while participating in protests on Bahmanyar Street in Kerman. Died from severity of wounds. Body returned to family on Saturday 20 Dey 1404 from Kerman forensic medicine after family was threatened to remain silent and forced to sign commitment. Buried in her birthplace Anbarabad around 19:30 the same day under security restrictions without public announcement.
Shot by suppression forces in Dezful. Lur ethnicity. Body was buried in Adalat neighborhood of the same city.
Shot by security forces during anti-regime protest. Originally from Dehloran city but killed in Tehran.
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Pardis during the protests

Shot with 12 war bullets by the Islamic Republic. Had made a will requesting to remain anonymous and said he was going so that strangers far from home and orphans of the homeland could achieve their rights. Chanted freedom slogans until his last moment

Shot by bullet to the forehead during protests. He was the breadwinner of his family and worked as a cabinet installer. His father suffered from severe Alzheimer's and his brother had passed away due to cancer.
Killed in Sidi district of Mashhad. Family was pressured by killers to claim he was a Basij member, but he had clearly declared his views on his social media page
Died in Torbat-e Jam
Died in Shahreza, Isfahan province
Became a martyr (جاودانه شد) in Fardis, Karaj. He is described as a father with young children who should know their father was a hero.

Described as 'child of Iran and one who sacrificed his life for the homeland'. His mother was taken by ambulance to Behesht Zahra cemetery to kiss her son's face for the last time and say goodbye to him. His mother is still hospitalized due to grief over Mehdi's death.

Shot in the chest with a Kalashnikov rifle during suppression of protests in Charmahin city. Protesters had gathered in the city square, burned the Islamic Republic flag, and moved toward the Basij base. When they approached the entrance, suppressive forces stationed inside opened fire directly at the crowd with Kalashnikov weapons. Four known suppressors fired: Rahim Hedayati, Alamdar Jafari, Shirzad Mehdipour, and Sirus Pirkhili. Colonel Alamdar Jafari of the IRGC was identified as the one who fired the fatal shot. Mehdi had completed his military service just two months before this incident.
Died at Khorasan Square in Tehran
Died on January 9, 2026 in Ariashahr, Tehran
Shot directly by security forces near the police station in Rostamkola, Behshahr County, Mazandaran Province. Body returned to family after several days with severe restrictions

Shot with a war bullet in the waist from behind in District 19 of Tehran, Khaniabad, in front of Shekar Banu pastry shop. Despite the possibility of survival, agents prevented his rapid transfer to hospital, and this delay caused him to die from the severity of his injuries. His body was eventually handed over to his family after receiving a 'bullet fee' and was buried on Sunday in Behesht Zahra, section 225. Family and friends described him as a peaceful, kind person who loved animals and nature, who died innocently and in silence.
Died in Saadat Abad, Tehran
From Gonbad-e Kavous, wounded by pellets on the first day but returned the next day, then shot in the heart and killed in Gohardasht

Shot in the head from behind with a war bullet by a plainclothes operative with a belt pistol while he was going to help an injured person on Ithar Street, Baharestan, Isfahan. His family found his body after one week.
Died in Shushtar
Died in Marvdasht on 19 Dey 1404
Shot by security forces on Qazi Street in Dezful. Lur ethnicity.
Described as 'child of Iran and soul sacrificed for the homeland'. Context suggests death related to Iranian protests. Referenced as cousin and friend by the author.
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Saman, Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province. Born in 1368 Persian calendar (1989 Gregorian).
Father of a young child, killed by Islamic Republic's suppressive forces in Isfahan city

Father of Mani Shafiei, killed simultaneously during protests by direct gunshot to the heart area. Government institutions demanded 500 million tomans from the family for returning the bodies of both victims.
21-year-old from Sabzevar, shot by IRGC terrorists during the national revolution on 19 Dey in Mashhad. His body was buried in the cemetery of Shams Abad village in Rudab district of Sabzevar.
Shot with three war bullets by Islamic Republic's suppressive forces in the city of Saman
Killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces in the street during Friday protests in Saveh city in Markazi province (Arak)

Two-time bodybuilding champion and coach shot and killed at a protest. Had posted on Instagram hours before his death: 'I just want my rights. A voice that has been silenced in me for over 40 years must scream. You took away our youth, hopes, dreams... I am here so that tomorrow I won't look at myself in the mirror and say that I had no vein, no honour ... I will pay anything for it.' Managed two charity organizations.

Shot with war bullets during protests in Isfahan. Family originally from Kerman, residing in Isfahan. Body was returned to family after six days with commitment for 'silent burial'. He was buried on Thursday, 25 Dey 1404.

Shot directly by government forces during popular protests in Shahriyar. Shot from behind in the head area while fleeing during protests on 19 Dey. Died on the way to hospital due to severity of wounds. His body was found in Kahrizak with registration number 12600 among thousands of bodies.

Suffered severe head trauma on Friday the 19th and fell into a coma with consciousness level dropping below 5 percent. After five days hospitalized in a coma, he died on Wednesday. His burial was held on Friday morning the 26th at 7 AM with only family members allowed to attend due to security forces' restrictions.

Shot with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Karaj. Kurdish citizen originally from Kangavar, Kermanshah Province, of Lak ethnicity. Body may not yet have been returned to family.

25-year-old Lor protester from Mamasani residing in Tehran. Injured by grenade shrapnel from Islamic Republic suppressors in Nazi-Abad neighborhood in south Tehran on evening of 18 Dey 1404, causing spinal cord injury to his neck area and leading to coma. Died on 24 Dey 1404. Body was buried on Friday 26 Dey in his birthplace Mamasani.

Gilan citizen from Rasht (Pirbazar neighborhood), shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during popular protests in Moalem Street near the governorate building. Family has been under severe pressure from security institutions after his death, not allowed to hold public mourning ceremonies, and no photos of him have been published. According to relatives, he was only three months away from his wedding ceremony.
Went to the streets on the 18th of Dey in Isfahan and his body was returned to his family after seven days

Farmer and tractor driver who was shot in the heart by a war bullet during protests. His funeral was held with epic and protest atmosphere, with no prayer service according to his personal will, and attendees recited parts of Shahnameh instead of Quran
Shot directly in the throat by government suppression forces during people's protests
37-year-old chef from Gorgan who worked in hotels and restaurants. Father of a 5-year-old daughter. Died in Gorgan.

Killed during Friday night protests on 19 Dey 1404. Family had to collect 700 million tomans as 'bullet fee' from family and acquaintances over 8 days to retrieve his body for burial. Body was buried in Ali Bagher village cemetery in Jalalavand area on 27 Dey 1404.
Shot in the head with a bullet on Parvin Street, Isfahan, at the 24-metri intersection on Friday. Became eternal (martyred).

Shot by security forces while trying to rescue his wounded cousin during protests. Despite warnings from agents not to approach, he continued trying to help his cousin who had been shot. After being shot, he attempted to reach his home despite severe injuries but collapsed in the courtyard. Security forces then removed his body from the scene. He was a worker at a company located on Karaj Special Road.

Shot by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic during revolutionary uprising in Zirab, Mazandaran. Described as a 37-year-old monarchist. Mother vowed at his burial ceremony to seek justice for his killing.
Shot dead by Iranian regime forces in Rasht city during protests in Gilan Province

22-year-old mechanical engineering student and teacher from Rasht. Shot directly by IRGC suppression forces around 8 PM on one of Rasht's streets during the massacre of people in Rasht. Hit by bullet and killed during popular protests. Described as good-natured, popular, responsible and committed person who earned trust and respect through honesty and purity. His body was buried at night on Sunday under security atmosphere.

Shot by Islamic Republic forces during protests on Naser Khosrow Street in Khorramabad. Bullets hit his neck and side. His body was taken from the hospital before security forces arrived, and his family had to drive around with the body in a car until noon to prevent it from falling into government hands.

Gilak citizen from Sangar, athlete, footballer and goalkeeper trainer. Shot on Motahari Street in Rasht during nationwide protests by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran. After being shot, people and friends moved his body about 200-300 meters to Hajiabad Street area and placed him inside his personal car. To avoid sensitivity from security forces, those present contacted Milad's brother saying he was injured and had a headache, asking him to come take Milad home. The brother came with his wife and young child, unaware of the severity of the injury, but upon opening the car door found it soaked in blood.
Shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic agents during Iran's national revolution. He was a monarchist resident of Marzdaran Boulevard in Tehran.

Father of one child, from Marvdasht, resident of Tehran. Shot by government suppression forces during protests and killed after being transferred to detention center. Buried in his hometown 7 days later.

33-year-old monarchist youth and Islamic Republic protester shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces during Iranian national revolution in front of Hamayoun-shahr (Khomeini-shahr) governorate building in Isfahan. Killed by two bullets, one to his side and another to his head. Married young man whose family had no information about his fate for five days.
Kurdish citizen from Ilam, killed by being shot in the neck with a war bullet by Islamic Republic forces. Family was forced to pay 600 million tomans in cash as 'bullet money' to receive his body
Died in Yaft-Abad district, Tehran
Motorcycle delivery driver and father of two children, killed by direct gunshot to the head during popular protests in Falah district of Tehran
Killed alongside Reza Foladi during the national uprising in Zirab Savadkoh on Friday 19 Dey.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial database
Listed in Iran International Memorial, indicating death during protests or related state violence
Victim memorialized in Iran International Memorial database

Baluch student shot and killed by suppressive forces during protests in Mashhad. Son of Mohammad Karim, from the Rigi tribe, originally from Zahedan but residing in Mashhad. Economics student at Azad University of Mashhad. Shot in the head with a war bullet in the Haft-e Tir area of Mashhad while going to join protest gatherings with a close friend. Died on the spot. Family was under severe security pressure and forced into silence. Body was buried in silence without the presence of relatives after being handed over from Behesht-e Razvan morgue.
From Shushtar, became eternal on 18 Dey (martyred/killed). Social media post asks for sharing as he has no one

Shot directly by government suppression forces during people's protests in Masour neighborhood. According to published accounts, first a bullet hit his heart area, then he lost his life after being shot in the head.
Killed by government suppression forces during popular protests
Gilaki citizen from Babol, shot directly by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran during nationwide protests in the city

Killed by heavy machine-gun fire while standing with other innocent people, shielding behind a wall. His last words were 'I'll go so the next generation can feel freedom.' His family discovered more than 1,400 bodies in the same morgue from that night alone.

Shot with bullets while traveling by motorcycle with his close friend Mehrshad Ragbar. A traditional 'Hojleh' ceremony was held for him according to southern coastal customs, a ritual typically performed for young people who lose their lives in their prime.
Shot in the side while trying to flee. His body remained in his father's car overnight until authorities determined what to do with it.
Died in Borujerd
Shot with war bullet to his eye

26-year-old resident of Qarchak, targeted by violence and suppression by the terrorist Islamic Republic regime forces during Iran's national uprising on 19 Dey 1404, sacrificed his life for the path of freedom and homeland

Shot with direct fire from military weapons by suppressive forces during the Iranian national revolution. He was a 29-year-old owner of a men's barbershop in northern Tehran in the Ekhtiyarieh Shomali area. He was targeted by bullets on Andarzgoo Boulevard on Friday night. After his killing, security agents did not allow his family to hold memorial or mourning ceremonies.
Killed in Karaj on 19 Dey. Family found his body three days after he was killed.
Killed in Garmdareh, Karaj
Shot dead by regime forces. Authorities held his body and banned his family from burial ceremony, from crying, or from mourning. On the day of burial, family was expelled from the cemetery.
Listed in Iran International memorial database as victim of state violence
Killed on 19 Dey month. Body was unidentified for several days and was found with difficulty.
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Mashhad
Killed by regime agents during nationwide protests against catastrophic economic conditions and widespread repression in Hasar neighborhood, Karaj
Death occurred in Malekshahr, Isfahan
Shot directly in the head by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government. He was a 23-year-old Gilaki citizen from Lahijan residing in Fardis.

MMA athlete shot directly by suppression forces while helping a wounded protester at 9:30 PM in Pasdaran neighborhood of Masjed Soleyman. Security forces later buried him as a 'martyred Basiji' with security arrangements at Behesht-e Zahra cemetery in Charbisheh on Dey 25, 1404 at 4 AM. His Instagram photos and videos were removed by security forces.
Shot directly by suppression forces in Masjed Soleyman
Died in Chalus on 19 Dey 1404

67-year-old retired Air Force Colonel and war veteran from the Iran-Iraq war. Shot with two bullets during protests in Kaj Square, Saadat Abad neighborhood of Tehran on Friday evening. His body was found in front of a clinic with emergency medical equipment, including angiocath, attached to his body.
Incident occurred at Kaj Square in Tehran

24-year-old Lor citizen from Lendeh city in Kohgiluyeh and Boyer-Ahmad province, shot directly by suppressive forces during Friday evening protests in Bushehr. Government institutions extorted 450 million tomans from his family in exchange for delivering his body and pressured them to cover up the government killing of their son and blame protesters for his death.
Died on January 9, 2026 in Sabzevar
Died on 18 Dey in Ahvaz. A friend sent his information with no photo found except a video of his daughter sitting by his grave saying 'Forgetting you is an art I don't have at all.'
Died in Sadeh, Isfahan area
Killed by Islamic Republic's suppressive forces
Father of a one-month-old baby, shot and fell into a coma. Even while in coma, his hands were tied to the hospital bed. When the patient companion was changed, IRGC killed him in the hospital.

Student at Shahrood University of Technology, known as 'Mahan Mardani', master's degree student in industrial management, fitness trainer with coaching certificate, and goalkeeper of university futsal team with runner-up achievements. Shot with direct fire near his home around 21:30. Hit by two bullets in femoral artery of his leg causing severe bleeding. Despite injuries, dragged himself to his house door but collapsed upon arrival. Witnesses described the bleeding as so severe 'it was as if they had poured red paint on the street pavement'. Died around 23:00 the same night due to severe injuries and blood loss. Body was buried on January 12, 2026 after family pressure and follow-up.
Shot in the throat by security forces during popular protests, buried in Behesht Roghayeh cemetery
Death occurred in Karaj
Shot directly with bullets by government forces during popular protests
24-year-old from Aligudarz, resident of Isfahan, killed by direct gunfire from government suppression forces during people's protests

Shot by regime mercenaries during December protests in Tehran. Originally from Romeshkan, Lorestan province. Had lost his father and was working as a shop apprentice in Tehran to financially support his family (mother and two sisters aged 15 and 17)

Provincial and national champion bodybuilder. Shot with a war bullet in his leg on Emammat Boulevard in Mashhad on 19 Dey. Family received the body on Sunday with bruising around the neck, cause of death listed as suffocation with plastic. Has two daughters.

Shot in the chest with war bullets by Islamic Republic forces in Fardis. Family was forced to pay 1 billion rials to receive his body and threatened that if they didn't pay, the body would be buried in a remote village. Described as one of the smartest and kindest people the source knew. His second-to-last profile picture was still 'Woman Life Freedom'.
Heavy-vehicle driver and only son of family, son of war veteran, shot from the front with live ammunition by IRGC forces during protests. Killed in the area opposite the waterfall in central Shazand.

Shot by government forces in Golshahr, Karaj. He was a mobile phone shop owner from Gomrok neighborhood in Tehran who had moved to Karaj and worked as a taxi driver due to economic pressure. He had a 17-year-old daughter and a younger brother named Mohsen.

Shot in the stomach with a bullet on 18 Dey near Rasht municipality. Transferred to Arya Hospital where family was told he was bandaged and would be released, but on Friday he suffered bleeding. The bullet had not been removed and due to infection he died on 21 Dey. The medical examiner said 'no operation was performed at all and they were not allowed to operate'
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Salsabil, Tehran
16-year-old resident of Mahallat shot with war bullets by government mercenaries in front of the Intelligence building (Education alley) on the path to homeland freedom
Killed in Khorramabad at age 16 by regime forces. The tweet emphasizes his youth and innocence, describing him as a child and calling for his name to be eternally remembered.
Died in Saeedabad, Shahriar
Killed in Tehranpars district of Tehran
Son, killed with war bullet in chest at 7 o'clock on Friday in Fardis Karaj alongside his 49-year-old father Behzad
63-year-old male from Isfahan documented in Iran International Memorial

Shot directly by IRGC forces' bullets in Abgarm city, Qazvin province. His body was handed over to his family only after three days under severe security pressure. He was married and had a 3-year-old daughter. Despite having a master's degree in physical education, he worked as a driver to support his family.
Shot with live ammunition in Maskan neighborhood of Kermanshah. He was a car bodywork mechanic. The bullet reportedly hit his leg and he died from severe bleeding.
Killed by Khamenei's executioners

Shot in the heart by bullets from Islamic Republic mercenaries. Was the breadwinner for his family. At his burial in Garmab village, according to his will, freedom slogans were chanted instead of holding religious ceremonies.
