Father of two children, killed by the Islamic regime in Malayer
Died in Hamadan
Lawyer and Gilak citizen from Bandar Anzali, shot with two bullets by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government in Rasht city
Fatally shot with pellet ammunition by Iranian regime guards
Died on January 9, 2026 in Mashhad during the protests
Shot in the back with a bullet to the lower back. Father of two children (a son and a daughter).

Shot with one bullet right under his throat during protests. Told friends 'I'm suffocating' before dying. Body was taken to Dezful hospital then moved to Ahvaz. Authorities prevented family from seeing the body or saying goodbye, only allowing direct burial after extensive searching and negotiations.
Died in Yaft Abad district of Tehran
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Malakshahr, Isfahan

Brother of the tweet author, appears to have been killed. Tweet mentions wanting revenge for his blood and refers to him as 'Jan Fashan' (soul-sacrificing). Context suggests he died during protests but specific details are not provided.
Father of two children, from Mashhad, killed by direct gunshot to the head by government forces during popular protests
Father of three young children, shot in the back of the head by regime forces
Documented in Iran International Memorial database as a victim
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Kerman during the protests
Shot in the stomach with a bullet in the small city of Chamgardan, Isfahan province. Father of two children and employee of the Zobahan steel factory.
Killed by agents of the Islamic Republic and Velayat-e Faqih regime in Arak during Friday protests on 19 Dey 1404. Originally from Bazaneh village in Arak county.

Killed in the city of Noor on 19 Dey. Father went to the hospital, took his body, brought it to his grandfather's house courtyard where they washed and shrouded him. He worked at Saeedinia Cafe. Described as energetic and full of hope for life with a bright smile and luminous eyes.

Elite mechanical engineering student at Yazd University shot directly by Islamic Republic suppressive forces. Also an athlete. His death shocked the academic and sports community in Yazd. Local officials' silence about this crime and heavy security atmosphere in the city prevented free and widespread mourning ceremonies.
Shot by direct fire from state forces during protests in Sabzevar, targeted at close range with military-grade weapons
Family is under pressure not to publicize information about his death
Shot by Khamenei's suppressive forces with direct gunfire. His family thought he was detained for all this time until his body was handed over to the family two days before the tweet was posted.
Shot directly by government forces during popular protests in Andisheh New Town Phase 3
Shot on Friday night January 9th in Mashhad. Family found his body after 4 days and had to pay 800 million to receive it

Shot with direct gunfire to the heart by Islamic Republic of Iran Basij forces in Chitgar area of Tehran. Gilaki citizen from Nasafi village in Rudbar, living in Tehran. Body was buried in his birthplace, Nasafi village in Rudbar

21-year-old student at Islamic Azad University, Andisheh branch in Tehran. Sustained severe head injuries during Friday night protests on 19 Dey month. Was transferred to Noor Andisheh Hospital around 8 PM while bleeding from head injuries. Went missing from the hospital and was removed from family access. Family was later informed of her death. According to Kahrizak forensic medical report, time of death was around 2 AM, six hours after initial transfer to hospital, with cause of death listed as bleeding. Two informed sources attributed responsibility for her kidnapping and killing to Ali Khamenei's mercenaries. Different accounts exist about how the fatal injuries were inflicted, including baton strikes or impact with hard objects. Family was required to provide documents to receive her body and are reportedly under pressure and threats.

Shot directly by government forces during popular protests in Isfahan. He was a hardworking hairdresser on Mofteh Street in Isfahan, known for his kindness, compassion, and family devotion. Father of two daughters who devoted his entire life to the peace and happiness of his family. Friends and acquaintances remember him as a calm, kind, and supportive person.
Died in Karaj

Killed during protests in Rostamabad. Shot first in the leg, then after falling to the ground, armed forces approached him and after insulting and cursing him, killed him with a finishing shot. The incident occurred in the area around the Grand Mosque of Rostamabad. His family was under severe security threats during his burial and warned against any protest or information sharing.
Shot directly by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during nationwide protests. Gilaki citizen from Rasht.

13-year-old Kurdish girl shot by Iranian government agents from approximately 5 meters distance while present in a park in Basij township, Keyhanshar boulevard, Kermanshah. She was a teenage champion in Wushu martial arts in Iran. Her mother had died three years earlier and she had no father, living with her aunt. Her body was buried on 21 Dey in Bagh Ferdows cemetery in Kermanshah.

16-year-old student from Bushehr who had a passion for ancient Iranian sports. Shot and killed by Islamic Republic regime forces near the Quran Mosque in Bushehr. He aspired to be a pahlevan (champion).

16-year-old child from Ardabil and wushu athlete, died after 21 days in a coma due to injuries from being shot with military bullets by government suppression forces. He was wounded while trying to save a girl who was being directly targeted during protests on Thursday 18 Dey in Ardabil. His body was buried at 7 AM on 10 Bahman.

Also known as Mohammadamin Parsa, former student of the University of Bologna and Italian-language instructor on YouTube channel Nebia Academy, killed by live ammunition fired by government forces during protests near Vanak Square, had been publishing educational content free of charge on YouTube

Elevator installer, shot in the head by regime's repressive forces on the night of Thursday. His body was withheld from family under pressure and forced commitments, handed over early Sunday around 3:00 AM, and buried just two hours later at 5:00 AM without permission for any funeral or mourning ceremony. Buried under security restrictions in Shahbaz city, in the village of Bazneh. Family was denied the right to hold memorial ceremony.
Killed by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic

Kurdish young man from Kermanshah, shot with a war bullet by Islamic Republic suppression forces in front of his shop in Maskan neighborhood during popular protests on Friday evening 19 Dey 1404. Families reportedly forced to pay between 700 million tomans to 1 billion tomans to receive victims' bodies.
Shot with live ammunition by government forces during popular protests in Fardis. Killed alongside his brother Amir and son Armin while participating as a family in the protests.
From the Yaqoub Vand tribe, married with three children, one of his children is a wrestler, died in Andimeshk city, no photo has been published
Shot directly by government security forces during people's protests. Body was buried in Hashtgerd.

Shot by Islamic Republic security forces at Taleghani (Azadegan) Square in Karaj. Was targeted with direct fire from the top of a building and was hit by three bullets. The bullets hit her pelvic area, spine, and thigh, and she died due to severe bleeding.
Shot with war bullets by security forces in Baharestan, Isfahan. From Izeh, member of Kourkour tribe. Body was buried on January 10, 2026 at 5 AM in Ardal county, Dinaran village.
Shot in the leg by Islamic Republic forces during the Iranian national revolution, died from severe bleeding in Isfahan. He was a resident of Baharestan, Isfahan.
Student from Andimeshk, killed during popular protests in Parand city

20-year-old cashier at Daily Market store on Shamshiri Street in Tehran. Shot with war bullets by security forces at her workplace at 7 PM. Her body was buried at 5 AM. Her family printed her name in an announcement without the martyr title, but security forces attached a paper with the martyr title to her name.

16-year-old Gilaki citizen from Abkanar, born April 1, 1388 (Persian calendar). Shot directly with war bullets from behind during nationwide protests. She was the only child of her family and was shot in front of her parents' eyes. Her body was found and identified by her father, uncle, and aunt's husband around noon the next day in Kahrizak.
16-year-old second-year student of Interior Architecture, shot and killed by security forces of Iran's Islamic regime
Incident occurred in Shahrak Razavieh area of Tehran

Shot with war bullet at 9 PM at home in Isfahan, Felkeh Nobahar area. He was an only child and his parents were severely harassed by authorities for the return of his body, with threats that if they disclosed information, their son would be buried anonymously. He was a mechanic who repaired foreign cars and had 5 apprentices. His garage was located at the beginning of Razmnandegan Street from the Isfahan house side, across from the first intersection. He was planning to return to his own home that week, with his belongings remaining at his father's house. Buried in Behesht Masoomeh Cemetery, Shahin Shahr, section 11.

Shot directly by government forces during protests in Khaneh neighborhood of Isfahan, in front of his mother and grandmother. Several motorcyclist suppressive forces chased him near his home and shot him from behind. The bullet hit his heart area and he was severely wounded. He was transferred to hospital but died hours later from the severity of his injuries. After his death, government agents stole his body from the hospital and the family was left unaware of where the body was kept. Four days later, Pedram Saeidi's body was found and delivered to the family.
Died in Isfahan
Gilak citizen from Shahsavar, killed by government forces' gunfire during nationwide protests in Dey month 1404

Shot by security forces with Kalashnikov rifle during nationwide protests. Bullet hit the right side of his abdomen, causing his death. Worked as a hairdresser in Shahsavar. Was engaged but not yet married.

Went out on 19 Dey (January 8, 2026) in Baharestan, Isfahan and disappeared. Body was identified among the unnamed corpses on 28 Dey (January 17, 2026) and was buried the same day under security conditions. Head and face were unrecognizable. Exact time and manner of death unknown.
Died in Shahrak Andisheh

Taekwondo athlete killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic forces after attending the funeral procession of Kamyab Ahmadi. He was a provincial and national taekwondo champion who had been invited to the national youth taekwondo team in the early 1390s.

Shot by sniper bullet on Hashemi Street in Tehran (above Dostghib) near Hashemi Mosque. According to family account, six people were injured in this shooting, and it was said they had shielded themselves to protect others.
22-year-old 7th semester sports science student. Shot in the heart by regime forces while trying to help his friend who had been shot in the abdomen during protests in Shahriar.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial

14-year-old teenager shot directly by Islamic Republic suppressive forces to the head and eye area during nationwide protests. Family transferred his body to Khalili Hospital in Shiraz. Despite his death, hospital doctor had declared his eye needed to be removed, but hours later after contact from government forces, Pouya's body was suddenly transferred from the hospital. Four to five days later, Pouya Jafari's body was only handed over to the family after obtaining commitments and receiving money. According to informed sources, security agents buried the teenager's body themselves and warned the family they had no right to hold mourning ceremonies. Only his father and mother were allowed to visit the grave, and even at the burial site they were prohibited from crying and mourning. After burial, security forces stationed around the Jafari family's residence and with severe security measures tried to suppress any reaction, gathering, or information sharing about this teenager's killing.
Shot in the head with live ammunition by mercenaries of the Islamic Republic in the city of Lapouei, Fars Province, southern Iran
Shot by direct fire from security forces in Memsani

Killed by direct shooting by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government
Killed at Chaharrah-e Taleghani (Taleghani Intersection) in Karaj
Shot and killed in Karaj. Buried in Imamzadeh Ebrahim in Malard.

Young Kurdish man from Kermanshah killed by direct gunshot from Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Karaj on Friday evening 19 Dey 1404. Shot with war bullets by regime forces.
Friend mentioned he always dreamed of becoming famous and appearing on television. Friend asked if his photo could be shown on Iran International so he could become famous at least after his death
Shot directly by suppression forces in Yazdanshahr, Isfahan. Kurdish ethnicity indicated by surname 'Lor'
Commemorative post by his father after his death. Father said: 'My dear son, with your departure you gave us honor but broke my back. But [you are] sacrificed for dear Iran.'
Death occurred in Shahroud. Listed as entry 1322 in memorial record.

Monarchist citizen from Zirab Savadkoh killed by gunshot from IRGC forces during the national uprising. He had a 7-year-old daughter named Roshana who attended her father's funeral with a toy water gun saying she wanted to kill the police who killed her father.

29-year-old Kurdish man from Kurmanj Kurds, killed by direct shot of war bullet to the head by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Nezamabad neighborhood of Tehran. Less than 24 hours remained until his wedding ceremony. His body was buried on January 12, 2026 in Qale Hassankhan area.
20-year-old from Yasouj, killed by the Islamic Republic in Sar-e Abtaveh
Shot directly in the heart by government suppression forces during protests

Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces on Keshavarzi Street in Isfahan. The bullet hit his heart area causing immediate death. After this crime, security forces put his family under pressure and threats.
Victim being mourned/remembered, described as having a noble and kind face

27-year-old software engineer working in Tehran. Left home on Friday evening January 8, 2026 around 7 PM. In his last phone call around 8:30 PM, he told his family he was fleeing and security forces were pursuing him. His phone was then turned off and he disappeared. After extensive searches by family at various detention centers including Evin Prison, Fashafuyeh Prison, and Tehran prosecutor offices, no official institution acknowledged detaining him. His body was finally identified at Behesht Zahra morgue on January 16. Severe blow marks to the back of his head were visible on his body, and cause of death was declared as 'high-speed projectile impact'. Killed in Pakdasht.

Father of two children (16-year-old son and 8-year-old daughter), owned a shop in Arak. Shot directly with a war bullet by Islamic Republic forces in front of Vali-e Asr Hospital in Arak around 8:15 PM on Friday. The bullet hit his abdomen area and caused his death. Evidence of the bullet impact was clearly visible on his jacket - holes and burns from the war bullet remained on his clothes, indicating direct shooting from close range or with high power. After his killing, his family was pressured and threatened to confirm the government's official narrative about his death, with threats that his children would be deprived of continuing their education if they opposed or told the real story. Despite being from Arak, his body was not allowed to be buried in the city's cemetery. His burial ceremony was held three days later on Tuesday in Qaniaro village near Arak under special conditions and restrictions.
Killed in Ashrafi area of Tehran. Described as someone whose name has not been widely recognized or publicized despite his death.
Listed as victim number 2346 from Mashhad
Originally from Shah-pasand but killed in Gorgan. Was wounded on the first night, but still went out the second night and was shot in the heart.

Shot during national uprising on Andarzgoo Street. Two war bullets were fired at her - one hit her throat area and the other hit her abdomen. She was a 24-year-old fitness trainer and resident of Tehran, working as a fitness coach in sports clubs in northern Tehran. She was the only child of her family.
Died in Saveh during the protests

Shot directly during protests in Anzali. Family was contacted on the night of 22 Dey and informed they were burying the body. The family was not allowed to hold any ceremonies including third and seventh day memorials, and security pressures continue on the family to prevent information dissemination.
Killed during protests in Kermanshah
Killed on 19 Dey in Isfahan. Was buried without notifying his family, who were informed later. Described as full of life and a nature lover.
Shot with a war bullet to the chest area by Islamic Republic suppression forces during direct shooting in the evening of 19 Dey in Shahrekord

Poet and writer shot with a war bullet by regime suppressors. Described as a cultured, moral person and noble child of the homeland. He was not only a father but also a cultural and human voice that was silenced by bullets, leaving his only daughter in eternal mourning. His killing represents the regime's fear of thought, words, and awareness.
Died on Saveh road
Shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic forces in Fardis, Karaj. He had recently become a father and had many hopes and dreams for his child.
Young man from Arak killed by Islamic Republic suppressors during protests on Friday night

Book author and mechanical engineering graduate killed during violent arrest by Islamic Republic agents. Was returning from work to home when security agents arrested her on charges of 'participating in protests'. She resisted the arrest and agents severely beat her with multiple blows to the head area with batons, which ultimately led to her death. Family was pressured by security institutions to declare cause of death as 'suicide', but death certificate records cause of death as 'impact of hard object to head'.

Shot with shotgun that destroyed her face. Family wrote on her obituary that she became a gift to the homeland. Her mother's regret was that she could not kiss her face one last time because the shotgun had destroyed her beautiful face completely. One of her relatives said at her grave that she had many dreams and asked that she not be forgotten.

23-year-old women's football assistant referee, shot directly by suppressive forces during nationwide protests against the Islamic Republic in Isfahan. She was also active in track and field and physical fitness in addition to football. Her body was buried on Thursday 25 Dey.

Father of a teenage daughter, shot by government forces during peaceful protests on Motahari Street while standing next to his wife. Authorities made it difficult to retrieve his body and did not allow printing of announcements or holding ceremonies
Shot by direct fire from state forces during protests in Sabzevar, targeted at close range with military-grade weapons
Died in Mashhad

Shot by government forces during protests. Government agents fired from the top of a bank building opposite the 'Chahar Baradaran' mosque on Motahari Street in Rasht. A bullet hit his leg, and he died at the hospital due to severe injuries and bleeding before receiving effective medical care. He was a Gilaki citizen of Rasht, 41 years old, father of a 16-year-old daughter, and worked as a worker in a supermarket. His family was pressured to sign documents and commitments to receive his body, and a public ceremony for him was prevented.

Shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic forces during anti-government protests in Marvdasht city, Fars province on the evening of 19 Dey. After being wounded, he did not go to the hospital in time due to fear of security forces and died from severe bleeding. He was a teacher. His father was an elder of the tribe and a well-known figure in Marvdasht. Security agencies agreed to hand over his body to the family on the condition that the burial ceremony would be with limited attendance and that the family would declare he was killed by 'terrorists' rather than government forces. The family agreed to the limited ceremony but refused to lie about their son's killers. Security forces prevented his mother from being present at the grave during burial, forcing her to watch from a distance.
Shot by direct fire from government mercenaries in Nasser Khosrow neighborhood of Khorramabad, killed due to severe bleeding
Goalkeeper of Aluminiumsazi Arak football club, shot directly in heart and neck at 21:30

Shot with bullets during protests in Mashhad on his 20th birthday. He had lost his father at age 4 and lived with his mother and sister. Relatives reported he died from excessive bleeding and lack of proper medical care at the hospital.

Kurdish Yarsan young man and taekwondo champion killed by war bullets fired by Islamic Republic suppression forces during protests. Son of Ali, follower of Yarsan faith, national team member and medal winner in taekwondo. Buried at Raqeh Sarab Tiran cemetery in Kuzran on January 11, 2026. Family may have been forced to pay between 700 million to 1 billion tomans to receive his body according to sources.
Killed during nationwide protests in Rasht. He was a Gilaki citizen from Khasmakh village in Fouman suburbs

Shot by Islamic Republic suppressors on Navab Street in Tehran. After her killing, security institutions demanded 500 million tomans from her family to release her body and forced the family to sign a written commitment to declare the cause of death as 'accident' and refrain from any media coverage, interviews, or independent follow-up.

12-year-old Kurdish Yarsan student from Kermanshah, living in Hashtgerd. Shot with two war bullets to the back and back of the neck by Islamic Republic suppression forces using a Kalashnikov rifle. Killed instantly around 9 PM on Friday evening in the street opposite an intelligence center, in front of the governorate building on Ayatollah Khamenei Boulevard. Security forces had suddenly turned off street lights and launched a widespread attack on protesters when she was shot from behind.

Killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces while protesting. Died from being hit by a war bullet. Was a mountaineer who had climbed high peaks including Kamal peak (3700m) in Sahand region of East Azerbaijan province and Shah Moalem peak (3050m) in Gilan province.

Killed by Islamic Republic suppressors. Graphic design graduate who worked as a freelancer, described as kind, calm and beloved among friends. Had participated in most protest gatherings in Isfahan from early Dey month. Last seen participating in demonstrations on 18 Dey. Body was buried at 6 AM in Bagh-e Rezvan cemetery in Isfahan without public announcement and under strict security measures with security agents present. Mother was reportedly threatened by security forces and prohibited from making this case public.
Kurdish citizen from Esfarayen, shot by Islamic Republic's military-security forces during popular protests in Tehran, killed by war bullet
Shot in the head by Islamic Republic forces with military weapons in front of the Fooladshahr courthouse during protests. Also known as Abolfazl Mousavifar, described as a monarchist

Shot from behind with a war bullet in Rasht city. Originally from Arak, had moved to Rasht about a year earlier for work. Was unmarried, worked as a tailor, and had a bachelor's degree in translation. Had saved money to buy a house, but the money was ultimately spent on purchasing her gravestone.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial database
27-year-old Gilak citizen from Chamestan, killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during protests
Shot three times in the side and hand on January 8th in Bandar Abbas. Was hospitalized for two days but was denied medical treatment. Died two days later due to bleeding.

Shot with shotgun pellets by government forces during protests in Ariashahr district. Pellets hit his body and side area, causing severe internal bleeding and lung damage. He was vomiting blood and died from his injuries despite being taken to a private hospital. Family searched for his body for a full day before finding it in Kahrizak among three warehouses full of victims' bodies. Funeral was delayed until January 10 due to restrictions and held under severe limitations. He was unmarried and worked as a car expert.
Shot by bullets from the criminal mercenaries of the Islamic Republic and was buried after one week. Son of Seyed Mahmoud.
Shot with bullet in Felvarjan, Isfahan during protests. Described as martyr on the path to freedom during bloody Dey month.
Body was missing for 4 days before being found. Mother searched for his body for 4 days and was not allowed to place his photo at his grave
Died in Fardis, Karaj

19-year-old wrestler and resident of Shohada neighborhood in Andimeshk. Shot directly by suppression forces on Partou Street during popular protests. Was targeted by sniper fire from a rooftop. The shooting was direct and without warning, with no possibility of providing medical assistance. His body was buried at 4 AM three days after his death in the presence of his parents, without a funeral ceremony and under government surveillance. His family remains under pressure and threats to refrain from informing media about their son's killing. Known as a local athlete in Andimeshk.

Shot with direct gunfire during popular protests. According to eyewitnesses, two bullets hit him and he died on the spot. He was an unarmed protester participating in popular protests against the Islamic Republic. His body was retrieved by his family from Kahrizak on Saturday morning and buried in Lavasan next to his grandmother's grave. He was a barista working in a cafe, lived in Phase 1 of Shahrak-e Gharb. He died on the same night the Saadat-Abad mosque was set on fire. Before attending the protests, he told one of his friends: 'Either everything changes, or I die.'
Commemorated as a gift to the eternal homeland
Two-time national powerlifting champion from Izeh, shot in the chest by government forces during a protest in Baharestan Isfahan. Mohsen Rashidi was killed while trying to help him.
51 years old, father of three children, resident of Shiraz, killed by direct gunfire from government suppression forces during people's protests
Killed in Shiraz, member of Qashqai tribe. Authorities pressured family to hold burial in private without anyone present.

Shot with two bullets to the neck and one bullet to the pelvis. While still alive, was thrown among corpses and died 18 hours later. Family was forced to pay 150 million (currency not specified) to receive the body after three days

65-year-old Iranian-German resident of Cologne, Germany since 1981, chemistry graduate with two children. Traveled to Iran in late December to visit his mother and made a trip from Tehran to Rasht. Killed in Black Friday protests at Rasht Bazaar. Father was Naser Zarrabadi, an old violin teacher.
Killed by the regime. Was a simple motorcycle courier. His father is a war veteran and his elderly mother pleaded not to let her son be forgotten.

Shot with live ammunition in the chest area during suppression of popular protests on Eram Boulevard in Mehrshahr. Shooting occurred around 10:30 PM. Friends transported him by motorcycle to Mehrshahr Central 24-hour clinic. Family searched for him among different medical centers until around 1 AM. Body was kept at home until 6 AM to prevent seizure by security forces, then transferred to Behesht Sakineh morgue in Karaj. Burial took place on 21 Dey but not at the desired location - ultimately buried at Behesht Ali in Mahdasht.
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime during the 1404 protests in Bandar Abbas

Shot with live ammunition from behind while being pursued by Islamic Republic agents, killed when she had reached the parking area of her residence. She was interested in acting and pursued this interest seriously.
Shot directly by security forces near the police station in Rostamkola, Behshahr County, Mazandaran Province. Body returned to family after several days with severe restrictions
Shot by Khamenei's mercenaries in Eslamshahr (Tehran)
Professional handball player and Wushu athlete shot in the stomach by regime's security forces, later died in hospital from her injuries
17-year-old killed in Rudbar

Stopped to help a girl who was being beaten by security forces, was attacked with batons and machetes on the spot and taken away half-dead. Since 19 Dey (January 8, 2026), no one has said he is detained, no one has said he is alive, and there is no news of his body.
22-year-old from Izeh, resident of Fooladshahr, shot from behind by suppressive forces during people's protests

Shot directly in the head by security forces during protests in Yazdanshahr on Motahari Boulevard. Was transferred to Fateme Zahra Hospital in Yazdanshahr the same night and died there. Security forces only returned his bloodied clothes to his family and told them to go to Bagh Rezvan cemetery in Isfahan to collect his body. Family had to wait 5 days before the body was returned to them. He was described as an extremely kind and lovable young man who had returned from military service less than a year ago. He worked as an apprentice in car color identification, working from 5 AM to 5 PM. He was raised by his mother along with his two sisters under difficult circumstances.
Shot by suppression forces in Yazdanshahr

Shot and killed by Islamic Republic security forces during popular uprising. Was trapped in an alley with other protesters, surrounded from both sides by government forces who opened fire. A bullet struck his heart and lungs, and he lay on the ground for about half an hour before losing his life. Was an 18-year-old student set to begin studies in mechanical engineering, from a financially well-off family. His presence at protests was driven by awareness and solidarity rather than economic pressure. Two of his uncles were killed in the Iran-Iraq war, one was a well-known commander. The Golgoon family is among well-known families of the city, and a boulevard in Shahsavar is named 'Golgoon Martyrs'.
Died in Esfarayen

English language teacher and translator, shot directly from behind by Islamic Republic suppression forces in Rabat-e Sevom area of Malekshahr, Isfahan. Family found his body after five days of searching and he was buried in Bagh-e Rezvan Cemetery in Isfahan.
18-year-old student killed by special units of the Islamic Republic suppressive forces during protests. Sourena was a piano player and had a deep love for karting.
Killed by Islamic Republic forces on 19 Dey
Death occurred in Isfahan
Kurdish citizen from Dehgolan arrested by security forces and held without access to lawyer or family visits. Status unknown after two weeks of detention.
Listed in Iran International memorial records

17-year-old student shot by Islamic Republic suppression forces with direct gunfire. Hit by multiple bullets - eight bullets to the side/torso area and one bullet wounded her leg. Died from severe injuries caused by this deadly shooting. Targeted with war weapons during suppression of popular protests.

Turkish protester from Tabriz living in Parand, Tehran. Shot by Islamic Republic forces on Friday evening on Attar 7 street in Parand. Cousin of Sahand Nourmohammadzadeh, a young protester who was sentenced to death on charges of 'moharebeh' during the Woman Life Freedom protests but the sentence was later overturned.
Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces in South Mehrabad, Tehran. He had about five years of experience in wrestling.
17-year-old killed in Marvdasht. Also known as Soheil Almasi.
Shot by Islamic Republic mercenaries, bullet hit his neck and he died
Shot and killed with direct gunfire from behind by terrorist IRGC during the national revolution in Gohardasht, Karaj. Originally from Sabzevar but residing in Karaj.

Shot by security forces in Tehran's 17 Shahrivar neighborhood of Shadabad. Shot first and left wounded on the ground, then agents approached and fired a final bullet straight into his heart. Was a professional bodybuilder. Authorities pressured family to declare him as Basij forces member before releasing body.
Died in Mashhad
Described as 'javidnam' (martyr/one whose name lives forever) in Parand

Shot directly in the heart from behind while trying to save a wounded 17-year-old teenager. He was unarmed and non-aggressive, only moving forward to save a child's life. He fell face-down on the ground and died in the arms of one of his companions. Witnesses describe his body growing cold moment by moment and his eyes that never closed again. He was the first casualty from Narjeh city during the national uprising.

Shot and killed in front of her 8-year-old daughter on the evening of 19 Dey. She had been sentenced to 1.5 years in prison in 2022 and recently received another 1-year sentence, awaiting appeal court.

Shot by security forces during protests in Bushehr on 19 Dey. Her funeral ceremony was held on 26 Dey in Bushehr where family and friends decorated her grave with flowers and candles and sprinkled sugar on her grave.
Official trainer of the federation, killed with a war bullet on 18 Dey

Shot in the leg with a war bullet, then arrested by forces who transferred him to a corner of a park adjacent to the street among trees where he was beaten with multiple baton strikes and ultimately died from the severity of his injuries. Known as 'Son of the Sea' among locals, he was a football coach who worked for years to develop football in the region.
Graduate student in IT field, killed by pellet shot and multiple stab wounds by suppressive forces

Mountaineer athlete and conqueror of several high peaks in Iran and Persepolis football team fan. Shot by security forces' war bullets on Thursday evening 18 Dey 1404 in Tehran. Initially told to family he was wounded and hospitalized, but family was later informed he had died. Authorities prevented delivery of his body to the family. His body was buried after three days.
Documented in Iran International Memorial

38-year-old Gilaki citizen from Lafmajan village in Lahijan county, killed by Iranian regime forces during protests in the Seygalan Square area of Rasht. Family was under severe security pressure after his death and the body delivery process involved coercion, requiring written guarantees from the family. Body was delivered alongside several other victims. Eyewitnesses reported severe, multiple and unusual injuries on his body that were so extensive that determining the exact location of the fatal injury was not clearly possible. No official or transparent explanation has been provided by responsible institutions about how he was injured and died.
Shot from behind on the night of a protest call in Marlik, Karaj. He had worked with great difficulty and hardship to set up a small falafel business. Buried on 25 Dey.

Young man from Esfarayen killed by suppressive forces. He was a tattoo artist who loved Iran and ancient Iranian symbols. He called himself 'Soldier of Cyrus' and had posted about Iranian history and Cyrus the Great on his Instagram. He expressed his beliefs and inner identity through body art.
Killed by IRGC forces in Sadeh Lenjan, Isfahan. His wife wrote: 'My life companion, now that you have gone, all roads lead to dead ends.'
Shot with direct gunfire by suppression forces on Naser Khosrow Street in Khorramabad
Kurdish citizen, killed by gunfire from military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Kermanshah

Kurdish citizen, 47 years old and father of one child, Snapp driver. Shot with war bullet by Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps forces during popular protests in Maskan neighborhood of Kermanshah on 18 Dey 1404. Died after two days of hospitalization at Hakim Hospital in the city due to severe injuries.
Died in Dey 1404 in Noorabad Mamasani
Cabinet maker born in 1368 (Persian calendar). Was wounded and arrested on the night of 18 Dey in Esfarayen (North Khorasan). His body was returned to his family after four to five days.

Kurdish man, father of two children (18-year-old daughter and 25-year-old son). During Thursday protests in a crowd, when a woman was shot and security forces wanted to assault her, he intervened to save her. When authorities told him to leave so they could assault the woman, he refused saying he wouldn't leave until he saved her. Security forces immediately shot him directly. He was taken to hospital where he could potentially have been saved, but medical negligence led to his death.
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime during protests while completing mandatory military service. Originally from Jamalabad village in Shazand.
16-year-old victim from Kermanshah

Psychology student at Azad University of Babol, shot with war bullets by security forces during recent protests in Babol. Identification was made through tattoos on his hands due to his face being covered with plastic during forensic examination

17-year-old from Sari city who was killed during popular protests around 10:30 PM in one of the city's streets by direct shooting from government forces with war bullets. His body was returned to his family after one week. He was only a few weeks away from turning 18.
Killed on Thursday night. According to locals, they were peaceful youth. His face was severely damaged.

19-year-old student from the Bakhtiari tribe, specifically from Dorki clan, Zarasound sub-tribe. Shot by government forces in Isfahan. Family kept his body on ice overnight fearing it would be taken by authorities. Buried in Dorak Shapouri village (Anari) in Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province on January 10, 2026. Funeral held at 5 AM under heavy security presence with widespread government agents present.

18-year-old Kurdish youth from Bijar, killed by direct shooting from government suppression forces during protests. His father was a street sweeper for the municipal office and was forced by government institutions to introduce his son as a Basij member.
Father of two children, described as an unknown hero. Reference to being an 'eternal wound on the chest of the homeland' suggests he was killed during protests.

Shot with direct gunfire to the throat by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic terrorist regime on the orders of Moushaali Fazilabi. He was the breadwinner for his mother and sister, and his family was unable to afford the set amount to retrieve his body, with no information available about the location and time of burial.
Listed as victim number 2156 in remembrance account
17-year-old killed by direct gunfire from security forces during protests in the small city of Qir near Kazerun. A memorial service was held for him where traditional surna music was played.

Shot by IRGC forces during protests in Qir city with direct gunfire. His body was delivered to the family with threats that they must declare their son was not killed in protests and hold the burial ceremony without gathering. The family initially planned to hold the funeral on Friday but officials refused to deliver the body due to crowds and gatherings. His body was buried around 6 AM Saturday with only his father present and four security officers at Qir cemetery.

Taekwondo athlete and 2nd dan black belt holder, shot directly by suppression forces during protests at Mesbah intersection in Karaj. Had previously lost both parents and only had one sister. Was transferred home by friends after being hit by the bullet but ultimately died for his homeland.
Computer engineer and bodybuilder. First hit in the leg by pellet shots, then snipers positioned on nearby buildings shot him in the head and killed him. Also known as Masih.
Young patriot, 33 years old, computer engineer and bodybuilder, shot directly by Islamic Republic terrorists in Gorgan
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial database
Death occurred at Revolution Square in Zanjan
Official bodybuilding federation trainer who was killed during the protests. His mother insisted that his name and photo be shared, wanting revenge and retribution rather than mourning.
Shot with two war bullets. He was a mechanic student and breadwinner for his family, from Seyedi neighborhood in Mashhad
Child killed by regime forces. Described as being from Sabzevar and killed by the child-killers/mercenaries of Seyyed Ali (referring to Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei).
Shot and killed on 18 Dey in Sari. Described as a hero and brave person (دلاور) who was 22 years old.
Died in Tehran during the protests
Death occurred in Tehran
Professional bodybuilder/athlete from Jarquyeh, Isfahan. Shot in the back of the head by regime suppression forces (Basij and IRGC)

Killed by regime's suppressive forces while sacrificing his life for the path of freedom and homeland. He had no father and had also lost his mother, making his orphaned state deepen the wound of this crime. His family and relatives have no voice to cry out.

Kurdish citizen from Javanrud arrested by Ministry of Intelligence forces at his family home. Being held in Kermanshah Intelligence Department detention center without family visitation rights or access to lawyer.

Gilaki citizen from Chalus, shot by Islamic Republic of Iran's suppressive forces during people's protests in Chalus. After being shot and falling to the ground, regime forces prevented citizens from approaching to help and rescue her body by shooting, and anyone who attempted to provide aid was targeted. Several others were killed in this crime. Her lifeless body was left in the middle of the street.

Shot in the throat with a war bullet by regime suppressive forces. Architecture student, professional mountaineer, and resident of Karaj. Described by friends and family as a kind, well-mannered, and always smiling person. His killing is part of the systematic targeting of Iran's young generation during the national uprising.

Taekwondo champion and sports coach who was shot while participating in a protest rally with his family members near one of the police stations in Chalus. He died from three bullet wounds. The shooting was carried out by police forces. According to witnesses, he was trying to help other citizens before being fatally shot.
Died in Chamgardan, Isfahan province
Killed during protests in Chamgardan, Isfahan. Perpetrators identified as Hassan Karimian (head of Basij) and Sheikh Hamid Gholami
Died in Narmak area
Died in Afsarieh area of Tehran
44-year-old from Sabzevar in Khorasan Razavi province, resident of Tehran, killed by direct shooting from government suppression forces during popular protests in Mashirieh area

Shot on Piroozi Street. After being shot, he made it to an alley and gave his phone to someone, asking them to call the last person on his contact list. He died before his family could reach Piroozi Street. Due to security conditions and lack of ambulances around Piroozi Street, Ahmad Abbasi's mother held her son's body in the alley from night until morning to prevent security forces from taking it. His body was eventually transferred to Kahrizak Legal Medicine facility where plainclothes forces kidnapped the body. Authorities are demanding one billion tomans as 'bullet fee' to return the body to the family.
Son of Iran killed for the homeland. His mother died 20 days later from grief over losing her son.
68-year-old two-time Asian champion killed by the Islamic Republic regime in the city of Arak
Architect who was shot from behind with a bullet to the chest during protests. Killed by Islamic Republic security forces with motorcycle units during the Thursday night protests of 18 Dey 1404.
36-year-old bodybuilding athlete killed by gunfire from suppression forces during protests in Mesbah area of Karaj during the Iranian national revolution against the Islamic Republic
Shot directly by government suppressive forces during people's protests

Shot with war bullet to the neck, transferred to Nour Hospital Shahriar, died upon family's arrival, then transferred to Kahrizak and identified among unknown bodies; after identification transferred to Behesht-e Zahra Tehran and delivered after 7 PM, buried with presence of maternal family. Born in Nahavand.

Basketball player and student at Sharif University of Technology, shot and killed by direct fire from Islamic Republic security forces while out on the street during nationwide uprising. He was a member of the Farzan Shemiran 3x3 basketball team which won the Tehran championship earlier that year, and was named Best Player of the Tehran Adult League in the same year.

Shot and killed by suppression forces on motorcycles in Tous52. First shot in the leg with a war bullet, fell to the ground, tried to get up using the wall for support with his wounded leg to escape, then killed by a war bullet to the head while suppression motorcycle forces were moving. Had a bodybuilding gym, was a bodybuilder and athlete with national championship titles in bodybuilding. Born in Mashhad, had two children (a son and a daughter). Body was so large it didn't fit in the coffin. Family was not allowed to bury him in Mashhad and had to bury him in a village, also not allowed to hold memorial ceremonies.

Shot with direct gunfire to the head by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests on 18 Dey 1404. Kurdish Kurmanji from Khorasan, originally from Qahrmanlu tribe and Ostorkhi village in Shirvan county, North Khorasan province. Worked in construction in Tehran, resided in Faruj city in North Khorasan. Married, father of two children. Body buried on 22 Dey 1404 in his native Ostorkhi village. Security agencies took commitments from his family for receiving the body. Had been previously arrested by security forces.
Young patriot from Chamestan city, Mazandaran province, killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic terrorists during patriotic protests

Shot with direct gunfire to the spleen and thigh area during the national uprising on Daneshju Boulevard in Gonbad Kavus. His father Hussein Shah-Ali, a veteran theater actor, was forced under pressure to sign documents confirming his son's killing by terrorists to receive the body. The burial was conducted with security forces present and they were not even allowed to print a condolence announcement. Ahmad's cafe was sealed. He was professionally involved in bodybuilding and in his last message wrote: 'It's passing from us, God willing the next generation won't see the Islamic Republic anymore.'
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Malard
Shot in the head with a war bullet while returning home from work, targeted by suppressive forces
Death occurred in Karaj
University student (2020 entry cohort) studying manufacturing engineering at Noshirvani University of Technology in Babol, killed during Thursday night protests on 18 Dey
Killed in Kahrizak, identity visible in videos showing casualties

21-year-old medical student at Tehran University of Medical Sciences who was killed on the 18th (18 Dey). Her body was not allowed to be buried for nearly five days, and when finally permitted, it was done at night with only her parents present. Her parents were under heavy security pressure and did not inform friends or students about the burial until the students found out themselves.
18-year-old from Arak

Shot in the heart on the night of 18 Dey 1404 by Islamic Republic forces in Shahr-e Rey. He was a 33-year-old master's degree student with an HSE bachelor's degree. Colleagues described him as very kind and helpful, full of life's passion with many plans for his future. He loved to travel and had visited many cities in Iran.
17-year-old Arab teenager, son of Faleh, from Ahvaz's Boroumi (Kareet) district, killed by direct gunfire from suppression forces during protests.
Died in Qods city, Tehran province
Killed on 18 and 19 Dey (January 8-9, 2026) in Karaj during protests for freedom of the homeland
Was deaf (ناشنوا بود)

Former political prisoner who was shot in the chest and killed. Before his death, he expressed knowing he might not survive and said he was going for his people, for Mahsa Amini, for Nika Shakarami, for Iran.
21-year-old patriotic youth from Koohdashte, Lorestan province, killed by direct shooting in Fardis, Karaj on 18th Dey

Killed in Qods city. 35 years old. Had two children. Had recently bought a house. Was very hardworking, working two shifts to make ends meet. Was very brave and said on Thursday that anyone who doesn't go has no honor. Ultimately became a hero with honor.
Killed during protests in Mohammadshahr, Karaj. On Thursday night he was returning from work, got out of his vehicle on the way, joined the protesters and was killed.

Killed on 18 Dey in Kuhdasht, Lorestan. Posted a video on his page the same evening speaking in Luri language, saying they were going to the streets for Mahsa and Nika and the people of Iran, hoping Iran would be free by 10 PM that night if they stayed alive. Ended the video with epic Luri poetry.
From Salas-e Babajani living in Qeshm, killed by direct gunfire from repressive regime forces during protests. The regime demanded 1 billion tomans to hand over his body to the family.
Shot with direct fire by government suppression forces during people's protests. Originally from Miyaneh, resident of Tehran.

Doctor who left his home on Thursday January 8th, 2026 around 6:45 PM to participate in nationwide protests in Sari. After six days of enforced disappearance during which his family searched hospitals, police stations, detention centers and morgues receiving contradictory and misleading responses from authorities, his body was identified at the medical examiner's office. Examination showed he had been shot in the side area. It remains unclear whether he was shot and killed immediately on the street during protests, or whether he was wounded and then died from blood loss while in custody of security forces without medical attention, or whether the shooting occurred during detention.

Kurdish youth from Gilan-e Gharb (Gihelan) shot by IRGC forces with a war bullet in the upper right kidney area at 11 PM during protests on 19 Dey. Transferred to surgery by his mother, was in operating room until 5 AM on 20 Dey. Family found his body among hundreds of corpses wrapped in black bags at Kahrizak Tehran and had to pay 700 million tomans to retrieve his body
Shot from behind on Tous Boulevard in Mashhad
Father who died alongside his daughter Shiva Javid. Buried in Behesht Reza cemetery, Block 50, Row 30, Section 15

Shot with pellet bullets during protests in Andisheh, Tehran. Born in 1366, originally from Bijar, living in Andisheh New Town. Father of two children (9-year-old daughter and unborn child - wife 7 months pregnant). Worked as furniture repair craftsman from 7 AM to 11 PM. Previously wounded in leg during past protests. Shot twice with pellet bullets - one to lower abdomen, another to leg hitting main artery. Severely injured, taken to hospital, spent several hours in coma. Despite initially coming out of coma, died from severe infection caused by pellets and lead entering body after several long surgical operations. Funeral held with security forces present.
Arrested by security forces on January 8, 2026 and killed in detention. He was the head of the boxing committee of Poldokhtar county.
Incident occurred in Dowlat-Abad area of Tehran
Shot on Bahman Street in Mashhad. Born in Ordibehesht 1390 (April-May 2011). Family may be afraid to share photos.

Killed in Najaf Abad, Isfahan. Civil engineering student who completed his degree in Dey month (winter). Orphaned from age 2, raised in orphanage in Dezful. Former teacher knew him from 2008 when he lived at Behzisti facility. Had previously studied architecture, worked full-time while studying civil engineering which was his passion. Was about to get his engineering license. Described as having hope for life and future plans.
From Sabzevar in Khorasan Razavi province, resident of Tehran, killed by direct gunfire from government suppression forces during popular protests in the Narmak neighborhood area

18-year-old Kurdish youth from Kermanshah, originally from Amirabad village in Eslam-Abad Gharb (Shabad) in Kermanshah province, residing in Shahin Shahr, Isfahan. Shot directly with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests on the evening of Friday 19 Dey 1404. Had 3 gold medals in bodybuilding and was preparing for competitions. Family was able to retrieve his body after several days and bury him in one of the cemeteries of Eslam-Abad Gharb, but were not allowed to view the body.

Father of three children and recently became a grandfather. Had a freelance job. Went to the streets to protest on Thursday 18 Dey in Tehran, Poonak area, but never returned. After several days of no news and worry, his family finally identified his body in Kahrizak among a pile of corpses.

19-year-old Kurdish citizen from Bijar arrested during popular protests in Tehran by government forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran and transferred to Greater Tehran Prison. Suffers from epilepsy and has been deprived of access to medication and medical care since arrest despite urgent need for regular medication

18-year-old first-term architecture student shot directly by government forces with two war bullets that hit his heart during protests. His body was delivered to his family four days after his death, with delay. During this period, the family was repeatedly offered to have him introduced as a 'Basiji' member, which the family explicitly rejected.
Killed during protests. The poster mentions this was their cousin who was killed on the first night of the call/protests. The family has no one to advocate for them.
Killed by government forces during protests on Thursday and Friday in Noor, Mazandaran
Poet and member of Iranian Writers Association. Security forces raided his home and violently arrested him. Brother of Anisha Asadollahi, imprisoned labor activist.

Shot by sniper in the heart from the top of Saderat Bank building in Yaftabad area of Tehran District 18. Family was forced to bury him in a village due to pressure and threats. Security forces from Avaj repeatedly contacted and threatened his family when they wanted to bring the body to the village.

Shot directly by suppression forces in Isfahan. Was taken to hospital where first hospital refused to accept him and second hospital kept him waiting for hours while he continued to bleed severely. Footballer and athlete. His body was held for 10 days before burial was permitted on 28 Dey.

Left home at 8 AM on January 8th from Felakeh Sevom Tehranpars area and never returned. Family searched for him for 5 days with no information provided by authorities. His body was found at Kahrizak forensic medicine facility on Friday. He had been professionally stabbed in the femoral artery near the groin area with a knife. Authorities pressured family to declare him a martyr to receive benefits and free funeral services, which the family refused.
Killed by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic on Thursday night in Fardis, Karaj
Died on Shariati Street in Tehran
Shot with bullets in Narmak. Had a tattoo on his hand that testified to his courage.
Shot by gunfire, worked as a visitor/inspector, had two children
Shot directly in the heart by government suppression forces during people's protests in Mashiriyeh

Shot with two war bullets in the stomach on Nabard-e Piruzi Street, Abyaneh intersection. His family was forced to sign that he was a Basiji member. His neighborhood was Piruzi (Victory). Had social media accounts dashali.f and work page soleygeo.
Hairdresser, resident of Varamin, shot in the leg and stomach by security forces during popular protests

Shot in the stomach with a military bullet on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) in Parand. Despite undergoing two surgeries and initial recovery, doctors authorized his discharge. However, suspiciously on 20 Dey his family was notified of his death. His body was not returned to the family until Wednesday. He was 30 years old, born and resident of Tehran, married for 3 years, worked as a pharmaceutical visitor, was an only child, loved football and bodybuilding, had strong perseverance and rapid progress at his company, was cheerful and full of enthusiasm and hope for life and dreams of a free Iran, loved his family and the home and car he had worked hard to acquire two months earlier, was beloved by all and full of good memories.

Shot directly by Kazem Estvari, commander of the Revolutionary Guards of Saadat Shahr county, at the main circle of Pasargad. From Ali-Abad Komin in Pasargad. His mother had died six months earlier; he had one brother and one sister.
Killed by Islamic Republic forces in Mashhad. The tweet refers to the perpetrators as 'terrorists of the Islamic Republic'.

21-year-old player for Sepahan youth football team, shot with war bullets by government forces during popular protests in Isfahan. He was unarmed and posed no threat to security forces when directly targeted. A promising football talent whose life and dreams were violently ended as a result of the bloody suppression of popular protests.
Father of two daughters aged 1 and 2.5 years, car dealership owner, resident of Sain Qaleh Zanjan, killed during people's protests by direct gunshot to the head from government suppression forces

Father of two teenagers, employee residing in Shahrolvand, Qazvin. Killed by direct gunfire from government forces during public protests. His body was handed over to his family with conditions and a pledge not to hold any ceremonies.

Shot by suppressive forces with direct gunfire while helping an injured woman trapped among garbage bins during nationwide protests. Three bullets hit his head, face, and heart. His body was transferred to Kahrizak after being killed, and his family found and retrieved his body after 3-4 days of searching among corpses. He was a hairdresser who also worked with motorcycles.
Killed along with his father Hossein Joanbkht by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic
Shot at 9 PM by Basij forces from the rooftop of Basij base on Kashani Street, where they opened fire on the crowd. In his last message, he told a friend 'I'll take your place so they don't get you.'
Died on January 8, 2026 in Tehran

27 years old, single, pharmaceutical company employee, resident of Felvarjan Isfahan. During people's protests, was first severely beaten by government suppressive forces and then shot in the forehead with a fatal bullet.
Shot directly in the head by Islamic Republic suppression forces during the national uprising
Shot with a final bullet to his face. His family is under pressure, and authorities did not allow him to be buried in Behesht Zahra cemetery.

Disappeared on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) at around 80 years old. Body was found after 10 days and buried without ceremony. Family and relatives are under pressure and are not familiar with social media.
Died in Tehran on January 8, 2026
Killed near Fallah area, Baharan Square, during clashes near Abuzar Mosque which was set on fire

2-year-old child from Dahaq, Isfahan, shot in the side with a war bullet by Khamenei's beasts while sitting on his father's shoulders. Body was kept in snow from that night until morning and buried the next day. Family is under severe security pressure.
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Qarchak
Listed as victim number 1048, died in Dehaq, Isfahan

Shot with war bullets by government forces in Tehranpars district of Tehran. Originally from Borujerd, born 1366 Persian calendar. Killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic suppression forces, demonstrating the use of war weapons against unarmed people during bloody suppression of popular protests.

42-year-old protester from Sarjoub Hesar area of Karaj, shot by government forces during protests. He was an only son in a 4-person family, worked in home repair and renovation with his father. His wife is 7 months pregnant and they were expecting their first child after 14 years of marriage. He was a supporter of Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi.
Killed by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic during protests and the security atmosphere

Shot and wounded by Islamic Republic suppression forces on Abbas Abad street in Arak during protests, then arrested. His body was found three days later several kilometers away from Arak near the prison.
Butcher by profession, shot in the head in one of the districts of Karaj, father of three children aged 2, 8, and 13

Memorial post with poetic text suggesting death, possibly related to Iranian protests. Text includes farewell message: 'My mother, I'm going but I'm always with you, when you see a purple butterfly it's me, clouds in the sky you see, it's me...'

Shot with bullets in Ariashahr district of Tehran on the evening of 18 Dey. When his body was delivered to the family, severe injuries, bleeding, and signs of the body being dragged on the ground were visible on his face. He was a father of three children who had recently become a grandfather and owned a takeout restaurant. Security forces forced the Oruji family to bury his body the next day before 5 AM.
Victim from Fardis, Karaj area in Tehran province
Killed by direct shooting by government forces in the area of Bagh Rezvan Isfahan

21-year-old only child of his family, died in custody after arrest by security forces. He had taken shelter in a residential house with several others when a neighbor reported their location. Security forces arrested everyone present. Family was told not to worry and that he would be released in the morning, but the next morning his body was found beside one of Tehran's highways in the Imam Ali highway area. Death occurred after arrest and while in custody of security forces.
Shot in the head from behind in Chalus. No funeral ceremony was allowed.
34-year-old young man shot in the head by direct fire from Khamenei's agents in Gorgan
Shot directly by the Islamic regime forces
From Zeynabiyeh area of Isfahan, was a student at an MDF workshop. Became eternal (killed) on Thursday 18 Dey month on Hassan Ghorbani Street.

Shot in the head by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran in the vicinity of Bagh Melli Lahijan. His body was held by security agencies for a period, and his family only managed to retrieve the body after paying 500 million tomans. He worked at a restaurant and lived with his mother. His body was transferred to Isfahan for burial.

Shot in the side/torso area during protests on Piroozi Street in Tehran. He was the only child of his family and son of someone killed in the 8-year Iran-Iraq war. Both father and son gave their lives for their homeland. The night before on 19 Dey, he witnessed widespread crimes by suppression forces and personally took many injured people to the hospital, but despite seeing all those crimes, he was not afraid and stayed until his last drop of blood for Iran.
Persepolis football fan who died (specific cause not mentioned in text)
Shot by snipers who targeted tall individuals with headshots during protests near the city television/screen. The incident occurred near Lahijan governorate.

Shot directly from behind by Hashd al-Shaabi forces in Fallah neighborhood, 5 days before his 20th birthday. His face was unrecognizable due to the severity of the shooting. His body was transported to Gorgan at night with ice molds. Brother of Green Movement martyr Reza Shokri.
Slain by regime forces in Lahijan. Brother of Ali Shoosh who died in 2023 from torture injuries sustained in 2022.

22-year-old electrical engineer shot with war bullets by IRGC and Basij forces on Palestine Street in Qazvin. He was fleeing from agents with his cousin when directly shot with war weapons. Suffered severe bleeding and died before reaching medical center due to severity of injuries.
19-year-old computer science student at Najafabad University. Shot in the head with a war weapon during protests in Falavarjan

26-year-old killed in Malayer on 18 Dey month. He was the breadwinner of his family. He saw officers beating some people and went forward to stop the officers, and the beasts of the Islamic Republic shot him in the head from the rooftop.

Electrical engineering student shot with war bullets from behind and side in Emamiyeh Square in Mashhad. Father Hassan is a war veteran from Iran-Iraq War with 8 years of service, is a war-wounded and chemical warfare victim
Died in Marvdasht

Shot and killed with two war bullets by a sniper in Moaliabad, Shiraz. Was a newlywed, married just a few months before his death. Family had to pay 1.5 billion rials to retrieve his body after extensive efforts
Shot in the head with a war bullet by the Islamic Republic government in Tehran. Originally from Akanloo village, part of Shirin Su, Hamedan.

Father of two children, shot in the chest with pellet gun by government forces around 19:30 in Fardis area of Karaj. His body was transferred to Kahrizak after being killed. He was a well-known businessman in Fardis who supported both his own family and elderly parents, known for his good behavior and responsibility. Photo shows him at the grave of Pouya Bakhtiari, a victim of November 2019 protests, indicating he was a protester seeking justice for victims of the freedom movement.

Kurdish citizen from Bojnurd, shot by military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Tehran, hit by live ammunition and killed. His body was delivered to his family at Kahrizak morgue and burial ceremony was held on 20 Dey in Bidak village, Bojnurd.

17-year-old teenager shot with five bullets from behind on the night of 18 Dey. Khamenei's mercenaries abandoned his body in a secluded place after killing him, and his corpse was only found the previous night. His mother suffered a heart attack following these crimes.
Shot directly in the head (مرگ دراثر شلیک مستقیم به سر). Martyred in Bandar Abbas, Hormozgan province, Iran.

Law student, shot by regime suppression forces during national uprising. Described as a conscious, promising young man concerned with justice who became a victim of government bullets instead of sitting in his classroom. Part of organized killing of Iranian youth during the national uprising.

Shot directly in the neck by Islamic Republic sniper from a rooftop during protests. He was a 40-year-old resident of Golpayegan who worked for years as a heavy vehicle battery mechanic in the city and was father to a 10-year-old son.
Shot in the head with a bullet on Hezar-o-Yek Shab Street in Kerman. His daughter was supposed to have her wedding the following week. Family is under pressure.

Shot directly in the head at close range by forces affiliated with the Islamic Republic at 8 PM in Ariashahr area of Tehran during the revolutionary uprising. He was the cousin of Ali Javaheri-pi who was among the victims of PS752 flight. He had been married for only six months.

From Sahneh county in Kermanshah province. After finishing high school, came to Tehran to work - did various jobs including selling fruit juice, driving agency cars, construction work, while learning auto body repair and painting. Was a monarchist who supported His Imperial Majesty Crown Prince Reza Shah II. Killed during national uprising of Iranian people at a Friday rally in support of the Crown Prince in Tehran. Had orange hair, memorable laughter, was a skilled footballer whose dribbling moves are still remembered, and loved his dog.

Shot by Islamic Republic suppression forces during national uprising. Had two bullet wounds on his face - one in the eye area and another in the chin area. Also had wounds on his body that resembled machete strikes according to his relatives, and the injuries were crudely stitched. Body was identified at Kahrizak forensic medicine after 13 days of searching by family through hospitals, police stations and security centers. Brother identified the body through tattoos. Family was prohibited from holding any public mourning ceremonies.
Shot by government suppressive forces during nationwide protests. From Dizicheh in Isfahan Province. Described as one of Iran's children who paid the price of standing for freedom with his life.

27-year-old Gilaki citizen from Rasht who was killed. He was a footballer with great passion for football, but had stopped professional activity in this field to provide for his family. His body was handed over to the family three days after being killed and was buried at night.

Shot by government forces in Shahrak Andisheh. 21-year-old kickboxing champion and IT student at Semnan University. Mother called him on the evening of 18 Dey but another person answered his phone. When family arrived, they found Alireza unconscious and he died before reaching the hospital. Government forces threatened his family that they would be 'destroyed' if they published news about his killing or spoke to media.
Died in Piroozi area of Tehran
Killed on the night of 18 Dey in Rasht

Shot with two live bullets from behind, hitting his neck, by regime's repressive forces. Fruit seller with a pickup truck and sole breadwinner of his family. Shot in the head from behind while protesting in Tehranpars with friends. Had a twin brother Amirreza, owned a Kia parts shop in Cheragh Bargh, loved music and dancing. Was rushing to Aryashahr for safety after a relative called urging him to leave when he was hit. Rushed to Tehranpars Hospital where staff tried everything but he died from the headshot. Urologist at Atieh Hospital. Arrested approximately two weeks ago after leaving his clinic. No information available about his whereabouts or condition since the arrest.

28-year-old monarchist and opponent of the Islamic Republic, shot by Islamic Republic suppressive forces on Andarzgoo Boulevard in Tehran alongside his close friend Mohammad Golriz. Funeral held on Wednesday 24 Dey in Lavasan.

Shot by security forces during protests in Shahrak Andisheh Phase 1. Was chanting slogans with friends when security forces suddenly opened fire from an unknown location. Four war bullets hit him. PhD student in laboratory sciences. Shot by sniper from top of police station in Haft Tir area of Mashhad with war bullets. 17-year-old boxing athlete killed in Chalous. According to relatives: 'One person was shot, he went to help rescue them, they shot Amir too. Shot with war bullets from behind by Javidan terrorists. He was an only child from Bistjan village in Isfahan. Art university student and life coach/healing practitioner. Born in 1369 (Persian calendar), resident of Majidiyeh neighborhood in Tehran. Shot directly in the head in Majidiyeh neighborhood in front of his sister's eyes.

Shot with bullet by Islamic Republic forces on Moallem Street in Rasht. Cause of death officially recorded as 'bullet impact' and registered in his burial records, clearly indicating he was killed by direct gunfire.

Shot from behind on Keshavarz Boulevard in Karaj. Lost his father several years ago. Family was forced to pay one billion [rials/tomans] to receive his body and were not allowed to hold a funeral ceremony for him

Shot in the heart with a bullet. Son of Youssef. Had a master's degree in electrical engineering. Was an only child. Family was harassed for days to retrieve his body. Family was forced to hold burial ceremony at 4 AM with only a few people present.
25-year-old from Rasht. Described poetically with reference to Ferdowsi's characters Siyavash who passed through fire without being burnt by lies, suggesting he died with honor and truth

Shot with war bullet during protests. Originally from Zahedan, owned a cafe called 'Be Vaght-e Cafe' (Coffee Time Cafe) on Daneshgah Street in Zahedan, then moved to Tehran and opened the same cafe on 17 Shahrivar Street in Tehran. Has a 10-year-old son.

Student at Islamic Azad University of North Tehran, studying microbiology, admitted in 1402. 26-year-old single man working at a private company, arrested by security forces on January 8, 2026 in Gorgan. His lifeless body was handed over to his family five days later on January 13, 2026. Shot in the neck with a bullet during protests in Najafabad, Isfahan. The tweet notes that direct shooting at protesters constitutes a clear violation of the right to life and prohibition of lethal use of force against citizens.
Killed during protests in Najafabad, Isfahan. He was in love and had a dream to open his own café. Heartbreaking images from the scene of his death were received.

Shot in the head with a war bullet during nationwide protests in Gorgan. Turkish citizen from Khalkhal, residing in Gorgan. His body was transferred to his hometown after six days in a security atmosphere and buried in Khalkhal county.

Shot directly in the heart by security forces' bullets. Mining engineer who had always dreamed of becoming a journalist and was passionate about telling the truth. He was a passionate fan of Naser Hejazi and like Hejazi never bowed down, stood by his principles and beliefs until the last moment.

Shot by security forces while participating in protests. Came from Mohajeran neighborhood to Arak to take part in the protests and was killed by gunfire from criminal forces.

Shot directly in the heart by Islamic Republic mercenaries on 18 Dey in Neyshabur. He was wounded and transferred to Hakim Hospital. Amirreza arrived at the hospital alive but doctors were not allowed to treat him and he died

Shot by government forces with two bullets to the heart and shoulder area during protests in Yaft Abad, Tehran. 17-year-old student from Shandiz who was arrested on January 5 amid the protests, released, then returned to the streets. 19-year-old medical student at Urmia University of Medical Sciences.
