Buried secretly in Elias-Abad village, Qaemiyeh, without any identification on the grave due to family being threatened and prohibited from sharing information.

Kurdish Kurmanj young man from Esfarayen, killed by direct shooting of two war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces to the neck area during popular protests. His body was buried in his mother's village 'Chaharborj' in Esfarayen district.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial
Killed in recent days during protests. No further information available at the time of reporting.
37-year-old bodybuilder, killed by regime forces in Sadeghieh, Tehran
25-year-old only child and IT engineer, shot and killed in the evening in Haft-e Howz, Tehran

Shot with a war bullet to his side and kidney at Haft Howz/Narmak area of Tehran at midnight. His body was transferred to Kahrizak and family received the body with difficulty on 20 Dey. The funeral ceremony was heavily secured with security agents present around the house.

Married young man shot with two bullets - one to the back of the leg and another to the lower abdomen - on Naser Khosro Street at the beginning of Tehran Street in Bandar-e Anzali. Died before reaching the hospital.
Died in Gorgan
Shot with live ammunition directly to the heart area on Piroozi Street in Tehran
Listed in Iran International Memorial as a victim

Shot in throat area by war bullets during protests in Chalous. He was targeted by barrage of gunfire from Islamic Republic forces in the upper bank area of Chalous. His mother searched for his body from around 9 PM until 8 AM and after hours of uncertainty, found his body. Gilak citizen from Chalous, law student and hairdresser.
Worker killed during protests in Saveh. He was a follower of the Yarsan faith and from Dalahu city in Kermanshah province. He had three children named Danial, Mardin and Bania.
Died in Mashhad
Killed by direct shot to the head in Fars Province. Had a case file from the Mahsa Amini uprising but continued to protest and gave his life for Iran's freedom.

Killed by Ali Khamenei's mercenary forces with war bullets, batons, and machetes. His mother found his body frozen in the morgue after 9 days and buried him with her own hands after 33 years of raising him.

Shot by a cleric from the Taheri family while trying to help his wounded friend. The cleric shot him from on top of a mosque. Aref was from a Bakhtiari family from Khuzestan, had come to Dargahan in Qeshm to work as an apprentice, and had recently opened a cafe. He was from the Qandali (Gandali) tribe near Masjed Soleyman. The shooter was a Bakhtiari Lor from Koohrang in Chaharmahal and is now the Friday prayer leader of Dargahan.
Killed in Mashhad. Described as having endless purity and goodness, but no mention of him anywhere.

Shot by security forces during protests. First shot in the side while still alive, then executed with a shot to the head. This method constitutes a deliberate execution and extrajudicial killing. Family was forced to pay 750 million tomans as 'bullet fee' to retrieve her body. Her body was buried eight days after her death at 6 AM under strict security measures.
Listed as victim #135 in memorial account
Shot with war bullet during nationwide protests in Lahijan. Mother Mojgan Tahvildari published a video on Instagram saying goodbye to her son.
17-year-old Kurdish child from Kangavar city in Kermanshah province, killed during popular protests by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran's suppressive forces

25-year-old Kurdish man from Saqez, resident of Kish, killed by direct shooting by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Kish, Hormozgan province. His body was handed over to his family after receiving 700 million tomans by security institutions.

Killed after leaving home out of concern for his brother when he heard gunshots. Brother of Amirhossein Eshghi who was shot near Yaftabad police station. Both brothers were buried together in a two-story grave.

23-year-old psychology student at Borujerd University shot directly by Islamic Republic agents. Government institutions held her body hostage for four days, demanding the family declare her affiliation with Basij before releasing the body. Family refused this condition. Body was finally buried on Monday January 12, 2026 with limited family attendance under strict security measures and presence of plainclothes officers. She was a 1402 entry psychology student who worked while studying and was planning to continue education abroad.
Died in Tehran

Shot directly by Basij and IRGC forces during popular protests. Bullet hit his heart area, causing his death. From Babameydan, a suburb of Noorabad Mamasani. His gravestone bears the inscription 'For what sin were you killed?' representing the family's quest for justice and collective conscience of society.
Killed for his country, described as a child of Iran killed in the path of homeland. From Nurabad Mamasani in Fars Province.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial

Shot with military bullets by government forces in Karaj Square on Thursday January 8, 2026. He was severely injured and immediately arrested by suppression forces. His body was delivered to his family several days later showing evidence of two bullet wounds. He was unmarried, had no children, and worked as a bazaari (merchant) in Tehran. Despite being wounded at the scene, he was arrested and his fate remained unclear until his body was returned after three days. His body was transferred to Sakineh Cemetery for burial.
36-year-old artificial flower vendor from Shush, shot and killed in South Mehrabad. Authorities forced his elderly mother to sign papers stating he died of natural causes before returning his body.
Victim of state violence during Iranian protests
Rapper shot in the leg on 18 Dey in Isfahan and died from severe bleeding
Shot by security forces during popular protests in Shahin Shahr, Isfahan Province

21-year-old Kurdish man from Badrah county in Ilam province. Shot and killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Ilam on Thursday evening 18 Dey 1404. Son of Mokhtar, from Sartang village in Badrah county, Ilam province.

Shot in the head with a war bullet at Felakeh-ye Sevom (Third Circle) in Tehran-Pars area of eastern Tehran around 11 PM while participating in protests. His body was taken to a hospital and family was contacted at 2 AM. He was a worker who had previously worked in mechanics and recently changed his profession to building painting. He had posted a story before the protest saying 'This Thursday-Friday we're going to walk the city with friends. If there's a one percent chance I go and don't return, celebrate for me in the upcoming festivities.' He was buried in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery in Tehran.

19-year-old nephew of Amir Teimouri, resident of Falah neighborhood in Tehran who had gone to visit Amir's house in Fardis for a gathering. Killed alongside his uncles Amir and Omid by gunfire from war weapons by Islamic Republic's suppressive forces on Sar-e Canal area of Fardis (main street). Family was pressured and threatened by government forces to receive the bodies and forced to bury them secretly.
Died in Karaj
17-year-old child from Tehran, killed during popular protests at the beginning of Piroozi Street by direct shooting from government forces, struck by war bullet

22-year-old only child from Arak. Parents had waited 18 years to have a child. Authorities demanded either 1.5 billion rials or would falsely register him as a Basij member on his death certificate. Father paid the money to retrieve his son's body.
Shot with two bullets to the heart and neck by Islamic Republic suppression forces during Vavan protests. Kurdish citizen originally from Divandarreh. Had recently completed military service.
Polymer engineering student at Science and Research University, killed by Islamic Republic forces during the suppression on Thursday 18 Dey
17-year-old child from Mashhad, Khorasan Razavi province, killed by direct shooting from government suppressive forces on Thursday evening

English language education student, national fitness champion, international Kyokushin champion, and official trainer for the World Dog Federation. Shot with a military bullet by Islamic Republic suppressive forces in the kidney area during suppression of popular protests in Zanjan. The severity of injuries from the military bullet led to the death of this young athlete and student.

Shot directly in the head with a war bullet on Ferdows East Boulevard between Ali Hosseini and Erik streets. He was a 26-year-old resident of Thailand, born in Jannat Abad neighborhood of Tehran. He had only been in Iran for two days from Thailand to visit friends and family. As a supporter of Prince Reza Pahlavi, he participated in the protests in response to calls made for building a better future and life for the people. His family found his body after three days of searching, and authorities demanded 2 billion tomans (compared to the usual 700 million tomans) for the release of his body due to his family's good financial situation.
Died in Tehranpars, Tehran during Dey 1404
14-year-old from Shahriar, Tehran area

Killed by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic regime during protests in Lahijan. His mother had not seen him for years due to immigration and was planning to travel to Turkey in the coming months to see her child after 7 years, but the regime left the longing for this reunion in their hearts forever
Shot by regime forces in Yousef Abad area of Tehran. Family is under pressure to claim he died of heart attack instead of being killed by gunfire.
Rapper and composer, resident of Shahrak-e Gharb area of Tehran. Joined protests in Naziabad area. Was targeted with two war bullets to his throat and back and was killed.
14-year-old brother of Amirhossein, found dead in the morgue of the forensic medicine center

21-year-old sixth-term mechanical engineering student from Mashhad shot and killed with war bullets by agents of the Islamic Criminal Republic. After his death, suppressive forces pressured his family to present him as a 'government martyr', but the family refused. His funeral was held under heavy security.

Kurdish student killed by gunfire from Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Mashhad, struck by war bullet. Burial ceremony held on 23 Dey at Behesht-e Reza cemetery in the city.

20-year-old Lor protester from Rostam Babameydan shot by Islamic Republic suppressors. Bullets hit his heart and side. Body returned to family with conditions of no media coverage and no use of banners in the city (which is Lor mourning custom). Buried in his native village of Nogak in Rostam county with large attendance at funeral.
Younger brother of Mohammad Rahmani, arrested together by security forces on 18 Dey 1404 and transferred to an unknown location. No information available about their condition or whereabouts.

21-year-old computer engineering student shot with war bullets from behind by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic regime during the national uprising. Killed for standing with the people and accompanying the Iranian people's national uprising.

Shot directly by government forces during popular protests in Shahin Shahr, Isfahan Province on Thursday January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1404). He was hit by a bullet in his side, which initially caused injury but after four days he died due to the severity of his wounds. His body was buried on Friday January 17, 2026 (26 Dey 1404) in Behesht-e Masoomeh Cemetery in Shahin Shahr. He was married with two children.

Killed by the Islamic Republic regime. Was a barista and bartender, a young man who built his life with his own hands. His last story was a cry of honor: 'History is made by those who did not fear and did not surrender.' He did not fear and did not surrender; it was the terrorist regime of the Islamic Republic that fears the youth. Became a martyr for the homeland.
Shot from behind and killed by regime forces in Andisheh neighborhood of Shahriar. His family was not even allowed to hold a memorial ceremony.
Shot with direct gunfire by suppressive forces during national uprising in Iran. Killed for standing with the people and demanding life and freedom.
Shot with bullets by suppressive forces during protests in Chalus. Was an accounting student and worked as a barista.
Shot with four war bullets during protests - one to the heart, one to the shoulder, one to the shin, one to the wrist. Married father of two daughters aged 1 and 7 years old.
Died in Narmak district of Tehran. Persian birth year 1398 indicates born around 1398 + 621 = 2019, making age approximately 27 years old in 2026.

Shot in the head by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic regime suppression forces during popular protests and the Sun and Lion Revolution at Meraj Square in Mashhad. She was completely unarmed, standing with her father and mother, and died in her father's arms. She was a law graduate.

Female protester and mother of a 9-year-old child, killed by direct gunshot to the head by government agents in front of the governorate building in Gorgan, in front of her family members during protests. Agents were shooting at protesters from inside the governorate building.

Originally from Sarab, resident of Eslamshahr. Shot during protests on 18 Dey 1404 (January 8, 2026), hospitalized for one week, died from infection caused by war bullet. Father of two children aged 11 and 9. Buried in Eslamshahr cemetery.

Shot in the head with a war bullet during Iran's national uprising. Her body was found after several days of searching among corpses transferred to Kahrizak. She was active on social media and her last Instagram story was an AI-generated image of herself embracing Iran. Described by loved ones as a person who loved life, nature, dance, and Iran. Her crime was loving Iran.
Shot by suppressive agents of the Islamic Republic regime during Iran's national uprising in Rasht. Killed with gunfire from regime forces while participating in protests.
Died in Fardis, Karaj
Shot directly from behind in the heart area by IRGC (Pasdaran) forces during the national uprising
Shot to pieces (پرپر شده) in Kazerun. Limited information available about him.
Died in Shirvan, North Khorasan province
Death occurred in Kermanshah on 18 Dey 1404
Shot by regime mercenaries during national uprising in Rasht on 18 Dey. Severely wounded by gunfire and died due to severe bleeding and prevention of timely transfer to hospital.

Shot dead with live ammunition by the regime's security forces. Born in Karaj, later lived in Hamedan. Youngest in his family, described as kind-hearted nature enthusiast and passionate hiker who deeply loved the earth.

Born 1373, resident of Hamadan. Shot with war weapon by Islamic Republic forces in Tehran on the evening of 19 Dey. His body was buried on Wednesday morning 24 Dey under pressure with very limited presence of family and relatives. He was a nature lover who enjoyed mountaineering and hiking in nature; a peaceful person who had no armed role in the protests.
Listed as victim number 87

Shot directly in the chest with a war bullet in front of Rajai Hospital in Tonekabon (Shahsavar). Shot by suppressive forces. Brother of Farzali Ashkurqorbani who was killed as a fighter in the Iran-Iraq war in 1987 in Sumar region.

Shot in the chest by live ammunition fired at close range by suppression forces directly in front of Rajai Hospital. Struck in the chest by live ammunition, resulting in immediate death at the scene. Brother of Farz-Ali Eshkevar-Ghorbani, a veteran killed in 1987 during the Iran-Iraq War.
Killed by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic in the city of Farakhshahr
Died in Tehransar, Tehran on 18 Dey 1404
Shot in the leg with a bullet in Babol. Security forces reportedly prevented his admission to hospital and he ultimately died due to severe bleeding. He had a 9-year-old daughter.

59-year-old war veteran, married with two children, resident of Nazarabad, Karaj. Shot with pellet bullets by Islamic Republic forces at close range in Hashtgerd, Karaj on January 9, 2026. He was hit in the head, face, heart and lungs. He was severely injured and remained in a coma in hospital for one week before dying on Friday, January 16, 2026. His body was only handed over to family after intimidation and threats, with conditions that burial be done in secret and no memorial ceremonies or gatherings be held.
Shot with war bullets by regime mercenaries during protests. Born in Arak.
Gilaki citizen killed by Islamic Republic armed forces during protests in Rasht, northern Iran
40-year-old from Dareh Zhir (Mahdiyeh district) in Kermanshah
Shot by suppression forces (نیروهای سرکوب). From the Lor ethnic group.
Father of two daughters aged 8 and 12. Wife says everyone's name is listed except her husband's, suggesting he was a victim whose name was omitted from official lists or memorials

Owner of the 'Smoke Burger' restaurant, shot straight in the heart by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic terror forces during protests. Killed by a regime sniper. He loved cooking, nature, and playing the guitar. He was not a threat, not armed, and was living his life.
Death occurred in Shahrak Andisheh area
Murdered by Islamic Republic while fighting to liberate Iran. His parents were forced to declare he died in a car accident.
Killed during protests in Kazerun
Shot with a war bullet in the head area in Rasht, Golsar
Shot by direct fire from government suppression forces during people's protests
Shot by direct gunfire from Khamenei's mercenaries in Nazi-Abad, Tehran. Was buried in Arak due to heavy security pressures. Had a 4-year-old son who is missing his father these days.
Killed alongside his wife Mansoureh in Bushehr, leaving two young children orphaned
Died in Zanjan on 18 Dey 1404
Died in Mashhad on January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1404)

Shot directly by government forces from behind during popular protests in Tehran, with a military bullet hitting the spleen area. Originally from Mazandaran province, resident of Rudaki neighborhood in Tehran. Body was handed over to family after payment of fees, and security agencies prohibited any ceremonies. Buried in his birth village under strict security measures without public ceremonies.
Shot in the head and heart during protests on Ashura Street in Bushehr. Had two children aged 7 and 10. Came to the street for freedom and prosperity of the homeland.

33-year-old Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, resident of Daredarez neighborhood. Shot with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during evening protests in Daredarez neighborhood. His body was handed over to family after extensive follow-ups on Saturday 20 Dey 1404 (January 10, 2026) and buried on Sunday 21 Dey 1404 (January 11, 2026) in Anjirbane Avarehali village cemetery in Sarpol-e Zahab. He was married and father of two daughters.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial. Located in Dareh Rizh area of Kermanshah.
Details not specified in the source

Kurdish Yarsan citizen from Qasr-e Shirin, Kermanshah province. Shot and killed with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces during public protests in Tehran on Thursday evening 18 Dey 1404. He was targeted by direct shooting of war bullets.

Shot and killed on Thursday 18 Dey 1404, minutes after identifying a suppressor and announcing it. He worked with his father in a dry goods shop in Astaneh, Gilan. Security forces reportedly set part of his father's shop on fire.

14-year-old Gilaki citizen from Sangar, shot directly by security forces in the municipality area of Rasht. Bullet hit his leg causing severe bleeding that led to his death. Body was returned to family after several days upon payment of money. Buried at midnight with security forces present and only his parents allowed to attend. Family was not permitted to hold a funeral ceremony.
16-year-old from Fallah, Tehran, killed by gunshot. A notice was posted at his grandmother's house door. His father had recently passed away. The exact date is uncertain but was around 18 or 19 Dey.
Listed as killed in Esfarayen city

Father of Danial Mostafavi. Shot and killed along with his wife and son while sitting in their private car during peaceful protests when government forces opened fire on their vehicle with a barrage of bullets.

Killed during violent suppression of popular protests in Tehran. From Ingijeh village in Salmas county. Part of over 200 people reportedly killed during several days of protests in Tehran. Many victims were from various Kurdish cities including Gilan-e Gharb, Ivan-e Gharb, Abdanan, Marivan, Bukan and Salmas.
Died in Kermanshah

Shot in the throat with pellets at close range in front of Yazd governorate on Friday 19 Dey. His body was found on Thursday 25 Dey in Khaladebarin cemetery labeled as unknown identity. Family was allowed to bury him on Sunday 28 Dey with the condition that no slogans be chanted.

Kurdish citizen killed during protests in Narmak, Tehran with three war bullets shot to his back and legs. His body was delivered to his family after 6 days. He was a cabinet maker and financial supporter of his mother and sister.
Shot in the head by sniper fire. Death certificate states cause of death as 'impact of high-speed projectile objects to the body'

24-year-old law student at Razi University Kermanshah, killed by regime suppression forces in his birthplace Kerman. His mother was photographed holding his photo and crying out: 'Khamenei, now rule! Khamenei, now rule over the blood of our children that you killed.'

Shot directly in left side at Haft Howz, bullet entered left side and exited right side destroying all internal organs, died instantly. Body was left in a garden where friends found him and brought him home. Family attempted first aid including applying pressure to wound, CPR, and heart massage but he had died from internal bleeding. Was wearing a shirt that read 'A soldier for life'

19-year-old student from Sonqor, resident of Karaj. Shot along with his parents while sitting in their private car during peaceful protests. Government forces opened fire on their vehicle with a hail of bullets. Their bodies were transferred to Sonqor and buried before 6 AM under strict security measures with enforcement by authorities.

Shot with a war bullet by suppressive forces in Qazvin. According to reports, the bullet hit his head. He was an automotive electrician from Ramhormoz, Khuzestan, of Lor ethnicity, who had migrated to Qazvin about five to six months earlier for a better livelihood. He was a hardworking young man striving for his future.

Shot at close range to the face during protests at Coca Cola intersection in Tehran around 9:30 PM on 18 Dey. His face was completely destroyed by the gunshot. Body was returned to his brother 6 days later on 24 Dey. Buried on 25 Dey at 10:30 AM in section 251, row 116, number 14.
Shot by suppressor forces on Thursday 18 Dey 1404. Body was kept at home until morning so they could bury him. Bakhtiari ethnicity.
From Bazoft in Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province, shot directly by suppression forces in Baharestan, Isfahan
Died at 8:10 PM in Marlik. Described as becoming eternal/martyred ('جاویدان شده')
Shot directly by suppression forces in Shahin Shahr, Isfahan

Shot with buckshot at close range, pellets perforated his spleen causing internal rupture and severe bleeding. Killed in Yaran neighborhood of Shahrak Valieasr, Yaftabad. Was among the first casualties in the early hours. Had been a longtime protester who was fearless and brave despite having two young children. Would travel to help and participate in protests in other neighborhoods of Tehran and Qom in previous days before Thursday and Friday
Died in Vakil Abad district of Mashhad

38-year-old teacher and father of three 3-year-old triplets named Alma, Pasha and Gersha. Shot directly in the side with a bullet in Isfahan. His body was kept for six days and then delivered to the family under pressure and threats, with demands that they declare the cause of death as 'being a Basiji' and 'killed by terrorists'.
Shot directly by suppression forces in Fardis
Father of two young daughters, shot in the eye during protests in Fardis
Death in Qarchak
Married with three children (triplets), killed by direct shooting by the Islamic Republic

19-year-old Kurdish man from Dehgolan living in Tehran, killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests. His body was buried at night under heavy security conditions, with mourners singing 'O Martyrs' and chanting 'Kak Diako is a hero, martyr of Kurdistan'.

18-year-old Kurdish citizen from Salas-e Babajani in Kermanshah province, resident of Qeshm, shot directly by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during popular protests. Family received his body three days later after paying one billion tomans

36-year-old graduate law student (criminal law), was targeted by plainclothes forces after being chased in Elahiyeh neighborhood of Kermanshah. He was severely wounded by war bullets in the crowded street. His family found him after searching, but he had died.
25-year-old cousin of the tweeter, mentioned in context of being added to a list (presumably of protest victims)

Kurdish citizen from Saqqez, worker and father of two children. Shot by military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Tehran on 18 Dey 1404, and died the next day in hospital due to severity of injuries.
Gilaki citizen from Bandar Anzali shot with a war bullet. Exact location uncertain with conflicting reports between Bandar Anzali and Rasht.

Futsal coach and father of two children, shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces at 21:30 while driving his car towards security forces in the main square of Neyriz, Fars province. He was targeted with shotgun fire from approximately 20 centimeters away while behind the steering wheel. Despite being transferred to Neyriz hospital, he died about half an hour later due to the severity of his injuries. He was married and father of a young daughter. Security forces held his body for two days and threatened his family not to hold any gatherings or protests. His body was finally buried at 2 AM on 22 Dey in complete silence under security forces siege, alongside the body of Amirmohammad Kohkan. He was a close friend of Amirmohammad Kohkan who was killed on 13 Dey in Neyriz.

Shot by security forces while trying to help an injured person during nationwide protests in Kalachai, Gilan. He was shot from behind by a security officer while attempting to move the injured person away from the conflict area. His body was buried three days later around 5 AM under strict security measures. Family was not allowed to hold public ceremonies and were prevented from visiting his grave even for the third-day memorial. The area around his grave was closed off with armed officers stationed there, and strict restrictions were imposed including preventing vehicles from stopping near the mosque.
Shot with bullets by Islamic Republic suppressors during protests in Babol
Listed in Iran International Memorial - specific circumstances of death not provided in available information
From Saqqez, worked as a caretaker in Tehran. Shot in the forehead by a sniper in front of his young child.
Died during the 2025-2026 protests in Tehran. Birth year listed as 1393 (Persian calendar).

Kurdish father of three shot by security forces at a protest. Had posted on social media hours before: 'We ourselves never had any luck, nor did our children ... We grew up with war and hunger, our children with sanctions, power cuts, water shortage, and pollution ... God, in the end, what will become of our children.'

Shot during national uprising. Attacked suppression forces with bare hands at Laleh Alvand Park in Qazvin. Used a fruit vendor's four-wheeled cart as cover and advanced to within meters of security forces. Was hit by three war bullets to his chest and stomach. Taken to hospital while conscious and speaking, family visited him, but hours later family was notified he had died. Killed in hospital.

Shot directly in the throat and several other parts of his body while engaged in hand-to-hand combat with several suppression forces. Died from bleeding caused by throat wound. Was single and had been supporting and caring for his brother who had cancer, covering his medical expenses.

Shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic security forces during popular protests in the evening of Thursday 18 Dey 1404 in the Falkeh Qahramanan Miyanrud area of Shiraz. He was hit in the neck with a war bullet, also shot in the arm, and his hands and feet were severely wounded with pellets. Born in Firouzabad, residing in Shiraz, had a diploma degree and owned a leather bag production unit. Had returned to Shiraz only one year ago after about 20 years away from family. After being wounded, he gave phone numbers he remembered to someone present to contact his family with his mobile phone. His body was only handed over to the family about a week later. Security forces pressured the family to hold the funeral quietly without announcements and only in early morning hours within a family framework. He was buried in his birthplace next to the grave of Raha Bahloulipour.

Dual Iranian-Swedish citizen who had traveled to Iran to visit his family. Shot on the street and taken to the hospital. While still conscious, he gave his name to the medical staff, then disappeared. Twelve days later, his body was found in Kahrizak. Due to severe swelling, the body was no longer recognizable, and his family was only able to identify him by a tattoo on his hand.

Employee at Kowsar Clinic and former security guard at Valiasr Hospital. Shot during events at Shora Square after going to investigate reports of a fire at his former school. Struck by both pellet rounds and live ammunition in the abdomen, heart, and temple. Body released to family after 4 days. Family rejected authorities' offer to attribute the killing to protesters in exchange for monetary payment.
Incident occurred in Azimiyeh area of Karaj
Shot directly by government forces during protests in Chalous. Described as someone who gave their life for their royalist beliefs, responding to pro-monarchy sentiments with sacrifice.
Died in Hoseinabad, Karaj

Killed during Iran's national uprising for standing alongside the people; described as sacrificing her life for freedom and homeland. Victim of systematic violence and suppression by the regime against defenseless people.
Mother of twin young sons, shot directly in the heart by government suppression forces during people's protests

Shot from behind with a war bullet while standing at the end of her street in Taq-e Bostan Boulevard neighborhood. Suffered severe tearing of abdomen, intestine, uterus, and bladder. Kermanshah emergency services refused to send an ambulance to transfer her to hospital. She was a 42-year-old supervisor at Imam Ali Hospital in Kermanshah, a diabetic mother with poor eyesight, and had a sister with kidney problems. Her father had died years earlier and she was the breadwinner and 'pillar of the house' for her family.

30-year-old English and German language teacher who was directly shot by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic during the national uprising in Tehranpars neighborhood. Despite his mother's warning not to go to the streets, he had left home. Government agents shot a bullet into his side at close range. After being hit, he managed to reach a nearby house but died from severe bleeding. The family was contacted through his phone and transported his body.

Barista and Gilak citizen from Lahijan, killed during protests by direct shooting with four bullets fired by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces. Had been previously arrested in 2022. His brother Ali Shush was also killed by government forces during 2022 protests.

Shot directly in the heart by a sniper positioned on Goldis building in Ariashahr on Thursday 18th, in front of Goldis next to the taxi station of Shahrziba and Dehkadeh. Friend took him to Ibn Sina Hospital. Family searched for him until 4 AM when hospital staff showed photos from morgue. Body was found at Kahrizak morgue after searching through approximately 1500 body bags. Buried on Saturday in section 329, upper alley of Hamidreza Rohi's house area.
Kurdish citizen from Lumar, Ilam Province, killed during popular protests in Varamin, Tehran Province, by gunshot from military-security forces of the Islamic Republic

Shot and killed by direct fire from security forces. Four bullets hit his head area and one bullet hit his leg. After his death, security agencies demanded 800 million tomans from his family to hand over his body. Family faced extensive pressure, threats and harassment during the process of receiving the body and holding burial ceremonies.

Shot by direct gunfire from security forces. Four bullets struck his head and one hit his leg. Security agencies demanded 800 million tomans from family for releasing his body. Family endured extensive pressure, threats, and harassment during body retrieval process and funeral arrangements.
Shot with 3 war bullets in front of the governor's office in Rasht. He was from Someh Sara, Gilan. Described as talented, language teacher, calligraphy master, and ranked in ping pong competitions.
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Rasht
Kurdish young man from Kermanshah shot by direct fire from Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Jafarabad neighborhood

Shot by three bullets in Tehran's Persian Gulf district, fired by forces of the Islamic Republic regime. Body retrieved by family from Kahrizak three days later on January 11. Was a dedicated athlete and wrestler, former champion in youth category with passion for professional motorcycling.

Shot with three direct bullets by regime suppression forces in front of Mashiriyeh police station. After his disappearance, family and relatives searched for him until Tuesday, and finally on Wednesday his father was contacted to come to Kahrizak for body identification. Concealment of the body and delay in notification and delivery of the corpse is part of the regime's suppression and forced disappearance pattern.
Building electrician who loved movies and cars. Shot in the head during protests. His funeral was held under his legal name Ali at Agha Seyyed Mohammad Lahijan.

Killed during popular protests in Lahijan. Real estate consultant, described as a healthy, athletic, and energetic young man. His family was forced under pressure to bury his body at night and in silence to prevent public ceremonies and popular protests. Described as a protesting young man who was tired of existing conditions, not a terrorist or rioter.
Citizen of Zarin-shahr who sacrificed his life for freedom during Iran's national uprising, victim of the bloody suppression by the terrorist Islamic Republic regime
Shot directly in the heart by government suppression forces during people's protests. Originally from Satarkhi, a suburb of Shirvan, but living in Mashhad
Died on January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1404) in Bumehen
Listed in Iran International Memorial as a victim

57-year-old Gilaki citizen from Lishavandan village in Shaft county, killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces in the ice factory area of Rasht city. Father of three children.
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Eslamshahr
Shot directly in the heart with a bullet during the Iranian National Revolution protests in Gohardasht, Karaj

Shot during clashes at IRGC headquarters in Shah-pasand on Thursday 18 Dey. Protesters had burned police vehicles, Basij base, courthouse, governorate, municipality and banks before reaching the main IRGC base where 'real war' began.
Targeted and killed by suppression forces in Khorramabad. From Delfan.

25-year-old from Qeshm city. On the first night of the protests, he courageously provided shelter to young people and prioritized others' lives over his own. On the second night, the regime's agents deceived him with cries of 'help help' and as soon as he opened the door, they shot him directly in front of his parents' eyes. Killed at home through deception and close-range shooting, part of the criminal pattern of the terrorist Islamic Republic regime during the Iranian national uprising.

Kurdish citizen shot with war bullets by Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) during popular protests in Eslamabad Gharb city, Kermanshah Province. Burial ceremony held on January 10, 2026, at Cheshmeh Khani Chikan Mansouri cemetery.
Barista at Cafe Melo, Gilak citizen from Sari. Injured on the same night as Mohammad Ebrahimi, hospitalized for several days, died two days before this report due to severity of injuries
Shot directly by Islamic Republic terrorists in Rasht city. 31-year-old patriotic young man from Rasht

25-year-old Iranian citizen killed during nationwide protests in Dey month. Arrested on 18 Dey 1404 in Punak neighborhood by Islamic Republic security forces. Family searched for him from that day but were unsuccessful in finding any trace of him.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial database
Murdered by the Islamic Regime on Taghbestan Boulevard in Kermanshah. His body was taken by authorities who allegedly planned to falsely claim he was IRGC
Victim documented by Hengaw Organization for Human Rights
Shot by police on the evening of 18 Dey in Fardis, killed in front of his brother. Brother emphasized he was killed by police bullet and refused to sign martyrdom consent form
Injured by baton strikes on January 8, 2026 (18 Dey) in Revolution Square, died on January 14, 2026 (24 Dey) due to being denied medical care
Suffered brain death from multiple baton strikes to the head and was killed by Khamenei's criminal regime

Shot by security forces during protests in Ariashahr neighborhood of Tehran. Had a royal crown tattoo on his right hand finger. After he was killed, security forces shot at the tattoo on his finger while collecting his belongings.
Building construction engineer shot in the heart with a war bullet fired from Khorzough police station on Thursday. His wife is pregnant with triplets and the children unfortunately died.

Shot directly in the head by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic with a sniper rifle, likely a Dragunov weapon. Security forces returned her body to the family on condition that she be introduced as an active Basij member. She was a Lur-speaking citizen from Basht city in Kohgiluyeh and Boyer-Ahmad province, had one daughter who is a student in Isfahan. Buried in her birthplace, Dareh Rahmeh in Basht city.
Death occurred in Mashhad on 18 Dey 1404
Shot directly by suppression forces. Body was buried on 29 Dey (January 19, 2026) under strict security measures.

Shot by Islamic Republic snipers during popular protests in Fouladshahr on 18 Dey. Bullet hit his head from above the rooftop and he died on the spot. He was a 28-year-old welder, son of Ali Mardan, Bakhtiari ethnicity, who worked mostly in Asaluyeh to make a living. After his killing, authorities withheld his body for several days and demanded 800 million tomans for its release. When the family couldn't pay, they were forced to claim Farshid was a 'Basiji' to get his body back. His body was finally buried on 29 Dey in Fouladshahr.
Died in Islamabad-e Gharb, Kermanshah province

37-year-old Kurdish man from Kermanshah, mechanical engineer, shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Kermanshah on the evening of Thursday 18 Dey 1404. He was directly targeted and killed by suppression forces.

Killed during violent suppression of people by forces affiliated with the Islamic Republic through direct gunfire. According to relatives, three war bullets hit his leg, heart and head, and a shotgun pellet also hit his face. Relatives and eyewitnesses remember his bravery and consider his killing a clear example of Khamenei's suppressors' crimes against protesters.
Mother of two children. Shot with bullets to the neck and leg. Her last words to family were that she was going to get her children's rights.

Shot three times in the neck, heart and shoulder while giving shelter to protesters in Kooh-chenar neighborhood of Fars Province. Ambulance arrived three hours later but it was too late. Officials demanded 400 million tomans from the family to release the body.
Killed in service of homeland, described as a child of Iran. Occurred in Haft-e Howz area of Tehran. Has no close relatives to seek justice for him, so Iran itself seeks justice.

Father of a 2-year-old daughter. During protests on 18 Dey in Tehran, after tear gas was fired, he and his companions went missing. Family searched for days and found his lifeless body in Kahrizak on 24 Dey
Hairdresser who was shot and killed with direct gunfire. The shooting targeted unarmed protesters, specifically aiming at the head and vital organs, showing clear intent to kill.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial

Shot in the side (pelvic area) in Ariashahr district of Tehran. Gilaki citizen from Lahijan residing in Tehran. Mother of two children. Family was unaware of her fate until January 19, 2026 when they received a call from Kahrizak for body identification and delivery.

Shot by Islamic Republic forces with two war bullets - one to the heart and one to the leg. Shot from behind, with the first bullet hitting her leg. She was the youngest child in her family, had been married for 1-2 years, and worked in the clothing industry for over 20 years before marriage. Family considered her the 'light of the house' and emotional pillar of the family.

Dental assistant shot directly in the heart with a war bullet by government suppression forces during popular protests in Fallah neighborhood of Tehran. She was targeted by a sniper positioned on top of a mosque near the gathering site at 7:30 PM and died from her injuries at the hospital despite medical staff's efforts.
Nuclear physics engineer and inventor of nuclear chips. Described as a scientific elite who sacrificed her life for the homeland. Killed on 18 Dey in Hashtgerd.
Killed by regime agents in Karaj. Mother of a 10-year-old child. Buried in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery in Tehran

Shot by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during protests near Rasht municipality. First hit by shotgun pellets in her leg, then after being moved to a nearby alley for potential medical transport, security forces arrived, beat her, and shot her in the genital area. She was hospitalized in critical condition and unconscious for two days before dying from the severity of her injuries. She was a Gilaki citizen from Sangar.

Shot directly in the head with a bullet during protests. From a very religious family that did not allow the truth about her killing to be spoken at her grave. She chose to go to the streets and stand with the people despite family pressure.

Kurdish citizen from Esfarayen city in North Khorasan province, killed by direct gunfire from government forces during popular protests on one of the city streets. Hours before being killed, she had written in her last social media story: 'Tonight I'm going out for my children, because they have the right to have a good life.'

Shot by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Isfahan. She was the accountant of 'Bargh Sepehr' shop on 'J' Street. Was targeted with weapon fire in front of her young daughter. Islamic Republic forces targeted her head with their weapon. The shooter was from Basij forces.

Shot while returning home from work in the Kakh Circle area of Gorgan on the evening of Thursday January 8, 2026. She was a 20-year-old athlete and physiotherapist. After being shot, she was transferred to Panj Azar Hospital but died two days later due to the severity of her injuries.
Shot directly in the head by government forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran. Citizen of Talesh from Anbaran village. Body was buried in Anbaran.
Memorial record indicates victim from Fooladshahr, Isfahan
Singer and pianist killed by three bullets fired by Islamic Republic forces, just five days before his 24th birthday. Described as having a peaceful, poetic, and artistic life.

Shot with over 100 pellets, then killed with two war bullets from a Kalashnikov rifle. One bullet hit him from behind and the second was fired directly into his heart from the front as a coup de grace shot. His body was held by security agencies for several days before being returned to family under security conditions. Burial was restricted to between 2 AM and 7 AM, and he was not allowed to be buried in Shushtar city cemetery.
Shot by suppression forces in Shushtar city. Lur ethnicity.
Shot in the head with a war bullet in Ferdowsieh, Shahriyar

Off-road racing champion from Qazvin. Shot first in the hand and then in the stomach on Yakhchal Street in Qazvin. Transferred to Pasteur Hospital where surgery was reportedly successful. However, at 5 AM Friday morning, he was shot with a finishing shot at the hospital and killed. Described as a planned field execution and example of the regime's policy of slaughter, elimination and assassination of defenseless citizens.
Kurdish citizen and retired teacher, shot by Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) forces during popular protests in Kermanshah central square
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Tehran

Owner of 'Linda' flower shop on Ghadamgah Street in Shiraz. Shot directly by suppression forces after giving shelter to several protesters. According to local sources, after some time he stuck his head out of his house door to make sure the suppression had ended, when suppression forces immediately shot him in the neck and he was killed instantly. Reports indicate indiscriminate shooting and targeting of citizens who were helping protesters.
Baloch citizen from Hirmand living in Golestan, killed by direct gunfire from suppression forces during nationwide protests in Varamin, Tehran. Burial ceremony was held under security measures.

Baloch citizen killed in protests in Pakdasht, Tehran. He was from Deh-dust Mohammad village in Hirmand township and lived in Kalokan village in Khan Bebin, Golestan province. He worked as a guard at a factory in Varamin.

31-year-old Kurdish student from Mahabad killed in Tehran. Body returned to family for 700 million tomans. Security forces and IRGC buried her body themselves in the black bag without allowing family to wash, shroud or conduct proper burial rites. Family only allowed 3 minutes to see her face. IRGC special forces stationed outside family home with vehicles and weapons. Several people arrested during funeral ceremony. Family charged 250 million tomans per bullet. Authorities pressuring families to register their deceased children with government Martyrs Foundation.

Emergency medicine specialist at Hashemi-Nejad Hospital in Tehran, arrested and transferred to women's ward of Qarchak Prison. During arrest, security and judicial agents forced her to sign a document with unspecified content. Family was kept in the dark about her status and location for two weeks.

Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppressive forces in Fardis, Karaj. He was a production line worker at 'Toga' company. After his death, the company deleted all his information and records from their systems due to fear of security pressures. Security forces did not allow his family to bury his body in Karaj. The family was forced under pressure to transfer his body to northern Iran for burial in one of the villages in the Savadkuh region. This represents the regime's policy of creating terror, controlling burial ceremonies, and preventing public gatherings at victims' graves.

Young man from Shirvan who was either executed by the regime or was previously arrested and killed in detention on 18 Dey month. In a video he had posted on Instagram, he said: 'Come out, what more do you want? Worse than this? Come, I have one life to sacrifice for you.' These words were his last message to the people to continue the struggle.

Shot by direct sniper fire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces. The incident occurred on the first night of protest calls in the area of Qaleh Hassan Station 1. He had only gone to a shop to buy something and was targeted for shooting because he was wearing a mask. The bullet hit him and caused his death on the spot. He was a worker and had a young child.

Basketball player, Iranian university championship winner, and basketball coach. Shot in the chest by Islamic Republic suppression forces during Iranian national revolution in Ariashahr, Tehran. Family searched for his body in Kahrizak for two days. Family faced security threats during burial. His nephew was arrested before burial. Security agents threatened the family that if slogans were chanted during the ceremony, they would not see him. Finally buried in Asadabad, Hamedan. Had a master's degree in physical education from Beheshti University, played with Pegah Hamedan basketball team in the premier league, and was champion of university competitions with Beheshti University team alongside national team players like Behshad Arabzadeh and Amirhossein Rezaifar. Had a 3-year-old son.

Shot in the head while trying to help someone who had been hit by pellets in front of the Shahrqods governor's office. He was buried two days later in his birthplace Tuyserkan. He owned a barbershop on Imamzadeh Street.
Died in Mashhad on 18 Dey 1404 during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests
40-year-old from Arak, killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces during protests on 19 Dey in Golestan Eslamshahr. His body was buried in his birthplace, Arak

19-year-old patriotic daughter shot by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic terrorists in Fardis, Karaj, just five days before her birthday during protests. Killed by direct shooting while fighting for freedom and homeland.
Killed at Seyyed Heshmat and Shahrestani intersection, mostly with heavy machine gun (doshka). Part of 61 people killed in one incident over two days.

Manager of Azam company in Rasht, shot on Saadi Street. According to witnesses, bullet hit artery in his leg. He came home and rang the doorbell, his wife took him to Pars Hospital but bleeding was severe. Authorities told his mother to tell them where to go until they extracted her son from the ground and took him to the desert.

Father of a 6-year-old daughter. Shot by sniper during protests in Fardis, Karaj and died from facial injuries. Two of his friends tried to transport his body by car but Islamic Republic forces prevented them and transferred the body to the coroner's office. His family faced pressure and threats when trying to retrieve the body. They were told they could only bury him if his name was registered as a 'Basiji' or if they paid 1 billion tomans. The family refused these conditions and after four days, through persistence and contacts, they retrieved the body. The family was warned they had no right to hold mourning ceremonies and were denied permission to bury him in their preferred location. According to authorities' orders, Hamed Basiri could only be buried in Eshtehard, Karaj.
Shot directly in the throat and received two bullets to the waist by security forces
Shot and killed by Ali Khamenei's mercenaries. Described as field execution against defenseless compatriots, part of organized policy of killing and intimidation by the Islamic Republic regime.
Athlete and gym owner, father of two daughters aged 7 years and 4 months. Shot by IRGC forces in front of Mas'oudiyeh police station - received 3 bullets to the side and from behind the head
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Bandar Abbas

Shot by government forces on the evening of 18 Dey while helping an injured person in front of Chalus police station during popular protests. Bullets hit his abdomen and he was severely wounded. He died during surgery after being transferred to hospital. He was a shopkeeper from Chalus who owned a souvenir shop in Sardabrud area (opposite Amir Hall). His body was handed over to his family on 19 Dey and buried in his birthplace Masal in Gilan province. Father of an 8-year-old son, originally from Masal.
Killed when he was alone in Haft Tir area of Mashhad on 18 Dey. He had a seven-year-old daughter
Described as 'freedom fighter' who sacrificed his life for the homeland in Qazvin

42-year-old father of three young children, owner of a furniture factory, resident of Tehran. On 18 Dey 1404 during popular protests in Tehran Pars neighborhood, he was severely injured by a bullet to the head. His brother sat beside him to help when he was targeted by two bullets. Both brothers were taken to hospital. Hamid died after 3 days of unconsciousness. Security agencies demanded 1.5 billion tomans from the family to hand over the bodies of the two brothers and forced them to sign a commitment stating the cause of death was 'brain stroke'.
Victim from Mashhad, Razavi Khorasan province
Father of a daughter, shopkeeper, killed during protests by direct gunshot from government suppressive forces
Shot by security forces in Phase 4 Mehrshahr, Karaj

Newly hired firefighter in Mashhad who was killed by government forces while helping injured protesters. He was also an athlete and international rugby referee. A video of him carrying an injured person on his shoulders in Mashhad while transferring them to safety became an iconic image of Iran's national revolution.
Hospital nurse shot and killed by regime forces during protests. Last note found in his backpack read: 'By the order of the Shah of Iran, King Reza Pahlavi.'
Victim documented in Iran International memorial database
Father of three innocent daughters, from Dezful, described as a child of Iran who sacrificed his life for the homeland

Father of a 5-year-old son. Went to Chitgar to visit relatives when he heard protest sounds and came outside. A girl was shot in front of him, and when he went to help move her aside, a bullet hit his forehead and he was killed

Kurdish citizen killed during popular protests in Eslamshahr, Tehran Province. Shot with two war bullets by Islamic Republic military-security forces. Security institutions forced his family to pay 200 million tomans to receive his body.

Shot and killed during protests in Chamestan along with 24 others on night of 19 Dey. Personnel at Safari Elimarat tourism complex, migrated from Radkan (Chenaran County, Razavi Khorasan) to Chamestan for work. Shot from very close range with war bullets and buckshot, targeted from waist up. Buckshot completely damaged both lungs, both kidneys, spleen and liver, four fingers of right hand were severed. Father of two sons aged 18 and 8. Wife forced to sign document claiming he died in accident to receive body and threatened not to reveal truth about his death. Authorities wanted to present him as a trained leader who came to incite unrest in Chamestan due to being non-local.
Death in Mashhad on 18 Dey 1404
Killed during the national uprising of Iranian people in Baqershahr, Tehran, through bloody suppression by forces of the terrorist Islamic Republic regime
Listed as victim number 302
Shot by Islamic Republic suppressors during protests. Originally from Javarsan village in Arak
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Shandiz, Mashhad during the protests

Student from Likak city in Kohgiluyeh and Boyer-Ahmad province, studying foreign languages at Isfahan University in his final semester. Son of Saeed, an English and German language teacher. Abducted during protests on 18 Dey 1404 (January 8, 2026) in Isfahan and killed in detention. After several days without any official information about his whereabouts, his lifeless body was delivered to his family. Authorities claimed cause of death was 'heart attack' but severe trauma was visible on his body. Buried on 25 Dey (January 15, 2026) in Likak city under security measures.

57-year-old war veteran. Initially wounded by gunshots to his legs in Golshahr, Karaj, then killed by mercenaries of the Islamic Republic in the hospital with a finishing shot. Despite his daughter's efforts, he was not introduced as a martyr or Basiji.

Shot directly in the head by Islamic Republic suppressive forces in the 45 Metri Golshahr area. Had a master's degree in civil engineering and was unmarried. Family initially thought he was arrested and imprisoned for a week before friends informed them his body was in a Tehran morgue. Security forces did not return the body to family but transferred it to a remote cemetery in Karaj with only parents allowed to attend ceremony. Family was forced to remove the word 'Javidnam' (eternal memory) from death notices by security agents.

Son of Shapour Shirazi, resident of Anjamabad village in Shahriar. Longtime supporter of Taj Football Club and fan leader. Shot with two Kalashnikov bullets by Basij forces in abdomen and right leg during protests in Phase 1 of Andisheh around 9:00 PM on January 8. Arrested by Basij and IRGC forces and held for 12 days in IRGC detention without medical care. Died on the twelfth day of detention due to severity of injuries. Body showed severe signs of beating, bruising, and torture, especially to head and face - face was unrecognizable. Family forced to pay 600 million tomans to receive body. Buried on February 2 in cemetery of Anjamabad village, Shahriar.

Shot from behind while joining protesters near Arash Hospital in Tehranpars. Had just returned from his mother's seventh-day memorial ceremony with his wife when he separated from her to join the protesters. Body was returned to family 4 days later.
History student at Farhangian University of Isfahan, killed by direct shooting from Islamic Republic suppressors
Killed by regime forces in Haft Hoz area of Narmak neighborhood

Kurdish young man killed by direct shooting from Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Elahieh neighborhood on Shahed Boulevard in Kermanshah. Part of mass killing in Elahieh district where at least 15 people were killed and dozens injured when targeted by gunfire from suppression and military forces of Sepahe Nabi-Akram (Prophet's Guard Corps).

Shot and killed with war bullets on 18 Dey in Qazvin. Family is from Naserabadi village. Their voices were not heard and they were under severe government pressure and forced to make forced confessions.
Shot with war bullets by special forces, was wounded but doctors said she would recover, however they were not allowed to treat her and she was killed with a finishing shot
Shot with war bullets to the head and abdomen during Iran's national uprising on Estakhr Street in Tehran. Body was transferred to Alghadir Hospital in Tehran.
Baloch teenage girl killed by direct gunfire from suppression forces during nationwide protests. Originally from Kahnuj.

54-year-old Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah living in Mashhad, shot and killed with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Mashhad. His body was buried secretly without family notification. The exact date of death is uncertain but likely occurred during the widespread killings on January 8 or 9, 2026 (18 or 19 Dey 1404). Family learned of his death after a period of uncertainty about his fate. Authorities secretly buried 400 people in Mashhad without family notification.
Shot at Revolution Square (Meydan-e Enghelab) in Tehran. Also known by the nickname 'Yasin'. Died after several minutes of bleeding from gunshot wounds.
Son of Yahya, killed for raising the historical and national flag of Iranians by defenders of the Akbar flag, for the honor of Iran and efforts to prevent harm to Iran

Kurdish athlete from Islamabad-e Gharb (Shabad), Kermanshah Province, residing in Karaj. Shot directly by government forces during popular protests at Mosbah intersection in Karaj. War bullet hit his leg area, was taken to hospital by his wife, and died from his injuries. His body was handed over to family on Sunday 21 Dey. Due to government restrictions preventing burial in Karaj or Islamabad-e Gharb, he was finally buried on Monday 22 Dey in his paternal village in Tohlelilan county, Ilam Province.

Shot in the chest with a war bullet at the first roundabout of Fardis. Born in Zanjan. Before leaving, he told his wife: 'After I'm gone, be proud of me and hold your head high. I'm going for my daughter and girls like my daughter.'
Killed in Mobarakeh, Isfahan
Gilak citizen from Ramsar, born 1376 Persian calendar (1997 Gregorian), killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces
Real estate advisor and professional bodybuilder. Shot on Jihad Street in Astaneh. Witness reports he was hit with both pellets and war bullets from Kalashnikov rifle.
Shot by Khamenei's agents in Satarkhan, Tehran. Resident of Simon Bolivar Boulevard, Tehran.
Killed for the homeland, described as 'شیره‌کر غیرتی خرم‌آباد' (honorable/zealous person of Khorramabad). Father of two daughters with another child on the way.

Shot in the side during protests in Khorramabad, Lorestan. Died from severe bleeding while being transported to hospital. Security officials tried to present him as a 'martyred Basij member' which the family rejected. Family was asked to pay 300 million tomans for the body's return, which they couldn't afford. He was buried at 5 AM under security measures at the end of Sarab-yas cemetery in Khorramabad with only his parents present. He was a plumber with two daughters aged 6 and 13, and his wife is pregnant.
Victim documented by Hengaw Organization for Human Rights
Kurdish citizen shot by Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) forces during popular protests in Kermanshah. His body was handed over to his family after payment of 600 million tomans.

Shot in the throat by regime mercenaries' war bullets during the popular uprising in Dey month. He held two master's degrees and had achieved rank 16 in the national technical university entrance exam. A symbol of Iranian elites who sacrificed their lives for freedom and justice despite their talent and scientific position.
Killed by IR security forces during protests in Tehranpars district. Body was released for burial but exact time, location of death, and circumstances of body release are not available.

Father of two children aged 16 and 13. Shot in the heart with a war bullet by security forces while helping wounded protesters to safety in Tehranpars area during protests. He was helping transport injured people to safe locations when he was targeted and killed by Islamic Republic security agents. According to his friend, after seeing wounded and killed compatriots, he shouted 'Don't be afraid, I am your bodyguard' and rescued several wounded people, taking them to parking areas of nearby houses. He was shot from behind in his pure heart by Zahhak agents while going back to help another person.
Listed in memorial account documenting victims from Najafabad, Isfahan
Died in Shahinshahr, Isfahan
Shot with six bullets in the evening
Shot directly in the heart. His body was found after being missing for one week. He was buried on 26 Dey month.
Listed as victim number 2321 in memorial account
Shot in the head by IR armed forces during protests at Haft-e-Tir Square in Mashhad. Father of a two-year-old child named Arnika. IRGC agents are trying to portray him as a state martyr.
Shot by suppression forces in the neck area while in Tehran. From Dorud, Lorestan province. Buried on January 11, 2026 in his birthplace, Bang-Abad village in Dorud county.

Veterinary PhD student at Chamran University of Ahvaz, cousin of Kourosh Jalil (former political prisoner). Arrested by security forces with violence and beatings in Kianpars area of Ahvaz. Transferred to Sheiban Prison in Ahvaz where he is being held.
Killed by the Islamic Republic in Karaj. Lost his mother during childhood and his father also left him. Had no voice and the account was asked to be his voice
Died in Gonabad during the protests

23-year-old Kurdish man from Sanqar (Kermanshah province), resident of Qarchak Tehran. Shot and killed by direct fire from government forces with war bullets during popular protests. Killed near Baqerabad police station in Qarchak by direct gunfire from forces stationed at this police headquarters.
Listed with additional surname (Salihavi) indicating possible family name or origin

Shot directly in the head with war bullets in Afsariyeh district of Tehran during events on Thursday evening. He worked in the business of selling decorative and electrical car accessories in Afsariyeh. His body was transferred to Shirvan city and buried there. The killing highlighted concerns about the use of war weapons against citizens.
Killed in Sadeh Lenjan, a suburb of Zarin Shahr in Isfahan province
Hit by a war bullet to the head during the night of 18th Dey in Nazi-abad (Tehran). He was a clothing designer and was about to celebrate his engagement soon.
Killed by Islamic Republic forces in Tehran on 18 Dey
Shot directly from behind by government suppression forces during protests in Haft Houz Square, Tehran

Shot below his left eye in Afsariyeh and taken to Baasat Hospital by his friend. During a phone outage, his friend left the hospital to inform Hossein's family. When they returned, the hospital staff said Hossein had been transferred to [text cuts off]
Father of Ali Joanbkht, killed along with his son by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic

Shot in the leg with pellets during protests in Yaft Abad on Thursday January 8, 2026. Was arrested after being wounded. Died in custody one day later. Body showed signs of severe beating, with bleeding from the eye area. Family was told to collect the body from Kahrizak.
Died in Pakdasht
Bram Lor from Falavarjan, Isfahan, killed by direct gunfire from suppression forces on 18 Dey
Kurdish citizen arrested during December protests in cities of Lumar Sirwan, Sanandaj, Kermanshah, Marivan and Urmia

Shot in the femoral artery in his leg during protests in east Tehran. Before joining the protests he had said: 'I am at peace about the security and welfare of my children and it doesn't matter what happens to me. I'm going to the protests for a better future for the next generation.'
Born 1370, listed in hospital records
Shot directly with a war bullet by Islamic Republic suppression forces in Salasabil area of Tehran

Shot in the legs with two military bullets while joining a gathering in front of his house in Isfahan. Was transferred to Kashani Hospital severely wounded. Government forces later attacked the hospital at midnight with the goal of eliminating the wounded, and deliberately shot finishing bullets into Hossein Rahimi and many other wounded patients. His body was transferred to Bagh-e Razvan cemetery in Isfahan and buried. His family was placed under severe security pressure and not allowed to hold any mourning ceremonies.

Shot with 3 bullets to the heart, shoulder, and side during the national revolution around Meraj Square. Family was charged 500 million tomans to retrieve his body, which was eventually buried in Shirhasar village next to his mother's grave.
Shot by sniper on Piroozi Street

Shot directly in the heart area. After his killing, security forces did not allow his family to hold a funeral ceremony. Under pressure, threats and harassment, his body was taken for autopsy to change the cause of death. The body was returned only under the condition that burial occur at 6 AM with only four family members present under complete supervision of security forces. The family was under pressure and threats throughout this period and prohibited from holding any public ceremonies.
Shot by suppression forces, buried in his birthplace village of Shams Abad in Dezful
Killed in Parand

32-year-old musician and computer science graduate who was shot during protests in Narmak neighborhood. Security forces were shooting from the top of Haft-Houz Narmak mosque toward the crowd. He was hit by a bullet, likely from there, targeting the eyebrow area and completely destroying his left eye. His body was identified through fingerprints after his father searched through morgues including Kahrizak. He was a guitarist, pianist and singer who had a music shop in Narmak.
Shot in the head by suppression forces in front of his house. He was targeted for sheltering protesters in his home. He owned a gym on Shura Street in Khorramabad.
Arrested in Nowshahr on 18 Dey 1404 along with two other young men

Kurdish citizen killed during protests in Razavi Khorasan and North Khorasan provinces. Identity verified by Hengaw Organization for Human Rights as one of seven Kurdish citizens killed in the regional protests.

Shot with a bullet in the Shishehgaran area of Lahijan. Killed through deliberate shooting of unarmed protesters with direct gunfire using military weapons, specifically targeting the head and other lethal parts of the body.

11-year-old Baloch child shot directly by government forces with a war bullet that hit his chest area during popular protests in Rajaei township of Mashhad. His body was transferred to Behesht Reza cemetery in Mashhad without informing the family and was handed over to the family after four days. He was finally buried on Monday 22 Dey (January 11, 2026) in Dastgerdan cemetery in Mashhad.
Kurdish citizen from Dehgolan arrested by security forces and held without access to lawyer or family visits. Status unknown after two weeks of detention.

Student shot by security forces with war bullets during protests in Tehran. Her body was transported approximately 800 kilometers under unusual conditions with ice placed on the corpse to be buried in her family's hometown, Khartoot village in North Khorasan province.

He was killed on Friday night during protests in Mohammadshahr in front of his house. Family was asked to declare their child was a Basiji member to avoid paying bullet costs, but they refused.

His sister shared a video message saying they had many dreams for him, hadn't yet seen him in wedding clothes, and hadn't properly finished celebrating his graduation.

Recently married man (newly wed) from Khvansar, Isfahan, killed by direct gunshot to the head. Despite authorities preventing and taking pledges from the conscienceless officials from the family and making many threats without media coverage, around 5-6 people from the community participated in a very magnificent funeral ceremony for him.
Listed as victim #725 in memorial post

Shot around 8:10 AM above Haft-e Howz Square on 18 Dey. People helped carry him to a building on a side street. He was still alive at that time but had a very low pulse and heavy bleeding. Emergency services had no personnel to send. The only ambulance that reached the street after one hour was not allowed entry by security forces. He died very soon after.
Among 40-50 people who lost their lives in the city of Alvand, Qazvin province on the night of 18 Dey

Killed during popular protests by baton strikes from government forces. His body was handed over to his family one week later at 4 AM and quickly buried.

37-year-old from Isfahan, arrested on the street in Isfahan and killed under torture by the Islamic Republic regime on 18 Dey. Under torture, his skull and ribs were broken and a rib entered his heart, causing death from internal bleeding.
Barber from Lahijan, killed during the protests in Lahijan near Enqelab Square. Originally from the village of Zemidan.

Young barber from Zemeydan village near Lahijan who loved nature, animals, and motorcycling. Shot in the side during protests at Enghelab Square while rushing to help a wounded woman. Bullet exited through his stomach. Authorities withheld his body but his father forcibly took it and drove to the cemetery.

Young artist and hairstylist who worked in music production and accessory sales at AS Man boutique. Gunned down by bullets of Islamic Republic forces in his own city. Remembered as joyful, nature-loving, energetic, and fiercely loyal companion. Grave photo inscription reads 'Soldier of the Path of Light'.

59-year-old civil engineer who worked for an oil company, from Tehran. Shot in the chest by suppressive forces during people's protests in Sadeghiyeh Square. His body was handed over to family in Kahrizak and buried in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery.

Father of two children, killed during the brutal massacre at Rasht bazaar while providing aid to the wounded. He was targeted and killed by two war bullets. His body was withheld from his family for four days and was finally buried on Sunday night around 21:30 under forced and security pressure. His family continues to be under severe security and psychological pressure.
Died in Rasht

Father of a 6-month-old daughter. Killed by direct shot to the head from half a meter distance while attempting to rescue and transport an injured girl. Born 25 Bahman 1386, shot in the side while returning home, killed by gunshot. Family was unaware until the next day when the hospital called saying their son had been shot, and when they went to the hospital he had already died.
17 years old, taekwondo practitioner with 3rd dan black belt. Targeted with direct fire in Tehranpars and killed.
Killed in front of the radio and television building in Isfahan
Elite PhD student in chemistry, originally from Sepiddashht in Lorestan province, resident of Tehran. Shot directly in the head by government suppression forces during people's protests.

Chemical engineering graduate with master's degree, PhD candidate, from Dorud in Lorestan province, resident of Tehran. Shot by Islamic Republic forces during protests. Shot and killed by Khamenei's criminal forces with bullets in the city of Saveh, Markazi Province. Government spokesperson Fatemeh Mohajerani had previously referenced his case during election campaigns, saying they wanted to ensure no more Mehrshads would be killed.
Died in Shahinavila, Karaj

3-year-old child killed by direct gunfire from war bullets by regime mercenaries during national uprising on 18 Dey month. She was not a protester, was not chanting slogans, had no weapon; she was simply alive and that was enough for the regime. After this crime, the regime's propaganda apparatus tried to cover up the truth with scenario-making and lies, and put pressure on the grieving family.

Shot by Basij forces affiliated with the Islamic Republic of Iran government in Kiashahr city on the night of January 8, 2026. He was a 30-year-old Gilak citizen from the port city of Kiashahr in Gilan province.
Married, resident of Tehranpars, Amin Street (Khaksefid). Owner of a pickup truck and mobile cafe. Shot with bullets in Amin Street, Tehranpars during direct fire by suppressive forces.

Shot in the chest with live ammunition while helping injured protesters, specifically while assisting an injured mother and daughter during popular protests in Lahijan. From Hassanalieh village in Lahijan. Father of an 8-month-old daughter. Died before reaching the hospital. In his final moments told his wife and child 'you will be proud of me in the future.' Family was able to retrieve his body before transfer to Rasht by providing guarantee, and transported it to Hassanalieh village for burial with widespread attendance from villagers.
Died on January 8, 2026 in Parand
Shot with direct hit from war bullet by suppressive forces of the regime during the national uprising in Iran. Killed while participating in protests for freedom and homeland.

Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, killed by live ammunition fired by state agents during protests on Taq-e Bostan Boulevard. He had celebrated his engagement ceremony only four days prior to this incident.

Shot with pellets in his eye in Shahidshahr, Shahriar. Said that with one eye, what use is this life anymore, then went among the crowd and had his throat cut

Killed by the Islamic Republic. Originally from Khuzestan, lived in Parand. His father was a war veteran. The family had not previously spoken out due to security pressures but requested that his name be made public so he would not remain anonymous.

From Kermanshah, had come to Tehran for work, killed by Islamic Republic regime suppression forces. Family under severe pressure and forced into silence by regime threats and intimidation to prevent disclosure of crime details

30-year-old son of Hooriyeh Faraj Zadeh, sister of the late Shahram Faraj Zadeh who was killed under police vehicle wheels during Ashura in 2009. He was one of the signatories of the 14-person statement and was arrested and imprisoned on 18 Dey. Family is under severe threats.
Killed during protests in Islamabad-e Gharb (Shababad). Identity confirmed by Hengaw Organization for Human Rights as one of 14 confirmed fatalities.
Shot with live ammunition in Maskan neighborhood of Kermanshah. He was a car battery maker who worked in Karaj and had returned to his hometown during the national uprising.

Shot directly in the stomach from a rooftop in Nazi Abad. The bullet went through his body. Body was not returned to family initially. Kept for 5 days on the ground in the courtyard at Kahrizak. Authorities demanded 1.7 billion (tomans) as 'bullet fee' to return the body, threatening to bury him as their own martyr if family couldn't pay. Family was threatened that if they protested, the body would be taken somewhere no one could find it. Described as someone who loved life, worked, and was very kind.
Drilling equipment technician from Kermanshah, living in Karaj. Shot by government suppression forces with direct fire to the abdomen and side during people's protests on 18 Dey 1404.
Shot with direct gunfire by Khamenei's mercenaries during protests in the street in response to people's demand for freedom
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Parand

Football coach shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces during protests in Narmak. Shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces during the Iranian national revolution in Bandar-e Anzali. He was a former player for Malavan youth teams and had recently been accepted in wrestling. He also worked as a hemp craftsman.
Shot in the heart by gunfire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces. Gilaki citizen from Bandar Anzali

Army personnel from Kerman killed on 18 Dey. Family is under pressure to declare him a martyr while authorities refused to bury him in the martyrs' section and told them their son is 'among the rioters'. No one dares to say his name.

Worker from Kermanshah. Family was in severe financial distress. Parents are elderly with no access to social media. Authorities forced family to either declare him a Basij member or pay 1 billion tomans for the bullets that hit him to receive his body. Family could not afford the payment.
Died in Nazi Abad area of Tehran

Son of Naser, resident of Shahr-e Rey, Salehin area. Shot directly in the neck by government forces in Nazi-abad neighborhood of Tehran. The bullet to the neck caused his death. Part of the deadly use of firearms against unarmed citizens during suppression of popular protests.

Kurdish young man from Salmas who was injured and arrested by security forces during protests on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) in Tehran. His body was returned to family after 12 days on 30 Dey (January 19, 2026) without any explanation from security institutions. It remains unclear whether he died from severity of gunshot wounds or was killed under torture after arrest.
