Gilak citizen living in Karaj and father of two daughters, shot directly with live ammunition to the forehead by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran during nationwide protests in the Sarasiyab area of Karaj on Enghelab Boulevard. His body was buried anonymously in Behesht Zahra and his family was prevented from holding public ceremonies and freely informing about how he was killed.

Shot from behind with direct gunfire by Islamic Republic forces while going to help an injured person during protests. Body identified in Kahrizak. Family confirmed baton marks on his head, but body was not wounded elsewhere - cause of death was gunshot from behind. Was unmarried and described as kind, passionate, good-hearted and humanitarian who stepped forward to help an injured person instead of fleeing.
Killed during protests in Shahreza on bloody days of 18-19 Dey by direct gunfire with war bullets or pellets
Shot in the head with a war bullet on Shariati Street in Ardabil. He lived with his mother and three brothers in Golmaghan neighborhood of Ardabil, and his father had died earlier.
21-year-old Kurdish man shot with direct fire from IRGC forces during popular protests in Zarneh city on the evening of Thursday 18 Dey 1404

Had a street vendor business. The text contains a mother's grief-stricken words in Azerbaijani Turkish mixed with Persian, mourning her son Mobin, expressing regret about not being able to cover him with a blanket and asking for his forgiveness.
Shot directly by Islamic Republic forces with an AK-47 during the national uprising. Died after being struck by a bullet.

Barista and cafe industry activist from Mashhad. Had been regularly bodybuilding for more than seven years and was known by friends and relatives as an energetic, kind and brave young man. Despite warnings from those around him, he insisted on active participation and believed that everyone should stand together to begin fundamental changes. He was patient in the face of pressures and physical pain and would not back down from his decision. According to local accounts, Moeen became a martyr in the Haft Tir area of Mashhad during the Sun and Lion Revolution. After being transferred to Velayat Hospital in Mashhad, he lost his life due to the severity of his injuries. Some witnesses also said that he was among the first people to take protest action in the vicinity of Haft Tir police station.

Shot with direct bullet to the heart in front of Golshahr Hospital in Karaj. Son of Razgar Abaspor from Ilam, residing in Karaj. His father is described as one of the most honorable people who spent his whole life helping patients in the most remote villages of Ilam, and this young man was the fruit of his life who died in his arms in the street.
Killed in the path of homeland, in Andisheh city

Shot by direct fire from Islamic Republic suppression forces during protests in Karaj. Body was buried on January 15, 2026 in Hasanak-dar village in Karaj under complete security conditions without public ceremony. He was the youngest child of a three-child family with one sister and one brother, living in Haft-Tir neighborhood of Karaj. According to his relatives, he had also participated in popular gatherings during the 2022 protests. His family is under pressure and threats from security institutions.

17-year-old protester from Karaj, killed by direct gunshot to the head by government agents on the evening of 19 Dey 1404 in the city. After the killing, his family was subjected to systematic pressure and extortion: 50 million tomans for 'bullet costs', 20 million tomans for burial permit, and 200 million tomans for burial in a six-story grave. In total, 800 million tomans was demanded just for permission to bury their child's body in Karaj. The regime threatened the family that if they protested, the body would be buried in a remote cemetery. During the burial ceremony, extensive presence of security agents was reported and the family was banned from any eulogies, memorial services and gatherings, and were forced into silence with written commitments.

Shot by bullet in the pelvic area on Haft-e Tir Street in Mashhad and died hours later from her injuries. She had told those close to her before joining the crowd that she was going 'just to be a member of the crowd; so that those who go forward are not alone and know that we are standing behind them.'

Lur citizen from Nahavand, Hamedan province, residing in Tehran. Shot with war bullets during protests on Thursday 18 Dey by government suppression forces. Died Friday 19 Dey from injuries sustained from the shooting.
25-year-old computer science student shot in the head with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppressors in the evening on Thursday in east Tehran area
35-year-old computer science student killed by war bullets fired by Islamic Republic suppression forces on the first day of Prince Reza Pahlavi's call
Shot directly in the head by suppression forces on the evening of 18 Dey. Father of one child and owner of a car parts shop.
Shot by local Basij militia members with war bullets during peaceful protests. The Basij forces were firing from the roof of Abulfazl mosque in the city at around 9:30 PM.

Shot in the abdomen during Iran's national uprising on 18 Dey. Was taken to hospital but left without treatment until he died. Example of shooting to kill and deliberate prevention of treatment of compatriots.

Killed during nationwide protests in Tehran. Gilak citizen from Gurab Zarmikh, resident of Tehran. After his death, security agencies attempted to portray him as a 'Basiji' member, but a close relative protested stating that Mohammad Aftabi was a protester and freedom seeker who was killed by government forces. His family was put under pressure and not allowed to publicly or through media report about how he was killed. His body was buried in his birthplace, Gurab Zarmikh.

Shot by government forces during protests in Mahshahr. Government agents forced his family to hold the burial ceremony before 6 AM and did not allow them to hold mourning ceremonies afterward.
Shot by suppression forces on Ammar Boulevard

Father of two children from Rafsanjan who was severely injured by direct gunfire from government forces during protests on 19 Dey in Rafsanjan. He died from his injuries on 22 Dey while hospitalized. During his hospitalization, none of his relatives were allowed to visit him. His body was buried under strict security measures without any funeral ceremony.

Shot directly by government forces' bullets in Rasht city. Originally from Fouman county. Was a childhood friend of Mehran Basir Tavana who was killed in the 2022-2023 protests and never forgot his grief over losing Mehran. Was arrested for 15 days after chanting against government suppression and violence at Mehran's 40-day memorial ceremony. Was a football enthusiast and leader of Fouman football team, worked at a hookah lounge. Family was pressured after his death - body was buried at night in complete silence with only mother, sister and brother allowed to attend. Even hanging a black flag on their house door was prohibited. Family had to pay bail to receive his body and now remain silent due to fear of further pressure. Buried at Imamzadeh Mirza in Fouman near his family's residence.

25-year-old protester from Fouman in Gilan province who was the leader of Ettehad Fouman football club supporters. Shot and killed by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic in Rasht on Thursday. His family was threatened by security agents and forced to bury him without holding funeral ceremonies and at night.
Also known as Nima. Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Tehran.

17-year-old student who worked at a car wash to support his living expenses, killed by direct gunfire from government forces during popular protests in Fouladshahr, Isfahan. His body was buried on January 19, 2026
Died in Zanjan
19-year-old arrested on 18 Dey, family has received no proper information about his location or condition, not even a single phone call allowed
Died on January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1404) in Fooladshahr, Isfahan

19-year-old mechanical engineering student at Tabriz University. Shot in the head with a military bullet around 8 PM in the area of Milad intersection in Andisheh city, Alborz Province. Died at the scene or shortly after being transferred. The incident occurred during the national revolution.
Listed as victim in Iran International Memorial database

Shot with three pellets and one war bullet above the heart during protest in Azadi Square Kerman, died from severe bleeding during national uprising. Father of two children - a 2-year-old son and 3-month-old daughter who were left fatherless.
Shot in the stomach with military bullets by regime mercenaries. Described as Iran-loving, very polite, kind and beloved. Family requested his name and photo to be shared.

Kurdish citizen who owned several clothing stores in Kermanshah. Shot in the chest with a war bullet by Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Kermanshah. Funeral held on 23 Dey at 'Bagh Ferdows' in the city.
Kurdish citizen killed by direct gunfire from IRGC forces during protests on Fermandar Boulevard in Malekshahi, Ilam province, while passing in front of the Basij Resistance building

24-year-old cousin of Edris Darvishvand, shot and killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces during Iran's national revolution protests. He was targeted along with his cousin and both lost their lives. No photo of Mohammad has been received yet.

Shot in the heart with a war bullet in Laleh Park in Alvand city, Qazvin during protests. Buried next to the grave of Edris Darvishvand. Family faced financial difficulties in paying billions in fees to receive the body and had to accept the regime's conditions.

25-year-old Mazni compatriot from Siah-Kolam-Mahale village in Babil, shot directly in the face by regime mercenaries during the national uprising in the area above Owqaf Square. He had gone to the gathering with Erfan Gholipour and after Erfan was injured, went to the police station to follow up and help, where he was shot in the face and sacrificed his life for the freedom of the homeland.

42-year-old coffee shop owner in Sari, Mazandaran, shot at close range with military weapons by Basij forces who entered his coffee shop demanding closure and claiming he intended to shelter protesters. After he refused and requested a judicial warrant, an argument ensued and Basij forces shot him directly with military bullets. Father of a daughter named Ava, known to friends as 'Ava's father'.
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime in Narmak, Tehran

18-year-old high school senior was filming protests with his mobile phone at Behesht Square in Nazi Abad when he was shot from behind by military and security forces with a war bullet. His family is under severe pressure and has been threatened that his grave will be opened and his body removed.
Detained in Karaj around January 8-9. Described as enforced disappearance and human rights violation.

25-year-old from Valiabad village in Gonbad-e Kavous. Injured by Islamic Republic government agents on the night of 18 Dey 1404, then arrested and transferred to an IRGC detention center where he was killed during detention. Was alive when transferred to detention but died as a direct result of IRGC forces' treatment during detention. His death occurred within a recurring pattern of protester suppression involving arrest, violence, and physical elimination with complete impunity for perpetrators.

Shot and killed by four war bullets in Nabard neighborhood, Piroozi district of Tehran. His family is under pressure from security forces. His will was simple: Say my name so much that my little son will be proud of me.
Father of two, died due to suffocation caused by inhalation of chemical substances and tear gas

Shot directly in the heart during protests in Dorud, Lorestan. At least 17 people were killed in Dorud on the 18th and 19th of Dey month, but due to the small size of the city and extremely severe security conditions, only the names of a few martyrs have been made public.
Construction worker and breadwinner for a family of four, from Mashhad working in Ramsar, killed by direct gunshot to the heart by government agents in Ramsar

Shot directly with bullet by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic in Sabzeh Meydan (Green Square) Rasht during suppression of popular protests. Died due to severity of injuries from bullet impact.
Shot by Islamic Republic's suppressive forces in Felah neighborhood of Tehran, hit by bullets in throat and leg area
Shot in the heart by security forces during protests. Arab citizen originally from Mashour (Mahshahr) in Khuzestan province. Also known as Alboghbish.

Shot with 2 bullets to the back and side, and stabbed from behind with knives by suppressive forces at Meraj Square in Mashhad at 10:45 PM. Died the next morning from his injuries during the Iranian national uprising.

Shot directly with military ammunition by regime forces on Sohrourdi Street in Alvand while working at Ali Meshti juice and ice cream shop. Shot in the forehead with a war bullet during protests on Vakil Abad Boulevard, Haft Tir area in Mashhad. Employee of Academic Jihad (Jahad Daneshgahi) in Mashhad. He was ultimately buried in Behesht Reza cemetery in Mashhad.

24-year-old barista shot directly with a bullet in front of his workplace door. The legal analysis notes this as a clear violation of the right to life and prohibition of lethal force against citizens, constituting direct criminal responsibility for commanders and perpetrators. Part of a broader pattern of systematic killing of citizens across different cities.

15-year-old boxer from Khorramabad shot directly by suppression forces in Masour neighborhood during the national revolution against the Islamic Republic. Security forces returned his body to the family on condition that no funeral ceremony be held, to be buried in media silence.

Shot with a direct bullet to the heart during protests in Arak by the Islamic Republic regime's suppressors on Thursday night, 18th Dey month. The Islamic Republic delivered his body to his family after 5 days at Arak cemetery.

Shot from behind with live ammunition during nationwide protests in Dey 1404 in Tehran. Originally from Arabkhaneh area in South Khorasan province. Described as an 18-year-old unarmed teenager.

Azerbaijani compatriot from Karaj who stood alone and defenseless against security forces to protect others' lives. He did not flee or retreat; he used his body as a shield for others' lives. Kurdish citizen of Kermanshah, killed during popular protests in Kermanshah on Gol-sorkh Street. Shot directly from behind by Islamic Republic suppression forces during chase. Son of Hossein, married. Body buried on Thursday at Behesht Zahra (Bremond) cemetery in Kermanshah.
Shot in the head with a military bullet while inside a car at 8 PM on the 19th of Dey. Originally from Pashaki but residing in Fardis, Karaj

Father of 2 children. Shot from behind with a war bullet in Malekshahr, Isfahan

Kurdish youth from Kermanshah, son of Mahmoud, shot and killed with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests on Taghbostan Boulevard. His body was buried on Saturday 20 Dey 1404 at Bagh Ferdous cemetery.

16-year-old Kurdish teenager from Kermanshah was shot by suppression forces with a war bullet during public protests on the evening of January 8th while chanting 'Death to Khamenei' in the Maskan area. Despite severe bleeding, he was arrested and plainclothes forces took his bloodied body in their vehicle. He died en route and the plainclothes forces abandoned his body by the roadside. After his killing, his family was threatened and pressured by security institutions and the IRGC, and threatened that his 10-year-old brother would be arrested.

Shot with direct gunfire by government forces near the Isfahan Metro Bridge. Two military bullets hit his side and one bullet hit his chest cavity. Family was forced under threat to claim he was a Basij member or they would not receive his body. Body was withheld from family for one week until they complied with forced interview. From Barsian village in Isfahan suburbs.

Electrical engineering student at Ferdowsi University of Mashhad. Killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic forces on 18 Dey 1404.

Shot with shotgun at close range to the chest area during nationwide protests in Sadeghiyeh area of Tehran. His body was found one day later on 19 Dey and finally delivered to family on 21 Dey after pressure and mediation. Forensic certificate states cause of death as shotgun pellet wounds, but family was forced to officially report cause of death as sharp object injury. Security forces banned any public ceremonies or mourning. Single, worked as repair technician and PDR worker, born in Ordibehesht 1381.

Shot directly by IRGC terrorists in Mashhad on 18 Dey. From Sham-Abad village in Sabzevar. His body was returned after 8 days with threats and intimidation, and the family was forced to declare him as 'Basiji', with the warning that otherwise they would not even be allowed to bury him in the village cemetery. He had made a video in memory of Hamidreza Rouhi.
Arrested on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) in Freyman county, currently being held in Vakilabad prison in Mashhad

Computer engineering student who recently transferred from Yazd University to Isfahan University. Killed by shotgun pellets fired by suppressive forces during protests. Was active in web design and user interface work, focusing on making digital product user experiences simpler and more practical.

Shot in the chest by gunfire from a rooftop at the beginning of North Citadel (Arg Shomali) in Neyshabur. He was 40 years old, tall, kind-hearted, always smiling, brought joy wherever he went, had 3 children whom he loved deeply, was friends with his children, and helped anyone however he could.

Shot with direct shotgun fire from close range in Sadeghi area of Tehran. According to witnesses, he was targeted while his hands were raised and he was saying 'don't shoot'. His body was handed over to the family several days later under security pressure.

Shot with direct fire by suppression forces in Qaemieh, Isfahan. Originally from Ardal in Bakhtiari province, his body was buried with strict security measures in his birthplace village of Sarchah in Ardal county.
Shot by the Islamic regime. Described as a young athlete.
Shot in the neck by direct fire from IRGC forces during protests. Family had to pay billions in toman just to retrieve his body.

Owner and model of Alpha Collection clothing store and professional bodybuilder from Zaid Aliya village in Sari, Mazandaran province. Killed by direct shots from Islamic Republic agents during national protests. Shot for shouting for rights.

Shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic forces in Behesht Square, Nazi Abad, Tehran. First bullet hit his neck area, and when he was trying to save his life after falling to the ground, he was targeted with a finishing shot by agents. Medical examiner incorrectly recorded cause of death as 'accident' and date of death as 'Wednesday'. His uncle was among those killed in Iran-Iraq war. Buried on 24 Dey in section 80 of Behesht-e Zahra cemetery in Tehran.
25-year-old killed on 18 Dey. Tweet mentions decorating his car like a wedding car and scattering sweets and congratulations at his grave.
Popular blogger from Qaleh Sefid, Najafabad, Isfahan. Buried in Mohammadi Paradise cemetery in upper Qaleh Sefid neighborhood. Memorial service held on 2 Bahman (January 21, 2026)

Not satisfied with shooting him due to his height and stature; they attacked him with batons and kicks until he died. Described as a child of Iran killed for the homeland.

Shot from behind by Islamic Republic suppressive forces during protests. He was the only child of his family and parents had all their hopes in him. He went to the streets to voice people's demands and was killed in an ambush by forces hidden around a police station. His body was returned after one week and his burial took place on the same night as his birthday, turning his birthday into eternal mourning for his family.

Rock climbing instructor shot in the heart with a bullet during protests on Thursday 18 Dey at Shahnaz Crossroad in Tabriz. Family had no information about his whereabouts until Sunday when they were informed of his death. His body was handed over early Monday morning only under condition of complete family silence and prohibition of any funeral ceremonies.
17-year-old killed in Esfarayen
Shot directly by IRGC forces during protests in Qazvin. He was from Hosseinabad Sofla village in Qazvin province, was unarmed when participating in protests, and was an athlete who loved life.
Arrested on 19 Dey (January 8, 2026) in Tehran and disappeared for over two weeks with no information about his whereabouts or transfer location
Arrested along with his younger brother Aryan Rahmani by security forces on 18 Dey 1404 and transferred to an unknown location. No information available about their condition or whereabouts.
Body taken from morgue at Behesht-e Zahra cemetery in Tehran
Engineer, shot during protests in Najafabad along with dozens of others. Limited media coverage due to families not being active on social media.
Killed by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran during protests in Gorgan. Citizen of Gorgan.

Kurdish student who was shot by Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Esfarayen, North Khorasan Province on January 8, 2026. He was transferred to Khomeini Hospital in the city but died the next day due to the severity of his injuries.

18-year-old known by nickname 'Tiam' from Kermanshah, disappeared after leaving home on 18 Dey. Body was returned to family on 23 Dey showing he was killed by a war bullet to the heart area. Burial ceremony held on 24 Dey at Ferdous Garden in Kermanshah. Case follows regime's criminal pattern of forced disappearance, killing with war bullets, and delayed return of bodies during suppression of national uprising.

16-year-old Kurdish child from Salmas killed by direct gunshot from government suppression forces during popular protests in Tehran. His body was transferred to Qom and has not yet been handed over to his family. He is the third Kurdish citizen from Salmas whose identity has been confirmed as killed in Tehran.

Shot and killed by government forces during protests on Kashani Street in Sadeghieh's second circle. Eyewitnesses reported that the bullet was fired from above the Goldis complex opposite Ibn Sina Hospital and directly targeted his head. Before joining the protests, he had posted a video on Instagram saying: 'I'm going for the freedom of my homeland, for my people not to migrate. Don't you want Iran to be free? So let's go for Iran's freedom.'
Listed among the martyrs of Falavarjan county, Isfahan

Third-term student at Shahrekord Technical College, shot directly in the head and neck area during protests at Falake Abi (Blue Circle) in Shahrekord. Family was pressured by security agencies after his death. Body was only released to family after written commitment from father to have maximum 10 people at burial ceremony. Funeral held at night at 11 PM. Death certificate listed cause of death as 'impact of hard object to head and neck' - a euphemism used instead of direct reference to gunshot.

15-year-old Baloch teenager injured by suppression forces during nationwide protests in Chabahar on 18 Dey 1404, then arrested and has been in uncertain condition for 27 days with no news about his health status. Illegally detained.

Shot by suppressive forces in Haft Howz Narmak area of Tehran. He was a young athlete and parkour champion who also worked in theater. In one of his Instagram posts he had written: 'hoping for a day when we can fly with our skates'

Shot from behind during popular protests. Son of Morteza. This killing occurred as part of violent suppression of nationwide protests in Iran, which according to human rights organizations has a systematic, repetitive and governmental nature that directly targets civilian citizens.
Shot by local Basij militia members with war bullets during peaceful protests. The Basij forces were firing from the roof of Abulfazl mosque in the city at around 9:30 PM.

Retired teacher and Gilak citizen from Chalous. Shot and killed by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces near the Chalous intersection and police station while trying to help and protect a woman who had been shot at. At least five bullets hit him, causing his death. His killing occurred on his child's birthday.
Shot directly by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic terrorist regime while standing with the people during national uprising

Shot from behind near the neck in the Haft-e Howz area of Tehran. He was 34 years old, single, worked as a carpenter in a cabinet-making workshop, and was described by those close to him as very kind, hardworking, and always smiling and cheerful.

Shot while with his daughter at the end of their street. He was hit by one bullet to his back and one bullet to his leg, died from blood loss. His daughter was also shot in the leg but survived after surgery. A motorcyclist was moving from street to street opening fire. Described as very kind and well-mannered. His family is under severe pressure.
Memorial entry from Iran International website. Location specified as Maali Abad area of Shiraz.
Died on January 8th in Karaj during the protests. Family is under pressure not to speak about it or write anything. Father only made one Instagram post without explanation.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial
Shot with direct gunshot to the head alongside Mila Ghaedi

Shot by suppressive forces on Rabat Street in Isfahan during national uprising protests. Directly targeted by regime's street killing policy as part of systematic pattern of eliminating and suppressing protesting people.
Shot directly by Islamic Republic forces in Qods (Qaleh Hassan Khan). Family is under severe suppression.
Listed as 'راه‌پیمای مقدم' (prominent marcher/protester)
Shot with war bullets during protests on Setareh Khan Street in Tehran, then killed with final shots by Basij forces after falling to the ground
Death occurred in Golshahr district of Karaj
Shot by regime suppression forces during Iran's national uprising. Martyred in Ariashahr, Tehran area during the national uprising of the Iranian people.
27-year-old cafe owner from Najafabad killed by direct gunfire from government suppression forces during protests. His body was delivered to his family 5 days later under pressure.
Kurdish citizen killed during protests. Originally from Sarpol-e Zahab. Family required to pay $4500 as 'bullet cost' to receive his body

Shot directly in the neck by government forces during events at Haft-Howz Square in Tehran. Body was delivered to family shortly after death because he was the brother of a martyr. Burial ceremony was held on January 11, 2026. After his death, individuals affiliated with the Shahid Foundation visited the family to record photos and videos to introduce him as a 'martyr for Islam', a narrative that does not align with his life and death and was not accepted by the family. He was a motorcycle enthusiast who loved heavy motorcycles and was a passionate young man who loved life.
Killed during protests. Buried in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery. Authorities are burying victims in different sections of the cemetery to prevent concentration of large numbers of killed protesters.

Shot in the head by suppressive forces during Iran's national uprising. Born in 1370 (Persian calendar) and from Bumehen. Family searched for 3 days continuously before finding his body in Kahrizak, identifying him only through a tattoo on his hand. Burial ceremony was held under strict security measures with security forces prohibiting any gathering, ceremony or public expression of mourning.
Died on January 8, 2026 in Pakdasht

Wounded by pellet shot during night of January 7-8, 2026 (18 or 19 Dey). Owned a woodworking workshop in Tehran. After being wounded, was taken to hospital by a neighbor while others were afraid to help due to fear of authorities. His lung was severely damaged and essentially destroyed by the pellet impact, leading to his death.
Kurdish citizen from Ivan-e Gharb, worker and father of two children, killed by gunfire from Islamic Republic military-security forces during public protests in Tehran
Death occurred in Shadabad area of Tehran. Note: 'Yazdan' appears in parentheses which may be a nickname or middle name.
Died on Kish Island
Shot directly by suppression forces in Yazdanshahr, Isfahan
Young man from Kashmar city killed in Pakdasht on 18 Dey
Shot directly by government suppression forces during people's protests
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Afsariyeh, Tehran
Shot by snipers during celebrations after police were driven out of an area. Victims had gathered to dance and celebrate when snipers came and shot everyone present.
Shot with military ammunition by suppressive forces affiliated with the regime during the national uprising
Shot in the neck by IRGC forces. His family was unaware of his fate for two weeks until they found his body in the Mashhad cemetery morgue. His last message was 'For the homeland, for the family.'

Shot in the head by bullet during Iran's national uprising. He was a resident of Siahkal who had come to Lahijan to participate in protests. His body was buried in Barfjan, Siahkal. He lived with his grandmother and his name was recorded on government lists under security pressure.
33-year-old resident of Marvdasht, killed during people's protests by baton blows and gunshot execution by government suppression forces
Died in Shahreza, Isfahan
Killed by repressive forces of the Islamic Republic regime while working in his family's cafe business. Described as a kind, empathetic young man deeply cherished by friends and family.

Shot directly in the head by an Islamic Republic sniper. Was with his family at protests, lit a cardboard on fire to reduce the effect of tear gas so people could escape, when Islamic Republic snipers targeted him with a laser in front of his brother and sister. Family was threatened not to have any social media activity and could not hold any ceremonies for him.

20-year-old Baloch citizen shot in the head with war bullets by military and security forces during popular protests in Karaj. Son of Molavi Abdolhadi, from Gosht city in central district of Saravan county. Had traveled to Karaj for work. Body was identified at Alborz Hospital in Karaj after extensive searches by family. Legal medicine demanded around one billion tomans from family for body delivery and asked them to declare he was a Basij member, which the family rejected. Body was transferred to Balochistan and buried on January 13, 2026 in his hometown Gosht in Saravan county.

Shot with war bullet by Islamic Republic forces during suppression of popular protests in Alvand city, Qazvin province. He was directly targeted and died from the severity of his injuries. Born in 1363 (Persian calendar), single.
Computer engineer who was shot in the face by Davoud Ghafouri from Dastgerd Basij militia in Dastgerd, Borkhar
Shot by mercenaries of the Islamic Republic. His family was forced into silence and told they had to sign a document stating he was a member of Basij.
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime in Mashhad, buried in his hometown Arak
38 years old from Khorramabad, commemorated with honorific 'Javid Nam' (immortal name) indicating martyrdom
Shot by gunshot to the left leg, death certificate confirms he was killed by gunshot
Father of two daughters aged 16 and 21, shot in the throat by government forces during public protests

Shot three times with war bullets in Baharan Square (Falah neighborhood), District 17 of Tehran. Was unmarried and unemployed at the time of death. Family was forced to bury his body outside Tehran in Jolfa city near the Armenian border rather than in the capital. Authorities offered money to the family to declare him a 'martyr' but his father refused this offer.

Christian citizen shot by security forces with a military bullet while attempting to help his wounded friend Shahram Maghsoudlou during a protest in Baharestan Isfahan. After being shot in the thigh and bleeding severely, security forces stationed at the hospital prevented him and his companions from entering the emergency room and accessing medical services, causing him to die from severe blood loss. His family searched for him for five consecutive days without knowing his fate. Authorities offered to return his body only if the family signed a form falsely claiming he was a Basij member killed by protesters, which the family refused. His body was eventually returned after payment of one billion tomans. He had a 4-year-old daughter and two teenage stepdaughters.
Died in Shahrak Andisheh during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial

32-year-old bank employee shot and killed by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic terrorist regime on a Thursday night in Tehran Pars after choosing to stand with the people and responding to the call of His Majesty Homayoun Shahanshah Iran-Zamin Reza Shah II. His body was buried in Golpayegan and his family is under severe security pressure. Authorities attempted to confiscate and distort his name and memory.
Died in Baharestan district of Isfahan
33-year-old Gilaki citizen shot by direct fire from Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during nationwide protests in Rasht

Shot in the stomach with a bullet in Haft Howz area of Tehran. He owned a beautiful cafe. Killed through deliberate targeting of unarmed protesters via direct shooting with military weapons, specifically targeting the head and other vital parts of the body, showing clear intent to kill as part of a widespread and organized attack against civilian population.
Described as martyr (شهید) from Isfahan. Died on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026) during the protests.
Shot directly by security forces near the police station in Rostamkola, Behshahr County, Mazandaran Province. Body returned to family after several days with severe restrictions
Killed during protests. In his last Instagram story he had written: 'If my body is returned, hold a celebration for me'
Shot from behind with war bullets by Islamic Republic terrorists. Originally from Malayer, Hossein Abad Nazem village in Hamedan province. Killed in the path of homeland and freedom

Disappeared during protests on January 8th. Family has no information about his whereabouts, no case file exists, and no body has been returned. Authorities told the family to 'cancel his identity card.'
Professional football player in Iranian league, brutally shot and killed by the thugs of the Islamic Republic Regime along with his wife. They leave behind two daughters.

From Kermanshah, had come to Tehran for work, killed by Islamic Republic regime suppression forces. Family under severe pressure and forced into silence by regime threats and intimidation to prevent disclosure of crime details

Shot directly by government suppression forces during popular protests on Thursday evening. She was a 38-year-old Gilaki woman from Rasht, married and mother of one child. She was targeted from behind by government forces.
Shot in the heart from behind during protests in Rasht. Left behind a young son who keeps asking why there are no photos of his mother anywhere.

Radiology specialist shot with pellet bullets while helping her daughter move dowry items in Malakshahr, Isfahan. Bullets hit her face and her daughter's and son-in-law's hands. All three were taken to Gharazi Hospital in Isfahan but Mona died within minutes of being admitted to emergency. She had reported severe burning sensation in her body and face during transport to hospital. Government officials offered to bury her as a 'martyr' in the martyrs' section of Bagh Rezvan cemetery, but her husband refused.
Shot in the chest by government forces while helping his wounded friend during protests. He was targeted by Islamic Republic suppressors' bullets.
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Bumehen

Shot in the heart with a war bullet at Selsabil, Tehran. He was a barber who owned a hair salon and was known as a very kind and energetic person who would cut hair for free for disabled people and those with Down syndrome. He loved his two cats.
Shot in the heart during protests. Described as a hero who loved his homeland and was targeted in the heart.
Killed on Friday alongside 17 or 18 others by several mercenary motorcyclists who shot at their veins. Father of two sons aged 12 and 3 years old.
Died in Shahrqods, Tehran
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Mashhad

Brutally attacked by armed regime forces on the night of January 8th while returning home with his wife in Daneshgah Square, Hamadan. Forces used batons and pellet guns. 34 pellets fired directly at his face and head smashed with batons in front of his wife.

Young married man returning home with his wife in Daneshgah Square when attacked by Basij forces with batons and pellets. 34 pellets fired at his face, head and face completely destroyed with batons in front of his wife. Regime took the bodies and held memorial services claiming them as their own martyrs, even circulating announcements around Daneshgah Square and conducting their own burial ceremonies. Couple was monarchist, not regime supporters. Left behind a 9th grade child.
Farmer who loved his country, killed by the Islamic Republic on the night of 18 Dey in Borujerd. He was a student of Majidreza Rahnavard and like that hero.
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime
Killed at Seyyed Heshmat and Shahrestani intersection, mostly with heavy machine gun (doshka). Part of 61 people killed in one incident over two days.
Listed as victim number 1170 in memorial post
43-year-old athlete and father of two children killed in Islamshahr during the bloody Dey month protests

Shot directly by government agents during protests in Dezful. His body was buried under security pressure and imposed silence in Hamze neighborhood of Dezful. The text notes this is part of a systematic pattern of killing youth in streets, delivering bodies under suppression conditions, and forced burial as part of the regime's systematic crime and intimidation against Iranian people.

Shot with bullet. Known by the nickname Shahin. 24-year-old tattoo artist from Mashhad who loved music and was always cheerful, even when life's burden weighed heavily on his shoulders. He just wanted to live.
Shot while walking hand-in-hand with his wife on the street. Family is under pressure.

Shot from behind in Narmak neighborhood at around 9:30 AM (had his last phone call with his brother at 9:30, and 10 minutes later a woman answered his phone). People were carrying bodies to residential parking areas, and Mostafa was carried to the end of the alley.
Died in Haft-Houz area of Tehran
Listed as a commemorated victim from Rudbar Gilan
Kurdish citizen from Dinavar, Kermanshah, killed by gunfire from Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Karaj
17-year-old from Tehran, commemorated with eternal memory (جاویدنام) suggesting death related to protests

Shot in the heart with war ammunition on Siman Road in Mashhad. Family searched for him for three days before finding his body. Forced burial by security forces in Sangal village, Khorasan province. Family is under pressure from security institutions not to publicize his death.
Shot by gunfire while among a crowd during a public gathering. Despite being transferred to medical centers, died due to severity of injuries sustained.

54-year-old protesting citizen from Fardis Karaj and originally from Malayer, shot from behind during protests, bullet hit his lung. The shooting occurred in front of his family. He was taken to a clinic but was refused treatment. He died in the car from the severity of his injuries while his head was on his wife's lap and his daughter was sitting in the front seat. After three days, his family was given permission to bury him and his body was buried in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery in Tehran.
Died in Yazdanshahr, Isfahan
Shot by government suppression forces during the current national revolution in Tehran
Listed as victim #1234
Shopkeeper on Farhang Street in Sari, Gilaki citizen from Sari, died during protests in the city. There is uncertainty about the exact date - unclear if the incident occurred on 18 Dey or 19 Dey 1404
Shot in the head during incident in Borujerd. His wife and two children were with him at the time. A disturbing video of the aftermath of the shooting to his head was published.
Father of three children (two daughters and one son), killed by direct shooting by Khamenei's forces. Body was buried in Khomeini Shahr cemetery

18-year-old killed in Shahriyar during protests. He had gone to the demonstration with his father. When his father was injured, he tried to go help him but Basij militia and security forces shot him with bullets. He had dreams of becoming a football player.

Slain by the brutal forces of the Islamic Republic regime. Her parents had already passed away, leaving her to grow up with her brother. She had only just reached the age where she could begin working and planting a future of her own. Her death occurred seven days before what would have been her birthday.
Listed as victim #1185 from Iranshahr, Sistan and Baluchestan province

Father of two children, retired worker from Hormozgan Steel Industries, originally from Khorramshahr and resident of Isfahan. Disappeared on the evening of January 8, 2026 during protests in Fooladshahr Isfahan. Family searched for him for a week with no official response. Body identified at morgue on January 14, 2026 with severe head trauma and swelling that made identification difficult. Severe injuries indicate extreme violence. Body was hastily buried the next morning by order of authorities with no funeral or mourning ceremonies allowed.
Death occurred during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests

Married mother of two children killed during protests in Tehran amid a widespread crackdown and mass killings of citizens by Iranian government forces in the Sadeghieh area. Shot in the neck by Iranian government forces and died instantly. Due to fears that authorities would prevent the handover of her body, her husband was forced to carry her body himself for more than an hour.
Student at Amirkabir University, was wounded during a protest, abducted by the Islamic regime from the hospital, and executed in cold blood

Baloch citizen and municipal street sweeper in Qeshm. Shot directly by military and security forces during suppression of nationwide protests. Bullet hit his neck and carotid artery causing fatal injuries. Son of Abdolghader, from Ahmad Abad village in central district of Iranshahr county.
Mother of two children, shot by Islamic regime with one bullet to her neck and one to her heart, died in her son's arms
Arrested in Nowshahr on 18 Dey 1404 along with two other young men

Young Kurdish man from Islamabad-e Gharb (Shaabad), killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests. His body was buried on Sunday 21 Dey 1404 in Imam-zadeh Hassan cemetery in Islamabad-e Gharb (Shaabad).
Died in Urmia. Mentioned as uncle (دایی) suggesting family relationship to another victim.
Shot and killed. Had told his father that if he was killed, he wanted to be buried near Cyrus the Great's tomb. His mother wrote that she and Navid were playmates and grew up together.

24-year-old nurse from Paveh who worked in medical centers in Kermanshah. Shot by military forces while at his workplace during the popular uprising. From the village of Mazidi in Paveh County. Lost his father at six months old and grew up facing many hardships. Graduate of medical imaging (radiology) who worked at Farabi and Imam Reza hospitals in Kermanshah. Investigations are ongoing regarding the exact circumstances of the incident inside the hospital.
Shot directly by IRGC suppression forces in Zibashah, Qazvin while standing with the people

Shot by security forces' pellets in Qeytarieh, Tehran. Was taken to Qeytarieh Clinic alive and receiving treatment when security agents abducted her. Her body was later found at the forensic medicine office with a fatal gunshot wound to the chest. Born in Bojnord, was a monarchist supporter who fought for years for Iran's freedom and the return of Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi.
Killed by the Islamic regime of Iran during a peaceful protest. From Zibad village, Gonabad in Razavi Khorasan Province.

Shot in the neck by Islamic Republic mercenaries on the night of 18 Dey 1404 (2026-01-08). A war bullet hit her neck and after several days of hospitalization at Panj Azar Hospital in Gorgan, she died on Wednesday evening 24 Dey.
Died in Sarasiab area of Malard on January 8, 2026
Shot with a bullet to the side/flank area in Qaleh Hassan Khan. His family is under pressure from security forces not to write the date of 18 or 19 Dey on his gravestone.

35-year-old Gilaki citizen from Shaft, Gilan province, arrested by Islamic Republic of Iran security forces during nationwide protests on 19 Dey 1404. No official information has been released about the reasons for arrest, detention location, or his physical and legal status.
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Shahrghods, Tehran
Shot in the head with two war bullets by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Karaj between Thursday and Saturday 18-20 Dey 1404
Killed by the Islamic Republic on 18 Dey. From Gohardasht area of Karaj. Known through mutual friends but not widely documented.
Killed during protests, no media coverage of his death
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Afsariyeh, Tehran

15-year-old girl shot directly by suppressive forces of the regime in Ashrafiyeh during the national uprising. Described as a defenseless teenager whose only crime was being present on the streets of her homeland during Iran's national uprising. Killed with a war bullet as part of targeted and systematic killing of people, especially children and teenagers, by the terrorist regime.
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Sarâsiâb Malard. Born in 1992.
Killed during the national uprising of the Iranian people
Shot in the face from the front during protests, with the bullet exiting through the back of his head. His mother had raised him with difficulty and now has no one left
Killed at Haft Howz police station (دم کلانتری هفت حوض). The tweet is a personal message of revenge/remembrance from someone who had a close relationship with the victim.
Listed in Iran International Memorial - specific circumstances not provided in this record
Shot directly in the neck by government suppression forces during people's protests
Shot with war bullet during protests in Shahin Shahr. Had two children. Authorities demanded 1 billion [tomans/rials] in exchange for his body and refused to allow a funeral ceremony.
Killed during protests in Prehsar, Gilan on Thursday when people from surrounding villages came for the call to action
Killed by the Islamic Republic during protests, from Malayer

Shot directly by government forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran around 10 PM on Namjoo Street in Rasht. The bullet hit his head and heart area, and he was killed at the scene. Gilaki citizen from Rasht.
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Mashhad

Shot during the national uprising in Iran on 18 Dey. After being hit by bullet, was transferred to several hospitals but died due to bleeding as hospitals refused treatment and prevented his care. Family was forced to bury his body secretly at night and were banned from holding third day memorial ceremony.

Shot with sniper rifle in Khazaneh neighborhood in front of his wife and two daughters aged 4 and 7. He was an employee of Ettelaat newspaper. Newspaper management received his body through lobbying to preserve the regime's reputation and registered him as a Basij member killed by Monafeqin (MEK) and terrorists.

Shot by suppressive forces during popular protests in Tehran-Pars neighborhood. From Sanandaj, Kurdistan province but resident of Tehran. Government forces demanded 700 million tomans from his family for return of his body.

Brother of Amir Teimouri, resident of Falah neighborhood in Tehran who had gone to visit Amir's house in Fardis. Killed alongside Amir and nephew Armin by gunfire from war weapons by Islamic Republic's suppressive forces on Sar-e Canal area of Fardis (main street). Family was pressured and threatened by government forces to receive the bodies and forced to bury them secretly.

Shot with live ammunition in the side of her body at 7:00 p.m. in Shora Square by security forces. Was taken to hospital and placed in ICU while fully conscious, but security forces expelled her family from the hospital. Her lifeless body was transferred to the morgue of Bagh-e Jannat in Arak that same night.

18-year-old experimental science student at Avini School in Bandar Abbas who wanted to become a surgeon to save people. Was shot and wounded, then placed in ambulance but died due to lack of medical attention and excessive bleeding.

Teacher and mother of two children, killed by direct gunshot to the heart in Abyek, Qazvin. Born in 1364 (Persian calendar). Friend's niece, family afraid to publicize. Reportedly 16 people were killed in Abyek, Qazvin.
32-year-old mother of two children, shot in the forehead in front of Elahiyeh police station in Mashhad

Shot directly by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces during protests in Rasht. Security forces prevented her family from holding any funeral ceremonies and her body was buried at dawn around 3 AM without family members present. She was the head of household and had two young daughters. She was a Gilaki citizen from Rasht.
Shot and killed (described as martyrdom), her death left a family grieving

Shot by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic regime during Iran's national uprising on the evening of 18 Dey. From Fardis, Karaj. Became a martyr for freedom and homeland, targeted with violence and bullets for standing with the people.

Shot during attack on Thursday market (Panjshanbeh Bazaar). He was with his father when he was hit by bullets. From the Abyazi family of Komoleh (Langrud). He loved veterinary medicine and worked at his father's clinic, Dr. Abyazi's clinic. His body was buried at night in Langrud.
Killed at Fifth Circle (Felakeh-ye Panjom) in Fardis, Karaj. Only 17 years old.

Shot by direct sniper fire from Islamic Republic forces in the Masour area of Khorramabad. He was a student who was interested in wrestling. According to family and relatives, he was severely wounded in this incident and died before reaching the hospital - he was never hospitalized and practically never reached medical centers. His body was buried in his birthplace, Zagheh city. Despite no special problems for the burial, authorities demanded 200 million tomans from the family for the delivery of his body.

Shot directly in the head with live ammunition by government suppression forces on Kashani Street during popular protests. The 17-year-old had told his mother he wore two jackets so that if he was hit by bullets he would only be wounded, but government forces shot him in the head from behind. His father is a veteran of the Iran-Iraq war who had to use his veteran card because authorities refused to return his son's body. The family remains under security surveillance.

Shot in the neck by government forces in the Fallah district of Tehran on Thursday evening. His family found his body among the killed in Kahrizak after three days of searching and buried him on January 12, 2026. Due to his family's difficult economic situation, he worked in a small workshop after receiving his high school diploma to help support the family. Government agents did not allow memorial services to be held in local mosques or public places, so only a small private ceremony was held.
51-year-old Gilaki citizen from Lahijan, killed by direct gunshot to the back of the head by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government in Lahijan
Shot in the head while protesting in the street hand-in-hand with her two daughters on Thursday evening

Kurdish Yarsan citizen from Qasr-e Shirin, killed by war bullet from Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Andisheh, Tehran province. Funeral held on January 10, 2026 in Andisheh city. Family was threatened and pressured by security agencies regarding holding the funeral ceremony.

35-year-old man who entrusted his two-year-old child to his sister to participate in protests in Chalus with his wife. Shot with war bullets around 9:30 and died. Before dying, he entrusted his child to his family.

31-year-old who fell while fleeing and was shot with pellets at close range, died from severe bleeding due to lack of medical care at Namazi Hospital in Shiraz. Authorities imposed many conditions and harassment for the handover of the body

31-year-old dentist shot during protests after intervening to protect another individual being assaulted by security forces. Shot from two directions - one bullet from behind and another from the front. Taken to private hospital where he fell into a coma and died. Adherent of the Yarsani faith. Authorities pressured family to pay one billion tomans or identify him as Basij member to release body; family was compelled to accept regime supporter designation due to inability to pay.

31-year-old Kurdish Yarsan dentist shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic's suppression forces during popular protests in Kermanshah's Maskan neighborhood. His clinic was located in the same neighborhood where he was killed. He was the son of Forud. His body was buried on January 18, 2026 (28 Dey 1404) in Sar-ab Tiran cemetery.

Shot directly by Islamic Republic terrorists in Bagh-e Bahadoran, Isfahan, during Iran's national uprising. Described as standing with honor alongside the people without hypocrisy and responding with bullets. His mother said at his grave that her son did not sell out his compatriots, had no seal on his forehead, was not a prayer reader, but was good.

Shot by sniper while present with his cousin. Father of a 3-year-old child. Body was returned to family after 10 days. Death certificate stated cause of death as 'impact with hard object and damage to kidney and spleen' with death date recorded as 20 Dey, while family and informed sources state he died on 19 Dey

Shot by security forces stationed at Tehranpars police station (Rashid police station) in Tehranpars area of Tehran. A war bullet hit his lung area. He was transferred to hospital and underwent surgery but died due to pulmonary embolism. Father of two children, resident of Haft-Houz Narmak. After his death, his body was transferred to Kahrizak legal medicine and family was pressured not to inform the public. Family was not allowed to hold a public burial ceremony and Peyman Dareng was buried without ceremony and in media silence.
40-year-old Gilaki citizen from Rasht, father of one child, killed by government suppression forces during protests in the city
Shot with three bullets. Was recently married (described as 'our new son-in-law'). Resident of Andisheh.
Shot to the heart by suppression forces in Isfahan, buried in Khomeini-shahr cemetery. From Jui-abad, Isfahan.

Shot during nationwide protests while riding a motorcycle with his sister. Government forces shot him multiple times in different parts of his body. He died from severe bleeding. His sister was also wounded in the abdomen during the shooting but survived.
Listed as victim number 950 in memorial post

Killed during Iran's national uprising. Targeted for violence and suppression for the crime of standing with the people. Described as one of the children of this land who sacrificed his life for the path of freedom and homeland.
Death occurred in Rasht on 19 Dey 1404

Kurdish Yarsani citizen from Sahne, Kermanshah province. Shot directly and deliberately with a war bullet to the head by Islamic Republic suppression forces in Taq-e Bostan area of Kermanshah while trying to rescue the body of another protest victim that had fallen in the street and prevent its abduction by suppression forces. Married with a 5-year-old child.
18-year-old from Isfahan killed at Malekshahr intersection. Family has been pressured to stay silent about his death

Shot with war bullets by security forces at Helal Ahmar intersection in Izeh city. The bullet hit his shoulder and he died hours later due to heavy bleeding. Security forces transferred his body to Ahvaz and forced his family to remain silent. Against the family's wishes, they imposed a martyrdom narrative and forced the family to bury him in the martyrs' section under strict security measures without holding tribal ceremonies. The family did not use the word 'martyr' in their obituary notice.
Young man from Shahreza who died, father held farewell ceremony with traditional reversed/upside-down musical instruments as per Lor and Qashqai tribal mourning customs for fallen heroes
Lor from Mamasani, killed when security forces opened fire on his personal car

Shot by government sniper positioned on National Bank of Iran rooftop at Abshar intersection in Isfahan on Friday the 19th at 6 PM. Bullet hit his shoulder. Was hospitalized at Sadoughi Hospital in Isfahan under IRGC supervision. Despite being alive with only a shoulder wound, family was not allowed to see him. After one week of family pursuing his whereabouts, they were told they could go to Bagh Rezvan (cemetery). When family reached his body, they found he had been killed with a coup de grâce shot. While his shoulder was bandaged, there were traces of another bullet on his chest. Killed in hospital while wounded - a crime against humanity.
23-year-old Gilaki citizen from Ishka village in Lahijan district, killed by Islamic Republic of Iran government forces in the evening on Thursday in the area of Lahijan National Garden
Shot in the stomach on 18 Dey in Mashhad, died on the 25th
32-year-old computer industry worker shot and killed by the Islamic terrorist regime in Haft-houz. A young man who wanted to live, worked, and had a future, but received bullets in response.
25-year-old doctoral student who sacrificed his life for his homeland, died exactly one week before receiving his study visa

Shot with two war bullets to his leg and heart on 18th Dey in Dowlat Abad (Tehran). Family was forced under threat to say he was a Basij member. Authorities took photos and videos from the family, then later removed banners and said 'Do you believe he was a Basij?! He is one of the rioters and you have no right to mourn!' Bodies were piled on top of each other in one room at Dowlat Abad clinic to hide the number of killed. Father and brother searched for 12 hours at Kahrizak. Bodies were scattered like watermelons, naked boys and girls, had to be placed one by one to see those underneath due to the large number of deaths.
Family member reported missing/lost during protests, described as 'one from our family is also missing'

Killed during protests on 18th of Dey month. His body was found among other victims of Iran's national revolution. Brother of the tweet author Payam Fotouhiyehpour, went missing on Wednesday when communication with outside the country became available, family and friends searched everywhere but found no trace until Tuesday when they were informed his body was found among the martyrs.
Killed during protests in Shahreza on bloody days of 18-19 Dey by direct gunfire with war bullets or pellets
Death occurred in Esfarayen on 18 Dey 1404

Kurdish Kurmanji youth from Esfarayen, North Khorasan province. Shot by Islamic Republic suppression forces with war bullets to the mouth and chest area during popular protests. Lost his father in childhood and had one brother; their mother raised the two children alone.

Shot in the head with a war bullet at Abuzar intersection, in front of a bank in Nahavand. Body was returned to family four days later. Against family's wishes, he was declared a 'martyr' and funeral announcements were published without family permission. Family emphasized he was neither a Basiji nor a member of IRGC. He was an athlete and bodybuilder. Funeral was held under heavy surveillance by plainclothes forces, with family facing restrictions, pressure and threats.
Listed on Iran International memorial website for victims
Died in Qarchak
Shot by direct fire from Islamic Republic suppressive forces. The bullet hit his face causing fatal brain damage.
17-year-old teenager killed by suppressive agents of the Islamic Republic

Student of Italian language studies at the University of Tehran, shot directly by Islamic Republic security forces on Ariamehr (Fatemi) Street during the nationwide uprising. Struck by live ammunition during violent crackdown on protests.
23-year-old student injured during protests in Saadat Abad on 18 Dey 1404. No news has been available about this girl since then.
Shot directly by regime suppression forces during protests in Meymand, Fars Province
Shot by Islamic Republic agents during protests in Nasim Shahr

Worked at a pharmacy. Was present at protests with his friend. First his friend was shot and killed on the spot, then Ramtin was killed by a direct shot to the head while trying to lift his friend from the ground.
17-year-old killed in bloody Dey month by regime forces in Vavan, Islamshahr. Described as a hero of the homeland whose name was not documented anywhere
Shot directly in the head around Kakh Square in Gorgan. He was the breadwinner of his family, having previously lost his father and brother, and was the only support his mother had.
Shot in the head by direct gunfire from suppressive forces during popular protests at the fifth roundabout in Fardis. Father of a young daughter.

Shot by government forces during protests in Dezful. Was a 19-year-old law student at Azad University of Dezful who also professionally pursued boxing and worked as an automotive electrician for several years alongside his studies.
Victim recorded in Iran International Memorial, died on Rudaki Street in Isfahan

Father of one daughter, resident of Tehran, shot directly in the forehead by government suppression forces during people's protests. His body was delivered to family one week later and buried in Masjed Soleyman

Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, 41 years old and father of a young child, taxi driver, killed by gunfire from military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Alvand city, Qazvin. His body was buried on 21 Dey in 'Behesht Fatemieh' Alvand.
Killed by gunfire from military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in Qarchak Varamin, Tehran Province. Originally from Sonqor
Killed by IRGC terrorists in Naser Khosrow neighborhood of Khorramabad
42-year-old architectural engineer and protester against the Islamic Republic, shot and killed by Islamic Republic suppression forces in Andisheh, Karaj
Shot and killed in Karaj. According to reports, the shooting occurred from the rooftop of a police station and he was killed by gunshot.
Described as sacrificing his life in the battle of the army of light against darkness, part of the Sun and Lion revolution
Shot directly in the heart during confrontation between security forces and protesters in Fooladshahr, Isfahan. Killed during suppression of nationwide protests in Iran.

17-year-old volleyball player and member of Setaregan Alborz team in Karaj. Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces in the lung area during protests at Mosbah intersection in Karaj. He was with his family during protests but got separated in the crowd and disappeared. His body was found hours later at a clinic. Family was forced to pay heavy costs to receive his body and buried him under security restrictions in Hajiabad cemetery in Karaj.

22-year-old Iranian daughter killed by suppressive forces of the regime during Iran's national uprising in Qazvin. She was shot and killed simply for standing with the people and demanding life and a future.
Killed during the 2025-2026 Iranian protests

Shot with war bullets during protests at 'Seh-rah Simin' (Simin Crossroads) in Isfahan, hit in the shoulder area. Described as tall, very brave and kind, was at the front of the crowd when he was hit by three war bullets, with the shoulder bullet reaching his heart and causing his death.
Shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces in Afsarieh neighborhood of Tehran

Shot with direct gunfire on the night of the 18th in the city of Dansfahan (one of the counties of Qazvin Province with 14,000 population). Had been fighting against the Islamic Republic for a long time. When he was killed, authorities demanded 200 million tomans to release his body and buried him at 5 AM in a heavily secured environment without notice or presence of anyone except his family. The family was not even allowed to print obituaries or hold mourning ceremonies.
Killed by direct shot to the head in Ariashahr, Tehran

Shot with seven bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces. His burial ceremony was held under the strictest security measures with only ten family members allowed to attend. The transfer and burial of his body was conducted with armed escort by security agents and the area around the burial site was completely under government forces control.

34-year-old protester who disappeared after participating in protests on 18 Dey in Shahin Shahr, Isfahan Province. His body was found days later in a morgue at one of the cemeteries with bullet wounds. This silent murder is part of the organized killing of protesters in Iran's national uprising.

Killed on 18 Dey in Zanjan. Father of a 5-year-old daughter. Buried at 7 AM in the presence of security forces and plainclothes agents of the Islamic Republic. No news coverage of his death. Heavy security atmosphere in Zanjan with many killed but families under severe control.

Father of a 5-year-old daughter, died for freedom and homeland on 18 Dey in Zanjan. Was buried at 7 AM in silence under heavy security pressure with the presence of security forces and plainclothes agents of the Islamic Republic. The atmosphere of repression in Zanjan is so heavy that families are under complete control and many names of martyrs are not allowed to be published.
Shot by regime forces during protests on 18 Dey near Imam Hussein mosque in his city. Described as a calm and kind young man known for his good nature and peaceful spirit.

Born in Mehr 1367, 37 years old, resident of Marzdaran neighborhood in Tehran, owner of a cabinet-making workshop in Ariashahr. Shot dead by direct fire from suppression forces during protests in Ariashahr district. Was with five friends at protests when one was shot. Returned to help his wounded friend when a sniper affiliated with security forces fired from a building rooftop. Security forces then targeted him with six war bullets, killing him on the spot. About to get married, gave his phone, password and car keys to his mother before leaving home and asked for her forgiveness.
Shot with direct fire during protests. Was an only son and newlywed. From Zeinabiyeh neighborhood in Isfahan.
Killed by suppressive forces on Kish island. Body was found full of wounds and bruises, riddled with bullets. Described as being killed mercilessly by government forces.
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Mashhad during the protests
Ten-year flower seller in Shiraz, known as a calm and gentle person whom the entire neighborhood would swear by his name. Shot directly in the face on Thursday 19 Dey in Shiraz.
Shot directly with war bullets by suppressive forces during protests

Shot with war ammunition in the lung area during protests. Originally from Shabad, lived in various areas including Shahryarshahr and Vali-e Asr Shabad before moving with family to Ni-pehan village in Qasr-e Shirin due to his father's agricultural lands. Was a tattoo artist who moved to Karaj with his wife for career advancement. Body was delivered to family after extensive pressure and difficulty - many victims' bodies were reportedly stacked on top of each other in a warehouse. Burial was forced to be conducted quietly at 10 AM instead of the planned 2:30 PM ceremony due to security pressure. Buried under heavy security presence with IRGC forces, plainclothes agents, mobile phone and internet cuts, with only close relatives present. Family continues to face unspecified security pressures.
Died in Fardis, Karaj

Retired teacher killed during popular protests when government suppression forces fired five war bullets directly at his leg and heart. He was trying to help a female protester who had fallen to the ground after being shot in the head by suppression forces. He was first shot in the leg, then killed with four additional bullets to his heart.

16-year-old child from Qochan working as a laborer, killed during popular protests in Karaj when shot in the heart by a military bullet fired by Islamic Republic military-security forces. Family was forced to pay 750 million tomans to receive his body. Burial ceremony held in Qochan.
Shot and killed in Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari. His family faced repeated threats while trying to recover his body
Shot in the heart by government forces. From Esfarayen. Described as sacrificing his life for the homeland.

25-year-old from Gerash, Fars who worked in Bandar Abbas. Killed by government forces during peaceful protests in Bandar Abbas on 18 Dey. His body was returned to his family four days later under security conditions to be buried in silence.
Death occurred in Javabad, Isfahan
Died in Tarom on January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1404). Listed as entry #2288 in a memorial list.
Kurdish citizen shot by Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps forces during popular protests in Karnachi neighborhood of Kermanshah

Shot during suppression of nationwide protests in the evening of 18 Dey in Afsariyeh neighborhood of Tehran, on 29th Street in front of his business place, targeted with direct bullet shot from behind at close range. His body was delivered to his family with delay and his burial ceremony was held on 25 Dey. He had recently married and was planning to build a new future with his wife at the beginning of their married life.

20-year-old Kurdish citizen from Sirvan, Ilam province, killed by direct gunfire from Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Tehran on Thursday evening 18 Dey 1404. Shot with war bullets.
Cinema actor and assistant director, Gilaki citizen from Bandar Kiashahr in Gilan province, shot by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran during protests

Shot from behind from inside a Basij base on the night of January 7. The bullet went through his heart from behind and exited through the front. He was a nature lover, athlete, and guardian of the Zagros oak trees.
Death occurred in Izeh on January 8, 2026

22-year-old monarchist from Izeh, killed at 10 PM on Hafez South Street in Izeh by security forces with three bullets. His family broke into the morgue at night to retrieve his body to prevent the Islamic Republic from conducting forced interviews and receiving money from them. He was buried at 5 AM on 19 Dey 1404 in Takht Kashan village in Izeh.
Shot with direct gunfire by suppression forces in Izeh. Kurdish/Lor ethnicity from Izeh

Shot in the head with a war weapon by suppressive forces. The bullet hit his head and the severity of the injury was such that his head was shattered. Originally from Ramhormoz, Khuzestan, and from the Lor ethnic group. Had migrated from Khuzestan to Karaj to make a living. Was a barber and also worked in perfume sales to support his mother. Had lost his father and had been forced to work since childhood.
Died in Karaj on January 8, 2026 (18 Dey 1404)
Died on January 8, 2026 in Sirjan
Shot by suppression forces in Yazdanshahr, Isfahan
Shot by regime forces during national uprising in Fooladshahr, Isfahan. Killed by bullets from terrorist Islamic Republic regime suppressors during Iran's national protests.

17-year-old from Salas Babajani, player for Saipa youth football team, shot with war bullet by security forces during popular protests in Tehran. According to his father Adel Moradi in video released by government media when receiving his son's body, he was shot from close range from behind.

Kurdish citizen from Divandareh, killed by Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Tehran. He had lost his mother several years ago and was living with his grandfather's family in Tehran. His body was delivered to the family after several days and the burial ceremony was held on 30 Dey in Tazeh Ava Vazir village in Divandareh.

Kurdish woman from Marivan studying textile and fashion design at Shariati College in Tehran. Shot in the head from close range from behind after joining a protest after leaving college. Family traveled from Kermanshah to Tehran to identify her body among hundreds of young people. Intelligence forces surrounded family home and prevented burial, forcing family to bury her body along the road between Kermanshah and Kamyaran.
Arrested from her home on the 18th or 19th of Dey month and not being released

Truck driver from Mobarakeh, Isfahan. Shot directly by government forces on the evening of 19 Dey. According to witnesses, he was targeted from behind with a war bullet and simultaneously hit with pellets from the front. His father, who was standing a few meters away, ran toward the injured person after hearing gunshots and discovered it was his own son. Rostam was severely wounded with blood coming from his mouth. He was transferred to hospital but died due to the severity of his injuries. Around 3-4 AM, armed government forces entered the hospital and forcibly removed the bodies of the deceased at gunpoint, despite resistance from families.
Father, died alongside his son Amirali Ahmadi Kouhbanani

45-year-old protester, married and father of two children. Joined protests in Mashhad with his friends on 18 Dey 1404. Went missing during clashes between protesters and security forces in the '7 Tir' area of Mashhad. After 5 days missing, his family found his body in 'Behesht Reza' cemetery in Mashhad, with signs of beating on his body and a bullet in his side.
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime

Mechanical engineer and graduate of Gilan University who ran a classic car repair shop. Shot in the side during popular protests in Sadeghiyeh area of Tehran while present on the street with her sister. Her sister transported her bloodied body by motorcycle toward the hospital, but she died before reaching the medical center. Family was subjected to severe security pressures to refrain from publicizing news of her death.

Recently graduated student from Amirkabir University of Technology (Tehran Polytechnic), class of 2019. Killed during the massacre on 18th and 19th Dey month in Tehran. Her body was recently returned to her family, and due to pressure, there has been limited information dissemination about this martyr. Initial information about her death was first published through stories and messages from friends and classmates on social networks.

Mechanic who was 24 years old, described as a happy and cheerful young man. He had just bought equipment and wanted to rent a shop to work independently. Shot with one bullet to his side and one bullet to his head in Chalous. His body was returned with threats and commitments. During his funeral procession, people chanted 'Death to Khamenei'.
25-year-old Gilaki citizen from Tonekabon, shot in the head by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government

Kurdish citizen from Lahijan, Gilan province. Shot by suppressive forces during people's protests. Targeted by a sniper from the top of the police station building, with the bullet hitting below his eye.
Shot directly with war bullets by IRGC (Revolutionary Guards) in Lahijan, body was buried at midnight without permission for mourning ceremony
22-year-old from Isfahan

Shop owner who went out toward Khaqani street in Isfahan on Thursday night. Shot directly in the leg, arrested while wounded, then executed with a shot to the head while in custody. Body returned after one week for 400 million rials
Shot with direct fire by Iranian regime forces in Tehran. He was a citizen of Talesh from Masal and resident of Qods city in Tehran. He had recently married.

Shot in the stomach in Tehran. When they saw he was still alive, they suffocated him. His body was thrown into an empty lot in Tehran that was full of corpses. Family searched everywhere for him, then authorities told them to go find and take their child's body from there. The family retrieved the body with great difficulty and buried him in their village near Quchan.
Killed during 2025-2026 Iranian protests

Graduate architecture student shot by government forces during nighttime shooting on Mehranpour Street in Narmak, Tehran. He was with his family members when the shooting occurred and was trying to move them away from the incident location when he was targeted by bullets from Islamic Republic regime agents. He was shot in the kidney area, transferred to Ansari Hospital in Narmak, but died despite medical efforts.
38-year-old from Azimiyeh, Karaj killed on 18 or 19 Dey 1404
Killed on 18 Dey, body was found in Kahrizak after five days and buried in Behesht-e Rezvan cemetery in Shahriar
30 years old, married, national and Asian Muay Thai champion, shot directly with bullet from behind in front of his wife and mother by government agents during popular protests

Engineer at Arak Refinery who disappeared on January 8, 2026 during protests on Shariati Street in Arak. His family had no information about his whereabouts for 6 days until his lifeless body was handed over to them at the Arak morgue on January 14, 2026. Authorities provided no clear explanation regarding the circumstances of his death or whether he had been detained prior to his killing.
Killed during protests in Azimiyeh, Karaj area. Date uncertain - either 18 or 19 Dey 1404

Shot with eight bullets while helping injured people in front of Rashid police station in Tehranpars. He had been detained during 2022-2023 protests. He had a seven-year-old son waiting for him at home.

Shot directly in the heart during a chase with security forces in Masoor neighborhood of Khorramabad. Family immediately washed and shrouded his body to prevent security forces from taking it. Security forces later came to the family home attempting to forcibly take the body, but family elders resisted and after a confrontation, the agents were forced to retreat and flee

Kurdish citizen from Qoch Tepe village in Asadabad, Hamedan, father of two children. Shot in the leg by Islamic Republic military-security forces during popular protests in Saveh city in Markazi province on 18 Dey 1404. After being transferred to a hospital in Tehran, he died two days later due to severity of injuries. Security institutions did not allow transfer of his body to his hometown and family was forced to bury him in Saveh city.

Shot in the head with live ammunition by government forces during popular protests. Killed by a sniper positioned on top of a building near the gathering location. He had made a will requesting that if killed by Islamic Republic forces, his death announcement should state he was a 'martyr for the homeland', but security forces prevented his family from honoring this request and called him a 'rioter' instead. Originally from Ashtian in Markazi Province.
