17-year-old Arab youth from Abadan's Maniohi district, killed by direct gunfire from suppression forces while participating in nationwide protests. He had traveled to Tehran for construction work.
Killed by Islamic Republic suppressors during protests in Arak. His family had no news of him for five days until they found his lifeless body at the Arak cemetery morgue.
Killed by Khamenei's agents on 18 Dey. Described as a hero of the nation and another brave person from Rasht.

Civil engineer and student at Azad University of Hashtgerd. Shot and killed by Islamic Republic agents with two bullets - first bullet fired from inside Gohardasht mosque (opposite the main Gohardasht police station) hit his side, second bullet hit the jugular artery in his neck. Died on the spot in front of his wife's eyes. Had participated continuously in protests from 2017 to 2025. Family was religious and regime-supporting. Body was initially not released, family had to pay costs related to bullets before burial was allowed three days later at local Atishgah cemetery with security forces present.

Son of Rahman, young Kurdish man from Abdanan. Arrested by regime mercenaries in Haft Hoz Narmak area of Tehran. Tortured for ten days resulting in broken ribs and two broken teeth. Currently imprisoned in Tehran's main prison without medical treatment.
Shot with a war bullet under the eye during protests
Father of two children named Sepehr and Arsam, killed during protests by Islamic Republic suppression forces

Shot in the head by Basij forces during protests in Parand, Tehran on Thursday 18 Dey. Died after several days in Robat Karim Hospital. Family was not allowed to hold funeral ceremony in Parand, so he was buried in Nasim Shahr
Killed by direct gunfire. From Javadiyeh, Tehran. Has a 15-year-old daughter.
Shot with war bullet (تیر جنگی). Had a 5-year-old child who still doesn't know his father was killed. Cousin's friend of the Twitter user.
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Tehranpars, Tehran

Shot with pellets and stabbed with a knife by Islamic Republic suppression forces during a protest in Masjed Soleyman. Originally from Bazoft, Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari Province. Was injured by knife wound to the thigh and pellet shots to the head area while in an alley leading to the IRGC base. Initially transferred to Shushtar hospital but was not admitted, then died on the way to Ahvaz hospital on the evening of 18 Dey. Body was buried three days later in Bazoft, Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari.
From Khormoj, shot in the throat during protests in Bushehr. Body was found in hospital two days after death. Buried four days later with only parents present under heavy security surveillance.
Died in Karaj

39-year-old Kurdish citizen from Haji Abad village in Tuyserkan, Hamedan province, resident of Shahriar Tehran, killed during popular protests by direct shooting from government forces, with a war bullet hitting his neck area. He was the father of a young child.

Shot by security forces near Azadi Street in Tehran. Legal Medicine officials cited excessive bleeding as cause of death and returned only personal belongings including blood-stained clothes to family while withholding body for burial.

Shot with hunting pellets from less than 3 meters distance during protests on Amiri Street in Abadan. Father of a 3-year-old child named Ariamehr. His body was held by security agencies for 5 days, and family received it only after threats and giving heavy commitments. Buried on Tuesday 23 Dey 1404.

33-year-old Kurdish man from Mehran in Ilam province, oil company contractor in Abadan. Shot directly with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Abadan on Thursday evening 18 Dey 1404. Family was threatened for 5 days and had to give written commitment before being allowed to collect his body. Buried on Tuesday 23 Dey 1404 in his birthplace, Chalab village in Mehran county. He was married with one young child.

Shot with direct gunfire to the head during Iran's national uprising. Body was delivered to family from Shiraz only after one week and under severe security pressure with written commitment not to hold ceremonies and avoid any gatherings. Buried at 6 AM without public ceremonies in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery in Abgashneh village, Mamasani county. Reports indicate continuous threats and pressure on the family. Father of two daughters.
Died in Khorramabad on 18 Dey 1404

Athlete from the village of Hajilarghala in Gonbad-e Kavus, Golestan, born in 2000, medal-winning champion in kickboxing and martial arts, from Iran's Turkmen community, killed by security forces of the Islamic Republic regime during the nationwide protests
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Isfahan
15-year-old who died on 18 Dey 1404 in Karaj
Shot directly by bullets from regime criminals while standing with the people. Killed for the crime of standing beside the people and became a victim of the deadly violence of suppressors.
Shot in the back/lumbar region by security forces, died from excessive bleeding
Father of a 5-year-old daughter who was told her father went on a long trip and would never return. Killed in Ariashahr, Tehran.

Shot with direct gunfire by Islamic Republic forces while holding her mother's hand in front of the shrine in Astaneh Ashrafiyeh. Killed without any confrontation or threat, dying in front of her mother's eyes. Mother, in indescribable shock and fear that officers would take her daughter's body, transported the corpse home and kept it with her until morning.
Killed in Hashtgerd on 18 Dey (January 8, 2026)

Shot with war bullet near Tus neighborhood police station, Meraj Square in Mashhad. Body was delivered to Razavi Hospital in Mashhad at 10:30 PM. Family searched hospitals during the night, his phone briefly turned on near dawn and someone answered saying to come to Razavi Hospital Mashhad, then phone went dead. Body was identified through photos shown to family. Buried in Behesht Reza cemetery. Family was threatened by Astan Quds Razavi Khorasan to declare him a martyr. Employee, studying for associate degree.

Shot directly by security forces during protests in Gohardasht main street. Initially shot in the heart area and severely wounded. Eyewitnesses report that after being injured in front of Gohardasht police station, security forces prevented his companions from providing aid and rescue by shooting again. He was then transferred inside the police station and killed by gunfire. His body was only handed over to the family after they were forced to pay one billion tomans as 'bullet fee'. The family was under security pressure to remain silent and refrain from informing others.
Died in Shahrak-e Andisheh
Mentioned as one of three citizens killed, reported by Hengaw three days after internet shutdown.

Killed during protest suppression. Disappeared on 18 Dey 1404 while working as a wire winder. Family was uninformed of his fate for two weeks. Body was returned to family on 6 Bahman after extended concealment by authorities.

Shot by a sniper from government forces of the Islamic Republic while in the area of Falakeh Kakh in Gorgan. The shooting was carried out from the top of Sarmayeh Tower. Security institutions pressured the family to declare he was a Basiji member and conditioned the return of his body on accepting this narrative. Family and relatives emphasize that he was a protester and rights activist with no affiliation to government institutions.
Martyred in Bandar Abbas, Hormozgan province during the protests
Shot by Islamic Republic mercenary forces. He was from Dinavar, Kermanshah province, and had come to Tehran to earn a living. Left behind a 5-year-old daughter.
Young Lor man killed in Tehran during protests

Shot and killed during Iran's national uprising. Friends say his name was deliberately removed from narratives and the regime wants this crime buried in silence. On his last night, he told his friend 'you take my daughter, I'll come' and never returned.

Kurdish dentist from Islamabad-e Gharbi (Shabad) in Kermanshah Province, shot and killed with live ammunition by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests on Thursday evening 18 Dey 1404. He was a well-known and respected figure among the people of Islamabad-e Gharbi (Shabad). His killing caused a wave of anger and grief among the people of the city.
Died in Mashhad on January 8, 2026
Shot in the eyes with bullets in front of Shahrak Vali-e Asr police station in Tehran. His mother says he grew up as an orphan and she devoted all her youth to raising him.
20-year-old athlete who had just completed mandatory military service. Shot directly to the head by government suppression forces during people's protests.
Victim listed in Iran International Memorial records from Ghaleh Hassan Khan area of Tehran
Died in Haft-Hoz area of Tehran
From Yazd, resident of Nasim Shahr Tehran, killed by gunfire from military-security forces of the Islamic Republic during popular protests in the city
Shot with fifty shotgun pellets to the chest and heart by suppression forces in Abyek, Qazvin
17-year-old Turkish child from Karaj, killed by direct shooting by government suppression forces during protests on Thursday evening

Shot directly in the neck and chest during protests by security forces of the Islamic Republic regime. Succumbed to injuries in hospital. In one of his final messages wrote: 'My life is in such a mess now that I don't see next year; either I must die or Khamenei.'

15-year-old Kurdish child from Khalkhal (Ardabil province) living in Shahrqods (Qaleh Hassan Khan), Tehran. Shot directly with war bullets by government suppression forces during popular protests on Mosalla Street. His body was taken by family members the same night in a private car to their village 'Lonbar' where he was buried.
Death occurred in Shiraz on January 8, 2026
Killed by Islamic Republic forces during evening protests in Chamestan

Shot from behind with a war bullet by suppressive forces around 9 PM on Thursday 18 Dey 1404, which was his birthday. The bullet hit him from behind and passed through his thigh area. Due to severe injuries and heavy bleeding, his transfer to hospital was delayed. He arrived at the hospital around 12:30 AM and suffered brain death. Doctors managed to revive him once, but he ultimately died around 4 AM. He worked at a cardboard manufacturing company as a driver and executive worker. He had lost his father at age 9 and his sister at age 17-18, and was the only remaining member of his family.
23-year-old Kurdish Yarsan citizen shot and killed by IRGC forces during popular protests in Dare-Darizh neighborhood of Kermanshah. His funeral was held with widespread public attendance.
Shot with 3 war bullets to his chest in Tehran. Buried on January 19, 2026 in Behesht-e Zahra cemetery.

Trans man who was shot directly in the heart with a bullet. He was 24 years old, worked in accounting with a diploma degree, and was employed at a large manufacturing company in Baghestan area of Karaj. He also worked as a Snap driver after his main job to cover his expenses. Member of the queer community who, despite being assigned female at birth, did not consider himself a girl. The neighborhood where he lived did not have the capacity to accept his identity, but his family ultimately accepted his gender identity, as evidenced by the non-feminine photo they placed on his grave.

Killed in Lahijan. Her body was stolen from Piroz Hospital in Lahijan by authorities at dawn on Friday and taken to Bagh Rezvan in Rasht. This process was repeated 4 times until the family was able to bury her in Bazargan neighborhood of Rudsar on 22 Dey.
Died in Lahijan on 18 Dey 1404

42-year-old mother of two children and nurse at Aram Hospital in Karaj. Killed in Mehrvila. According to witnesses, she approached to help a girl who had been beaten. At that moment, she was shot in the spleen from behind. Her sisters who reached her were also targeted with violence - they were severely beaten, their hands were broken, and they were struck in the face with brass knuckles.
12-year-old Gilaki child from Ramsar, shot directly with military bullets by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government in front of the Intelligence building in Ramsar city

Gilaki citizen and violin teacher from Siahkal, shot by Islamic Republic forces in the vicinity of Lahijan governorate. Eyewitnesses described the shooting as from a distance in the governorate area. Method of killing described as 'unusual'. Body buried in Barfjan shrine in the city.
Dr. Sanaz Mousavi, an anesthesiologist, was shot in the head by regime forces in Haft-e Tir area of Mashhad
Shot with war bullet during massive protests in Mashhad, died as a martyr for the homeland

Shot by Islamic Republic suppressive forces while leaving Mehr clinic in Shiraz. First hit by shotgun pellets, then killed with a war bullet. Her body was delivered to her family under pressure and threats from security forces who demanded silence about the crime.

Shot in the head with a war bullet in Emamat area of Mashhad. Body returned to family 3 days later after payment and threats not to hold any ceremonies. Death certificate falsely listed cause as collision with agricultural machinery. Left behind two daughters aged 19 and 6.

Killed by the Islamic Republic regime, with family forced to claim she died of a heart attack. She was strongly opposed to the Islamic Republic and had continuous activity in the 2022 protests (Mahsa Zhina Amini). Someone falsely claimed on Instagram that she died of a heart attack and that they received her body, but investigation with her closest associates confirmed she was killed by the regime.

Shot from behind on Moradi Street in Bandar Abbas at 10 PM in front of his wife. Family forced to pay 1 billion [rials/tomans] to retrieve body and sign document claiming he was a Basij member. Family under severe pressure. Previously arrested in 1401 (2022) during anti-government protests.
Victim documented by Hengaw Organization for Human Rights

17-year-old resident of Babolsar who was arrested in Amol after being hit by two bullets. After 23 days, there is still no news of her condition. Security institutions have threatened her family to remain silent and only requested payment of 2 billion tomans to provide news about Sayeda.
Shot with war bullets in the area of Se Rah-e Simin, Isfahan. Referred to affectionately as cousin's son by the tweeter.
Shot in the head by Islamic Republic security forces during suppression of popular protests. He was directly targeted by gunfire and killed as an unarmed civilian victim of lethal violence.
Referenced as a victim with the phrase 'his name hasn't become a hashtag yet', suggesting he was killed but has not received widespread social media attention
Shot in the head with war bullets on the first day of the protests. Killed in Sirjan where many people were killed but few dared to speak about it due to Islamic Republic death threats.
Shot by bullet to throat and chest in Alahiyeh area of Mashhad during protests

Shot by the regime in the streets for protesting. Was an orphan with no family to receive her body after paying the $4,500 fine demanded by the IRGC for removing bullets from bodies of murdered protesters before burial. Buried in an unmarked mass grave. Her Telegram channel was called 'The Girl Who Was a Sun'.
Shot by IRGC forces during protests. The suppressive IRGC forces of the Islamic Republic targeted this brave woman's body with bullets.
Shot with bullet to the neck area in the vicinity of the overpass in Ashrafi Isfahani, Tehran. Buried in Shiraz.
Shot by government mercenary forces during the violent suppression of popular protests. Originally from Kuhdasht county.
18-year-old from Kerman, remembered with phrase 'may your soul rest in peace'
Died in Fardis, Karaj

Kurdish Yarsan citizen from Qasr-e Shirin who went missing on January 8, 2026 after participating in popular protests in Fardis, Karaj. Family was informed of his death on February 2, 2026 through government institutions. Killed in Fardis, Karaj and his body was transferred to Kahrizak. Family was under severe pressure from security forces and warned not to speak to media or inform anyone, or the body would not be returned. Death certificate listed cause of death as 'heart attack'. Body was returned to family on February 4, 2026 and buried under security control in a very short time in Behesht-e Sakineh cemetery in Shahriar.
Fatally shot in the chest by Islamic Republic forces
Killed in Koochesafahan during protests. The message indicates that even a 4-year-old girl was also killed in Koochesafahan.
Died in Kuchsafahan on January 8, 2026 during the protests. Also known by the name Aryan.
Killed during protests in Shahreza on bloody days of 18-19 Dey by direct gunfire with war bullets or pellets

30-year-old electrical engineer and resident of Qeshm Island, shot from behind by Islamic Republic forces while unarmed during suppression of popular protests. He was an ordinary citizen living a simple and peaceful life, interested in mountaineering, ran a shop in Qeshm, and was known by friends as kind, humanitarian, and animal-loving, especially cats. He was unmarried with a bright future ahead. Local witnesses say he was directly shot from behind on January 8th without being armed or posing any threat to anyone.
Kurdish Yarsan citizen killed by gunfire from Islamic Republic's military-security forces during popular protests in Tehran
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime. Death occurred on either 18 or 19 Dey 1404
Killed on Thursday night. According to locals, they were peaceful youth. Shot in the stomach.

Shot three times in the chest by security forces near Imam Hossein area on Daneshjo Boulevard near Midon. He was from Amirabab neighborhood (Enghelab Street) in Yazd. Lost his father in 2008. On Thursday night January 8th, he was taking his two sisters and mother home and was heading toward Imam Hossein when he was killed. Buried on Tuesday in block 2 of Rezvan Khaldbarin cemetery in Yazd.

Kurdish citizen from Kermanshah, retired from Road and Transportation Department, shot with live ammunition by government suppression forces during popular protests in Nobhar neighborhood. He was shot along with his son, who was injured while Shahab was killed. His body was buried on Sunday 21 Dey 1404 in Bagh Ferdows cemetery in Kermanshah.

Young woman from Tehran killed by direct gunfire from government security forces during popular protests. Both her parents had previously died and she lived alone with her brother, supporting herself by selling handmade dolls.
Shot with two bullets to the neck and one bullet to the pelvis in Fardis, Karaj. Body was forcibly handed over after three days and money was demanded for it.
Shot with direct gunfire by regime suppressive forces while participating in national uprising. Killed for the crime of standing with the people and participating in Iran's national uprising.
Died in Urmia. Mentioned as nephew (خواهرزاده) suggesting family relationship to another victim.

Shot while helping a wounded person in Qaleh Hassan Khan. First shot in the leg, then when they saw he was still standing, shot in the side. He gave his home address and was taken home where he died in his father's arms. Family was not allowed to bury him in Tehran.
Described as martyred (شهاب), with phrase 'my child went for other young people' suggesting he died for others during protests

Shot with bullet during protests in Gilan province. Family refused to take him to hospital due to unsafe conditions and security atmosphere, fearing he would be killed in hospital as there were multiple reports of finishing shots being fired at wounded protesters. He was taken home to find treatment but died at home. He was an athlete, described as a modest, calm and well-mannered young person who was noble and beloved, with a life connected to sports, morals and respect for others.
Shot in the head with war bullets by Islamic Republic mercenaries
Shot in the heart with war bullets by government suppressive forces during popular protests in Rasht. Resident of Rasht from Jirdeh rural district in Shaft county, Gilan province

Shot and killed by plainclothes officers in a white Samand car on the night of 18th Dey. Family retrieved his body with great difficulty and buried him at 3-4 AM without anyone present, under complete media silence. Intelligence officers threatened the family that if anyone held ceremonies or posted announcements, they would arrest his brother and father. He had completed all his marriage and engagement preparations and was planning to finalize arrangements in the coming days when he was killed by the Islamic Republic.
Her husband Mehdi Khbat (Kakaii) was injured with her, and after being discharged from the hospital, he committed suicide
Location noted as Meydan-e Kakh (Palace Square) in Gorgan
Died in Esfarayen
Shot with war bullets by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic terrorist regime in Fouladshahr, Isfahan. He was the father of a 9-year-old child. Born in Aligudarz.
German-Iranian dual citizen
Killed in the path of homeland during Iranian protests, buried in Nourabad Mamasani
Shot directly by suppression forces in Mamasani

Shot directly by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic terrorist regime in Saveh. Originally from Borujerd, resident of Saveh, married for two years, worked as an employee of a company. His body was buried in Borujerd on 28 Dey after ten days of pressure and delay. He was neither a criminal nor armed, but a victim of organized massacre of people who only wanted the right to life and freedom.
High school principal killed during protests

Teacher who was found beheaded. Body was discovered unidentified in Razvan Garden. Family spent one week looking for him. Authorities delayed burial for three weeks under the pretext of identity verification.
Shot from behind with a war bullet by Islamic Republic forces during protests in Gohardasht area. He was a 25-year-old unmarried man who came to the streets for freedom and human dignity.
Died in Piroozi area of Tehran

Student at Beheshti National University, daughter of Fatah and Shirin, from Baneh city, killed by direct gunfire from suppressive forces during popular protests in Tehran. Security institutions returned her body to family after applying pressure, threats and obtaining commitments, and in exchange for payment of 150 million tomans. Buried on Monday evening 6 Bahman 1404 in Baneh cemetery.
Shot directly in the head with two war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces in Fardis, Karaj. She had a one-year-old son and was buried in Behesht-e Ali cemetery in Karaj.

Kurdish man from Eslamabad-e Gharb (Shabad) killed by direct gunshot to the head from Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests. Shot around 9 PM in front of the governorate building in Eslamabad-e Gharb. Security agencies and IRGC pressured family to take the body but family refused to let the body leave Cheshmeh-Khani village. Government agencies demanded money from the family which the family explicitly refused.
18-year-old daughter killed with repeated blows to head and face. Her lifeless body was found 10 days later. Killed alongside her father Ali Javid.
35-year-old woman from Sari, killed in Sadeghieh Square, Tehran after being hit by 6 bullets fired by security forces while rushing to help the wounded during protests

Professional photographer and mother of two daughters from Arak, shot and killed by regime suppressive forces during Iran's national uprising while standing with the people and documenting the truth. Killed for the crime of standing with the people and recording reality.
Owner of Ava cafe, resident of Tehranpars, Amin Street. Killed during shooting by armed forces.
Died in Qarchak on 18 Dey 1404

Shot with live ammunition while dancing Kurdish dances around a fire in Punak Square after a placard of Qassem Soleimani was burned. Initially wounded and taken to Al-Ghadir Hospital which had no capacity, then transferred to Rasoul Akram Hospital where he died at 2 a.m. on Friday due to lack of medical attention and severe blood loss. From the city of Bukan. Was one of 22 young people shot down at the scene. Body was assigned number 12647 at Kahrizak Forensic Medicine Center among five thousand bodies.

Shot with a bullet to his back by Islamic Republic forces. He was 37 years old, had recently gotten his life together, renovated his house, and was planning to marry his partner. He was supportive of those around him and had helped many people in his neighborhood. On Thursday 18 Dey, he called his mother saying he wanted to go out that night. Despite his mother's insistence that he not go, he said 'Mother, if I don't go, who will? Look at our living situation, you take care of yourselves, I'll watch out for myself.' He went out and never returned.

Shot with war bullets by Islamic Republic forces in front of the Imam Ali IRGC base building in Meybod. Security forces attempted to present him as a 'Basiji' and 'government martyr' but his mother explicitly rejected this. From a well-known family in Meybod - his uncle was the first casualty from this city in the Iran-Iraq war and one of Meybod's boulevards is named after him. His death occurred on the anniversary of his father's death.

Shot by suppression forces with war bullets during protests in Tehran Pars neighborhood. Transported to Tehran Pars Hospital at Third Circle where he died. Was an only child from a well-off family, a responsible teenager who participated in protests. Was a student who was planning to emigrate to Canada to continue his studies.

Shot with direct gunfire by suppressive forces. Had family relationship with Matin Montazerzohour. Both were concerned about freedom and went to the streets, but the response to their protest against the current situation was bullets.
Shot and killed during protests. Member of the same family as Matin MontazerZohour, both from Gorgan
Died in Fardis, Karaj on 18 Dey 1404

Shot in the head during protest. Initially wounded in the leg and walked to hospital herself. Family was told she was 'not there' when they went to find her. Body was later returned showing she had been executed with a bullet to the head. Islamic Republic demanded 700 million tomans (approximately $5,000-$6,000) to hand over her body.

Young Kurdish man shot with three direct bullets by regime's suppressive forces during national uprising protests in Satarkhan area of Tehran. Killed for standing with the people during Iran's national uprising.
From Kuhdasht, Lorestan province. Killed by suppressive forces through direct gunshot in Tehran.
Shot with two bullets to chest and abdomen during protests for freedom from Islamic regime
Real estate advisor and professional bodybuilder. Shot on Jihad Street in Astaneh. Witness reports he was hit with both pellets and war bullets from Kalashnikov rifle.
Shot and killed by gunfire. Family has not shared photos publicly due to fear of government repression.
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Kermanshah
Died in Shahenshahr, Shahriar
Died on 18 Dey 1404 in Narmak, Tehran

Kickboxing athlete shot during protests. Initially targeted with pellet shots, then while fleeing despite being wounded, security forces shot him in the side from behind with a pistol. He was taken alive to an ambulance, but friends found his body hours later with signs of bruising on his neck. He had told others he was going to a 'wedding' and had even visited a barbershop before participating in the protests.

39-year-old tailor and mother of an 11-year-old daughter, shot directly by Islamic Republic suppression forces around 7 PM on January 8, 2026, while returning from work during gatherings in Nazi-Abad, Tehran. Her body was retrieved by family from Kahrizak forensic medicine after hours of fear and uncertainty. Her 11-year-old daughter Dorsa was home alone waiting for her mother who never returned. Buried in Asadabad, Hamedan.

Young married woman returning home with her husband in Daneshgah Square when attacked by Basij forces. After witnessing her husband's brutal killing, she was shot with 27 pellets to her head and face and struck multiple times on the back of her head, completely destroying the back of her skull. Regime took the bodies and held memorial services claiming them as their own martyrs, even circulating announcements around Daneshgah Square and conducting their own burial ceremonies. Couple was monarchist, not regime supporters. Left behind a 9th grade child.
Lost her life from direct fire in the Khaksefid area of Tehranpars.
Killed by Islamic Republic forces in Pare Sar city, Gilan province

Volleyball player and young Iranian woman shot by regime suppressive forces. Described as a sporty, hopeful and defenseless girl whose only crime was standing with her people and homeland. Killed as part of targeted killing policy against Iranian youth.
Language instructor from Shiraz, fatally shot by Islamic Republic forces on Friday evening. Shot in the head from close range of approximately six meters. Died due to severity of injuries.

Language teacher and beloved educational figure. Shot directly with a war bullet at close range (about 6 meters) in the head in the Sadra neighborhood of Shiraz by Khamenei's mercenaries. Her body was buried under severe security measures in a completely controlled environment in Ghalat village, Shiraz. The burial ceremony was held with severe restrictions on public attendance and under security forces' supervision.
15-year-old teenager shot with live ammunition by plainclothes agents during protests. His family was forced to pay $3,500—a so-called 'bullet fee'—to have his body released for burial
Killed during protests in Golpayegan, a small city where families have remained silent due to severe suppression atmosphere
Shot by government forces on Ferdowsi Bridge in Isfahan in front of his family. He was an elite computer engineering student and the only son of his family.

Disappeared on 18 Dey in Rasht. His mobile phone was found on Golsar Street with only a few photos on it. No trace of him at the medical examiner's office, but he is also not on the list of detainees.
16-year-old victim in Isfahan
Killed by the Islamic Republic regime on 18 Dey 1404
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial
12-year-old child shot in the face and neck with pellet bullets by security forces at a distance of less than one meter

Shot from behind with direct gunfire by regime suppression forces on Niroye Daryayi Resalat Street. Taken to Shahde Tajrish Hospital where she died thirsty and hungry in her mother's arms. She was her mother's only child.

Kurdish woman and mother of two young children (ages 9 and 13 named Surna and Samyar), killed by direct shooting with war bullets by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests in Kermanshah's Moalem neighborhood. She died in front of her child's eyes. Her body was buried on January 12, 2026 (22 Dey 1404).

Killed in Yasouj. After his death, family was pressured by security agencies to introduce him as a 'Basiji'. The regime prevented the family from holding mourning ceremonies to bury their crime in silence.

Killed by IRGC during protests in Kermanshah, Kurdistan Region. Family stated there were no visible bullet wounds on his body and he probably died as a result of severe tear-gas inhalation. Also known as Mohammadreza Kianimanesh.

Brother of Hamid Arzanloo, entrepreneur and well-known activist in Iran's furniture industry. When he went to the scene to help and rescue his brother Hamid, he was targeted by two bullets to the neck area and also fell into a coma. Died in hospital. Security institutions demanded 1.5 billion tomans from family to return the body and forced them to sign a commitment to declare the cause of death as 'brain stroke'. Family was also required to attend mandatory government rally at Revolution Square. Father of three young children.

Brother of Hamid Arzanlou. Shot twice in the neck while running to help his wounded brother. Died in hospital days after his brother's death. Regime demanded $30,000 to return body and forced family to sign false cause of death.
Memorial record from Iran International, specific circumstances not provided in the source text
Teacher, killed by regime forces on Ashrafi Esfahani street in Tehran
Afghan national killed on 18 Dey 1404 in Tehranpars, Tehran

Shot directly in the eye by suppression forces at Sadeghieh Square. He was a patriot and honorable man who had resigned from the Air Force in 2022 during the Mahsa Amini uprising. He was the father of two daughters aged 4 and 9.
Shot in the right side of chest with a war bullet, died in hospital two hours later
Died in Pakdasht
45-year-old from Fardis, Karaj killed during protests
Shot directly by government suppression forces during people's protests on 18 Dey 1404, transferred to Amin Hospital but died two days later due to severity of injuries

Shot directly in the heart with a bullet in Arsanjan city, Fars province. He was a cafe owner and father of a one-year-old daughter. Described as a social, cheerful, and warm person who had friendly relationships with everyone and was well-known among the city's people.
Shot with military bullet to the heart by IRGC forces during popular protests. Married father of two children. Shot at close range, bullet hit from behind and struck his heart area.
Shot by sniper with eight live rounds, died in her mother's arms
Commemorated as a victim, context suggests death during protests
45-year-old protester and father of a 7-year-old daughter, killed by direct gunshot from suppressors while in his wife's arms in Tehran
Commemorated with banners in Baghershah, Tehran. Families were threatened to remain silent about their deaths.

Chemistry student shot and killed while trying to rescue a wounded girl who had been shot. Killed by forces of the Velayat-e Faqih regime. Family was not allowed to bury him in Arak, so his body was buried in Gazran village

Dedicated musician and music instructor, master of tar and setar instruments, director of 'Pezhvak Honar' music academy. Shot directly in the head with a military-grade bullet. Body remained missing for seven days until authorities contacted family for identification.

18-year-old Kurdish youth from Ab-e Anar, Abdanan, Ilam province. Shot directly in the chest with a Kalashnikov bullet by Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests at the second circle of Dowlatabad Tehran on Friday evening 19 Dey 1404. His body was buried in Ibn Babuyeh cemetery in Rey city, Tehran province.

Shot with direct war bullets to chest, head and neck after capture of Basij base at Falakeh Gaz. Young man from Rasht. Family was under financial pressure and forced to sign statement claiming he was a Basij member, but during burial ceremony family and companions chanted 'Long Live the Shah' and 'Oath to the blood of comrades'

Shot with bullets by Islamic Republic suppressors during protests in Dareh Daraz (Dejir) neighborhood of Kermanshah. He was a student studying in Italy who had returned home for New Year winter holidays. He was from the Kurdish Yarsan community.
Lawyer who was killed during popular protests. After her killing, her family was pressured and threatened by security agencies to remain silent and refrain from public disclosure
Graduate student in geophysics studying in Italy who had returned to Kermanshah for holidays just days before being killed. Shot by security forces.
Shot by suppression forces in Karaj. Lur ethnicity.
Kurdish citizen from Harsin, Kermanshah province, shot with live ammunition by government suppressive forces during popular protests in Shahriyar, Tehran province
Killed during protests in Mashhad. Mother is requesting people to call out his name.
Shot with eight war bullets by a sniper from suppressive forces, died in her mother's arms
Shot with a war bullet in the throat area during the national uprising in Meraj Square, Mashhad. Killed for standing with the people during the protests.
Christian firefighter who was shot in the head while trying to save people from the siege when regime mercenaries set fire to Rasht bazaar

Shot from behind with war bullets while moving away from the scene during protests in Fouladshahr. Security forces engaged in widespread and direct shooting. An unknown person who knew Younes transported his wounded body by car to near his family's home. The family, thinking he was alive, took him to Fouladshahr Hospital where blood was seen from his mouth and nose. The hospital doors were closed and families were denied information. Many other bodies were also brought to the hospital by families. After about 10 hours, no clear information was given to the family, and the next day bodies were transferred from the hospital by security agencies. The family went through a long, ambiguous process with pressure and threats to receive the body. After about 10 days, the family was told the body could only be buried with limited attendance and no public ceremony. Younes had been working since adolescence in jobs like construction and welding, and just one week before his death had started a new job as a CNC cutting machine operator at a company.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial from Park Square area in Mashhad
Died in Rudehen, Tehran
Victim from Sabzevar, Khorasan Razavi province

Flower seller from Mashiririeh area of Tehran who came to the streets for freedom on 18 Dey. Trapped by suppressive forces in Haft Howz Square in Tehran, shot with a final bullet to his forehead. After the killing, his lifeless body was transferred to Kahrizak and abandoned as part of the regime's pattern of murder and concealment of crimes.
Died in Haft-e Howz area of Tehran
Death occurred in Parand on 19 Dey 1404
Commemorated with phrase 'eternal name' (جاویدنام) suggesting martyrdom/death in protests

Shot directly in the heart by war bullet from Islamic Republic suppression forces during popular protests. 27-year-old merchant from Chalous who had migrated there with his family several years prior. His parents' origins trace back to Kermanj people from Quchan city in Razavi Khorasan province, and his body was buried in that city. Described by relatives as a calm, oppressed, and unarmed young man who went to the streets only for peaceful protest and solidarity with other citizens.
Killed for homeland and freedom. Originally from Bahar county in Hamadan province, became eternal in Bagh-e Feyz, Eslamshahr
Shot in the back of the head. Initially authorities prevented the family from receiving her body, but it was eventually buried in Imamzadeh Heydar in Kalak County.

Shot and killed during protests on Qeshm Island in front of her son's eyes, near Bustan Qeshm police station. She had participated in protests alongside her son. Her body was buried in Sadeh five days later without ceremony.

Shot by suppressive forces during protests on Qeshm Island. After the shooting, family and relatives faced severe restrictions and were not even allowed to say goodbye and give a final kiss to the body. When they reached Zahra Arjomandi's body, it was still warm and efforts were made to urgently transfer her to the hospital and perform initial resuscitation procedures, but at the medical center it was announced that she had died. She was a well-known figure in Qeshm's sports community, described as athletic, kind and friendly with close ties to the local sports community. She was the mother of Fardin, a bodybuilding trainer at Sanas Agh-Damoun Qeshm club.
From Baghbahaderan area of Lenjan, Isfahan province
Mother of two daughters from Baghbehadran, killed by direct shooting of government suppressive forces during people's protests

Kurdish citizen, 28 years old, dentist from Quchan living in Mashhad, killed during popular protests in Haft-Tir Square with direct shooting by government forces, war bullet hit to the head area. She was the cousin of Ali Mozaffari, who was killed in the 'Jin, Jiyan, Azadi' movement in Quchan.
Died on 19 Dey 1404 in Fardis, Karaj

17-year-old arrested on 18 Dey month in Fardis, Karaj. Three days after family inquiries, authorities first called from her phone saying she was alive, but when family went to inquire they were told to search for her among corpses. Her burial was not permitted in Karaj and her body was transferred to Tabriz for burial.

Master's student in Electrical Engineering at Amirkabir University of Technology, shot directly by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic during events related to Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi's first day call in Najafabad, Isfahan. She had graduated with a Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering from Isfahan University of Technology and achieved rank 146 in the 1403 Master's entrance exam.
Shot directly by suppressive forces during popular protests in Tehran. She was originally from Boukan, West Azerbaijan province, had recently married, and worked as a hairdresser in Tehran.

Pregnant 30-year-old woman from Gonabad, killed by direct gunshot with live ammunition to the neck area on Moalem Boulevard in Mashhad. She and her husband were chanting slogans when security forces pursued them. After entering one of the alleys around Moalem Boulevard, they were identified and stopped. Security forces shot her directly in the neck with live ammunition while she was pregnant. Her husband was also injured by shotgun pellets to the leg. They were transferred to Chamran Clinic in Mashhad, affiliated with the Revolutionary Guards, where she died due to inadequate medical care at the military-affiliated medical center.
Shot directly by forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran government in Shaft, Gilan. Described as a Gilaki citizen from Shaft.
28-year-old Gilaki citizen from Rasht, Gilan province. Shot with direct fire by government forces during popular protests in the city, died from impact of military bullet.
Shot in the head by a regime sniper during protests. She was 38 years old and worked as a taekwondo, TRX and bodybuilding coach.

Died after 8 days of hospitalization at Taleghani Hospital. Described as a soldier of Reza Shah II who went out of love for Pahlavi. While hospitalized, he told others to go to the streets to finish the work and said later a street should be named after him.

Shot with war bullet to the back and died from suffocation caused by chemical gas by government mercenaries on Shariati Street in Najafabad. After his death, they also denied him peace and did not allow his body to be buried in Haji cemetery
Employee of Khuzestan Steel Industries, killed by Islamic Republic's suppressive forces
Shot by direct fire from suppression forces. He was from Lordegan in Bakhtiari Province.
Killed by Islamic Republic mercenaries and hired agents of Velayat-e Faqih in Khomein city, Markazi Province-Arak
40-year-old woman from Neyshabur in Razavi Khorasan province
Executed by Iran's Judiciary, accused of spying for Israel's Mossad. First espionage-related execution in 2026.

Lor citizen from Lordegan, Chaharmahal and Bakhtiari province, shot directly by suppressive forces during popular protests. His funeral was held on January 19, 2026 with widespread citizen participation and anti-regime slogans. Exact date of death uncertain - occurred either January 8 or 9, 2026
13-year-old killed in Nahavand
Shot directly by suppression forces on 17 Dey 1404 in Isfahan

Shot by security forces while intervening to defend a girl who was being arrested by agents. Hit by two bullets in the chest and abdomen around 10 PM. Teacher and environmental activist arrested at his personal residence on Tuesday 30 Dey by Islamic Republic security forces raid. Graduate of software engineering (bachelor's) and artificial intelligence (master's) from Isfahan University of Technology. Has been teaching computer science at high school level since 1396 in Alborz province and Karaj city. Threatened and summoned multiple times by security and intelligence forces since 1401 due to his positions during Woman Life Freedom movement. Suspended from teaching for about one year in fall 1401 by education department security under pressure from security institutions. Founded 'Siavash Unit' for preventing destruction, fires and restoration of Zagros forests. Was held in solitary confinement under lengthy interrogations from 30 Dey until 4 days ago, then transferred to Dehdasht prison.

Being held in Lakan Rasht prison in a separate section. Family has not been allowed visits and no information is available about his physical and legal status. His social media accounts had previously been targeted for restrictions or blocking multiple times.
Killed by regime forces who shot at him and his wife from the Quran Mosque located on Ashouri Street. He was married to Mansooreh Heydari and they leave behind two young children

Citizen from Ilam city arrested on 19 Dey by security forces. During arrest, forced confessions were extracted under torture. Security forces have fabricated a heavy case for this civil activist based on charges related to moharebeh (enmity against God). There is a risk of death sentence being issued.
Shot in Tehran, buried in Mian Mahalleh Chaf - Langaroud. Listed in government records with 'Gabiyeh' suffix.

Teacher in lower Mashhad. Shot on the first night of July 9 (18th of Tir). Body was severely mutilated, head missing. Family searched for him until Saturday of the following week. Body was not found in Behesht-e Reza cemetery initially. His name was not among the prisoners. Body was eventually found among unidentified corpses brought from Behesht-e Razvan. Wife identified him by his socks and shoes. Sister was in such shock she refused to accept it was him and wouldn't allow burial for 3-4 days.

Director summoned separately to IRGC Intelligence Organization on Tuesday 30 Dey and interrogated for hours. The main focus of these summons was the recent statement by these filmmakers protesting violence and suppression of people.
Arrested at 4 AM with assault by 15 armed agents who raided his home. No contact allowed and whereabouts unknown after more than 43 hours.
Listed in Iran International memorial database as a victim
From Aman Magan village, under 20 years old, arrested after protests
Memorial ceremony (javidanam) held at Behesht-e Zahra cemetery

17-year-old from Fardis, Karaj who was injured during suppression of popular protests, transferred by government forces to Kachouei prison where he died overnight. Body was held at Kahrizak for five days before being released to family. Family was charged 700 million tomans as 'bullet costs' and forced to give heavy commitments under security pressure. Burial was restricted to a village around Hashtgerd.
Victim from Moallem Boulevard, Rasht
Used fire capsule against officers, died after arrest (martyred)

23-year-old medical student from Takestan who died during Iran's national uprising. She was killed as part of the systematic violence and suppression by the Islamic Republic regime against defenseless people. She represents a generation that could have saved lives and built Iran but was taken away due to the regime's violence and suppression.
From the Abdoli tribe. Described as being very isolated and alone, even his photo was difficult to find.
Arrested approximately one week before the report, family has no information about his detention location or condition.
Young protester arrested by intelligence forces on Thursday in Punak neighborhood. No information available about her whereabouts since arrest.
Memorialized victim from Shahrak Manzariyeh in Fardis, Karaj
Husband of the poster's sister, killed according to family statement
Sentenced to death by Islamic Republic. The tweet indicates he has no one to speak for him and calls for people to say his name in place of his family.

18-year-old orphaned youth under the care of Mazandaran Welfare Organization, arrested during the early days of protests. Death sentence issued and is being held in Tehran Grand Prison without any family support.
Child under welfare services protection, arrested in early protests, sentenced to death, currently held in Tehran's Grand Prison (Evin), has no family or support system
Arrested during protests in Bandar-e Anzali on Friday, detained in Lakan prison in Rasht. Brother of Yashar Ladeni who was arrested alongside him.
Listed in Iran International Memorial as protest victim
Listed as a victim in Iran International Memorial database

Shot in Haft Hoz area. Bullet entered his left side and exited from the right, destroying his internal organs. He died on the spot from direct gunshot. His body was left in a garden where his friends found him and brought him home. Family tried everything - applied pressure to wound, gave artificial respiration, performed heart massage - but he had died from internal bleeding. He was wearing a shirt that read 'A soldier for life'

Shot with a war bullet in his side in Shahinshahr. Friend took him to hospital but officials took him from the hospital. Family had no news of him for 8 days, then were told he had died. Body was returned to family after 12 days. His nose and jaw were broken, hair torn from the front of his head in such a way that his parents could barely identify him from other identifying marks. Family is under security pressure. Buried with only 15 people in Ahvaz city.
Arrested in Izeh on 18 Dey. Described as having no parents to speak for him or publicize his name. There are concerns about potential harm befalling him in custody.
Became immortalized at Se-Rah Simin in Isfahan
Detained in Arak during protests

Eldest son of Zahra Bani Amirian, survived being shot when Islamic Republic forces opened fire on their car during a peaceful protest in Karaj. His mother, father, and sibling were killed in the same incident.

Filmmaker and cinematographer who was violently arrested on Saturday, 20 Dey in Karaj by security forces. During arrest, agents severely beat him, causing serious injuries to his eyes and spine. He is currently held in Qezelhesar Prison with reports of deteriorating physical condition. His relatives state that due to the severity of his injuries and lack of proper medical care, his life is in danger.

Young worker, renter, father of three children. Went to Baharestan, Isfahan for work to earn honest living for better life. Was shot and killed. His body was buried at night in Izeh with security measures, as if they wanted to extinguish his name with darkness.
Arrested on Thursday 18 Dey in Sari, had his ribs broken during detention, family is left without information about his condition
Arrested on Thursday morning at 5-6 AM along with Seyyed Meysam Hosseini before any protest call was made. Forced confession extracted from him. Author expresses concern they may be executed.
Shot by government suppression forces during the current national revolution in Tehran

Older son of Bijan Mostafavi, was shot and injured when their personal car was raked with bullets by government forces. Extent of injuries unknown. Survived the attack that killed his parents and brother.
Older son of the Bani Amerian family. Was present in the car during the shooting and was hit by bullets but survived the attack that killed his mother, father, and sibling.
Victim from Shahreza, Isfahan province
Arrested in Punak some time ago, no news of him since arrest
Nurse at Sharif Hospital in Isfahan, kidnapped by anti-security forces during his work shift

Initially wounded and went to hospital on her own, but when family arrived they were told she wasn't there. Hours later her body was found with a gunshot wound to the head. Described as systematic disappearance, murder and cover-up against defenseless people.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial database

From Gilangarb, Kermanshah province. Arrested by government forces about 29 days ago and transferred to the women's ward of Kermanshah Central Prison. Severely beaten during arrest and suffered fractures to hands and feet. Being held in prison with broken limbs without independent medical care, which constitutes torture and crime against humanity.

From Armak village, owned an alphabetical stationery shop in Jarsoq Babol

Helicopter crash - all rescue helicopters sent to investigate the incident were grounded due to bad weather conditions. The exact location of the crash, casualty count, and cause of the incident are not yet determined.

Listed in Iran International Memorial for victims of Iranian protests
Victim of state violence, documented in Iran International Memorial

Citizen living in Gorgan, arrested by security forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran in recent days. Family sources say that since the arrest, there is no precise information about his place of detention and his physical and legal condition.

Killed in Isfahan. Body was buried in Chaghader village in Freidan, Isfahan. Family was not allowed to hold mourning ceremonies

Killed by suppressive forces of the Islamic Republic regime in Isfahan city. After his murder, his body was forcibly buried in Chaghader village in Fereydan, Isfahan province, and his family was denied permission to hold mourning ceremonies. This forced burial and prohibition of ceremonies is continuation of the regime's policy of suppression and erasing traces of crimes.

Shot and killed while filming the courage of protesters in Nazi Abad square. He was targeted from behind with a war bullet while his family was preparing balloons for his surprise 18th birthday party.
Wounded during the national uprising, described as one of the martyrs of the national uprising who had accompanied Mohammad Ebrahim Dadashi to the gathering.
24-year-old from Karaj. No specific details about death circumstances provided in the text.

17-year-old from Mashhad wounded on Haft Tir Street. First shot hit his side causing bleeding but he was still alive. When bodies were taken by truck to Behesht-e Reza cemetery in Mashhad, they saw the boy was still alive and shot him with a finishing shot to kill him.
Kurdish citizen arrested in cities of Oshnavieh or Kermanshah, whereabouts unknown
Killed by Ali Khamenei's forces from Khezr neighborhood of Hamedan (or Golpa neighborhood on Madani Boulevard according to some). Family was pressured to say he had a heart attack.

19-year-old worker at Tehran bazaar, arrested during bazaar strikes on 16 Dey 1404. Transferred to Qom prison where he is currently being held. Family has only been allowed one visit. Physical condition and legal charges against him remain unclear due to security conditions and severe restrictions on access to information.
Secretary of Islamic Student Association at Faculty of Dentistry, arrested by security forces on Sunday evening 21 Dey month and no news of his release since then

Clothes shop owner arrested in his home on 8 January 2026 for being connected with the protests in Fardis. He was denied a lawyer and his family was not notified of the charges brought against him. Several days later, Soltani was notified that he was to face execution on 14 January, less than a week after his arrest. Shortly before the execution date, Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi denied any plans to hang people, and Soltani's family was notified that his execution had been postponed

Arrested about 20 days ago in Majidieh area of Tehran along with one of his friends. Family has been unable to obtain any information about his location or condition despite repeated inquiries. About two weeks ago, he made his first phone call to his mother from Evin Prison. No official institution has taken responsibility for his arrest and no details about potential charges or his legal status are available. Family and relatives continue to be concerned about his health and safety.

From Brazjan (a city 20km from Bushehr), worked in ATM repair and had recently started working at Asaluyeh Petrochemical Complex. Government agents prevented him from building the simple life he wanted.
Victim documented in Iran International Memorial, died on Ashouri Street in Bushehr

Shot in the temple by regime forces after being hospitalized for several days at Imam Hospital in Robat Karim. His mother is a teacher and he has two sisters. The family is under severe pressure and threats not to mention his name anywhere.

Young man from Nahavand who was killed while trying to help an injured woman. First shot with hunting rifle, then targeted directly with military bullets while still attempting to help the wounded person. Buried in Firouzan, Nahavand.
Originally from Firouzan, Nahavand, killed by Islamic Republic terrorists in Parand. Described as a brave man who said 'do not retreat' in his final moments.

Shot with pellet gun to the temple alongside his wife by Islamic Republic terrorists at Parvaneh Square. Family was forced to delay burial and authorities withheld the body for several days.

Rock climbing champion and former national team member arrested on 12th of Dey and transferred to Tehran's Greater Prison (Evin). Remains in temporary detention with uncertain legal status. Political prisoner being held deliberately without clear legal proceedings as a pressure tactic by intelligence and security institutions in cooperation with the judicial system.

37-year-old killed in Isfahan. He was arrested and authorities said he was alive and told family not to follow up. When family went to identify, they found he had been shot in the stomach and died, meaning he was killed during detention.

Faculty member at Golestan University of Medical Sciences, arrested after protesting against suppressive forces who were shooting at protesters and wounded individuals in the hospital. Current detention location and physical/legal status unknown.

Kurdish citizen from Ilam Province arrested violently by security forces without judicial warrant between 27 Dey and 10 Bahman 1404. Being held in unknown location with no official information about status after more than 16 days of detention.

Killed in Rasht. Eyewitness account describes events on Thursday evening around 6-7 PM when people in dark clothes and masks came to Beiston Street in Rasht, with crowds growing and cars honking in solidarity, while most shops had been closed for 2-3 days prior.

Brother who provided shelter and medical care to wounded protesters during Iran's Sun and Lion Revolution. Betrayed by informants of the Islamic Republic on Friday 19 Dey, then arrested on 21 Dey when Ali Khamenei's thugs raided their home. Transferred to Dastgerd prison in Isfahan.

16-year-old student imprisoned. The tweet mentions they have gone to war against this 16-year-old student with prison because they know the aware generation is the end of tyranny.

18-year-old Baloch woman, disappeared for weeks in detention during Balochistan protests. Detained without charges, without contact, families have received no news for 22 days. Described as human elimination rather than detention.

17-year-old resident of Saveh who lived with her mother and two sisters. Kidnapped by security forces during Dey month protests. Family was kept in complete uncertainty for 6 days until the regime falsely claimed to her father in Ganaveh that 'your daughter had a heart attack', while her body was delivered with clear signs of torture and beatings. Family was forced to sign a silence agreement and threatened to have a quiet burial. During the funeral procession in Ganaveh, her mother held her daughter's wedding dress in her arms; women were wailing and the mother was spinning around with the wedding dress - a burning image of dreams extinguished by torture. She was killed under torture, not from a 'heart attack'.
Mother of Yasamin Hojati Qomi. Missing since January 11, 2026 along with her daughter. No further information available.

Shot with war bullet in Mehrshahr, Karaj. Lost his mother since childhood and his father had abandoned him. Had no one to publicize his case in media.

Killed in Shahin Shahr and buried in a nearby village called Chaleh Siah (official name Jehad Abad). He was single and had completely white hair like Zal Pahlavan.

Former political prisoner who was arrested on the evening of 19 Dey around 8 PM on one of the streets in Tabriz. His family was unaware of his arrest for four days until IRGC intelligence forces raided their home on 23 Dey. Since his arrest, no information has been provided about his detention location, physical and mental condition, charges, or the arresting authority. He had been summoned months earlier to serve sentences but had avoided appearing and begun living in hiding, not even visiting his own home to avoid arrest.
